title: De-risking wave energy technology development through transnational pre-commercial procurement of wave energy research and development
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development and demonstration of cost-effective wave energy converters capable of operating in harsh marine environments. Key research topics include improving the efficiency, reliability, and commercial viability of wave energy technologies, as well as assessing their environmental and socio-economic impacts throughout their lifecycle. The initiative aims to advance wave energy solutions to higher technology readiness levels (TRL 7/8) through collaborative pre-commercial procurement, facilitating large-scale deployment and market uptake in Europe.

title: Innovative approaches for the deployment of Positive Energy Districts
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing innovative approaches and solutions to enable positive energy districts (PEDs) that achieve a net positive energy balance and facilitate the export of excess renewable energy. This includes addressing technical, business, social, and organizational constraints related to climate mitigation, renewable energy integration, and community engagement. Proposals should emphasize the creation of supportive local planning frameworks, the demonstration of solutions in diverse districts, and the development of guidelines and training materials for professionals to enhance replicability and public acceptance of PEDs.

title: On-site innovative robotic and automated solutions and techniques for more sustainable and less disruptive building renovation and construction
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and validation of innovative on-site robotic and automated solutions for construction and renovation, with an emphasis on sustainability, resource efficiency, and reduced environmental impact. Proposals should explore techniques such as 3D printing, assess worker safety and human-robot collaboration, and test prototypes across various building types to ensure applicability to the European building stock. The aim is to achieve measurable improvements in construction efficiency, accuracy, and pollution reduction compared to current best practices.

title: Next generation distribution substation for increasing the system resilience
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the observability, monitoring, and control of electricity distribution grids through the integration of advanced technologies such as power electronics, intelligent electronic devices, and AI algorithms. Key research topics include real-time monitoring and analysis of grid conditions, the development of a flexible and programmable electricity distribution grid, and the establishment of a smart substation ecosystem that fosters collaboration among distribution system operators and technology providers. Projects should demonstrate best practices for building resilient and intelligent distribution substations capable of addressing disturbances and optimizing power routing.

title: Extending the lifetime of crystalline silicon PV modules (EUPI-PV Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the durability and reliability of photovoltaic (PV) energy systems, particularly high-efficiency crystalline silicon modules. This includes identifying defects and failure modes, developing cost-effective defect detection techniques (potentially using AI), and proposing mitigation strategies to extend module lifetimes. Additionally, the research aims to assess degradation rates through outdoor field experiments across various European climates to improve resource efficiency and reduce the levelized cost of electricity (LCOE).

title: Towards commercialisation of Perovskite PV and development of dedicated manufacturing equipment (EUPI-PV Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and commercialization of metal halide perovskite solar cells (PSCs), emphasizing strategies to enhance their optoelectronic properties, performance, and stability while minimizing environmental impact. Specific areas of interest include scaling up the deposition of high-quality perovskite films, developing robust encapsulation techniques to protect against environmental stressors, and addressing recyclability and toxic lead management in module designs. Additionally, proposals should assess performance and reliability against established photovoltaic standards and involve multidisciplinary collaborations with manufacturers.

title: New CO2 capture technologies
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development of innovative CO2 capture technologies, specifically targeting either point sources or direct air capture (DAC). Key research topics include enhancing absorption/adsorption processes, improving kinetics and energy efficiency, creating new materials with high CO2 selectivity, and addressing operational flexibility and scalability. Additionally, proposals must consider the minimization of health and environmental impacts, ensuring the captured CO2 meets transport and storage specifications, and maintaining performance under variable operating conditions.

title: Innovative pathways for low carbon and climate resilient building stock and built environment (Built4People Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing innovative building solutions that enhance the decarbonization, climate resilience, and sustainability of buildings and the built environment. Key research topics include creating scalable planning methods that integrate innovative building solutions, assessing whole life carbon performance, and ensuring stakeholder involvement across the construction value chain. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for tools that adapt buildings to changing user needs while promoting occupant comfort and health.

title: Improved reliability and optimised operations and maintenance for wind energy systems
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the reliability and efficiency of wind energy systems through various innovative approaches. Key research topics include developing solutions for operational and financial risk reduction, improving condition and health monitoring techniques, optimizing maintenance operations with advanced tools and digital technologies, and ensuring the safety and efficiency of maintenance activities. Emphasis is placed on the use of digitalization, predictive maintenance, and the creation of FAIR data to support the reliability of wind energy components and systems.

title: Smarter buildings as part of the energy system for increased efficiency and flexibility â€“ Societal Readiness Pilot
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the smartness of buildings through improved Building Management Systems (BMS/BEMS), integrating renewable energy sources (RES), and increasing grid flexibility. Proposals should aim to reduce energy demand, improve indoor environmental quality, and ensure user satisfaction while addressing the needs of diverse social groups. Additionally, the research should include pilot demonstrations across various climatic zones and building types, along with methodologies to measure energy efficiency and cost-effectiveness, incorporating social sciences expertise to address societal readiness.

title: Innovative tools and services to manage and empower energy communities
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the integration of home and building energy assets through IoT communication standards, facilitating local energy trading and enhancing market participation for citizens. The project aims to develop innovative open-source tools for managing energy community assets, optimize energy consumption and production using AI, and establish a cooperation platform for energy communities and grid operators. Additionally, it emphasizes the importance of security in data exchange, cross-sectoral synergies, and the involvement of social sciences and humanities to enhance the societal impact of energy transition initiatives.

title: Innovative solutions for a generative AI-powered digital spine of the EU energy system
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development and implementation of generative AI tools to enhance the digital and green transformation of the energy sector. Key research topics include local grid optimization, integration of renewable energy sources, and the creation of smart demand-side management tools for consumers and industries. The initiative aims to improve energy system reliability, efficiency, and resilience through advanced AI technologies, while promoting interoperability and data exchange across various sectors, including transport and residential heating.

title: Understand and minimise the environmental impacts of offshore wind energy
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing understanding of the cumulative environmental impacts of offshore wind energy deployment, emphasizing the need for comprehensive monitoring and assessment tools that consider multiple pressures on marine ecosystems. Key research topics include expanding field studies to larger areas, improving environmental risk assessment models, and developing strategies to mitigate negative impacts while promoting sustainable offshore wind energy practices. Additionally, the call highlights the importance of ensuring data produced is FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Re-usable) and encourages collaboration with existing European initiatives and projects.

title: Phase out fossil fuel in energy intensive industries through the efficient integration of renewable energy sources
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing innovative solutions for the local integration of renewable energy sources in industrial processes, specifically targeting significant heating demands. The aim is to enhance energy efficiency, reduce fossil fuel consumption and greenhouse gas emissions, and ensure high reliability and safety in industrial operations. Additionally, the proposals should explore process flexibility, energy storage, and the potential for collaboration with neighboring industries to optimize energy and resource sharing.

title: Competitiveness, energy security and integration aspects of advanced biofuels and renewable fuels of non-biological origin value chains
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing energy security and industrial competitiveness in the EU through advanced biofuels and renewable fuels of non-biological origin. Projects should assess and optimize value chains, evaluate their contributions to EU energy goals, and address integration challenges among stakeholders. Additionally, multidisciplinary issues such as carbon removals, sustainable farming practices, and the development of new standards for these fuels are to be explored, with an emphasis on sustainability assessments through life cycle analysis.

title: Development of innovative solutions strengthening the security of renewable energy value chains
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the energy security of Europe through research and innovation in renewable energy technology value chains. Key research topics include sustainability and social awareness in hydropower or bioenergy, skills development for innovation in renewable energy, and addressing complexities in grid-based renewable fuels and direct solar fuels. Proposals should aim to develop solutions that improve these critical aspects, ultimately strengthening the European clean energy system.

title: Optimal combination of low embodied carbon construction products, technical building systems and circularity principles for climate neutral buildings (Built4People Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on reducing whole life carbon emissions in buildings through innovative construction and renovation practices that integrate circular economy principles. This includes developing optimal combinations of construction products and systems that minimize lifecycle environmental impacts, enhancing adaptive reuse strategies, and validating these solutions across diverse climatic conditions. Additionally, the proposals should address the cost-effectiveness of these solutions and contribute to European standards and benchmarking efforts related to whole life carbon emissions.

title: Underground Thermal Energy Storage in dense urban areas
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and optimization of Underground Thermal Energy Storage (UTES) systems, including Aquifer Thermal Energy Storage (ATES), Closed-Loop Thermal Energy Storage (CTES), and Borehole Thermal Energy Storage (BTES) in urban environments. Emphasis is placed on integrating these technologies with existing energy grids, addressing seasonal energy demand uncertainties, and utilizing geothermal resources effectively while ensuring community engagement and addressing social challenges. Additionally, the research aims to enhance the sustainability and efficiency of subsurface space use, develop monitoring systems, and create open datasets to support the advancement of thermal storage technologies in densely populated areas.

title: Demonstration of thermal energy storage solutions for solar thermal plants and systems
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the demonstration of innovative thermal energy storage solutions, specifically in concentrated solar power (CSP) and solar thermal heat and cold. Key research topics include improving performance, cost-effectiveness, and lifespan of these technologies, as well as assessing their sustainability in environmental and socio-economic terms. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of developing a clear pathway for commercialization and scalability of the proposed solutions.

title: Large-scale production of liquid advanced biofuels and renewable fuels of non-biological origin
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the large-scale production and demonstration of advanced biofuels and renewable fuels of non-biological origin, particularly for sectors like aviation, shipping, and energy-intensive industries. Key research topics include the utilization of sustainable biomass feedstocks, the development of innovative production technologies, and the assessment of economic viability and environmental impacts through life-cycle analysis. Projects should aim to establish full-scale plants, optimize feedstock processing, and create robust business cases for commercialization and scalability.

title: Scaling up deep tech ecosystems
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing deep tech ecosystems through pan-European research infrastructures, fostering collaboration between academia and industry, particularly SMEs, to drive innovation and competitiveness. The initiative aims to identify and develop breakthrough deep tech innovations, assess their feasibility for industrial implementation, and support pilot projects across various technological areas to maximize their market and societal impact. Additionally, it emphasizes the importance of valorizing past investments in research infrastructures and promoting innovation training and education.

title: European network of national competence centers for innovation procurement
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the capacity of public procurers in Europe to implement pre-commercial procurement (PCP) and public procurement of innovative solutions (PPI). Key research topics include the establishment and expansion of national competence centers for innovation procurement, fostering cooperation among public procurers, and promoting awareness of innovation procurement opportunities among startups and SMEs. The initiative aims to create a European network of competence centers to facilitate knowledge sharing, policy development, and the diffusion of innovative solutions across EU Member States and Associated Countries.

title: Expanding Investment Ecosystems
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing cross-border venture investments and supporting the growth of startups from less developed innovation ecosystems ('emerging' and 'moderate') by connecting them with foreign investors from more developed regions ('strong' and 'innovation leaders'). The initiative aims to improve awareness and access to local deals, provide knowledge on regulatory frameworks, and facilitate market entry for startups, particularly addressing challenges in sectors such as energy, food security, digital transformation, healthcare, and circularity. Activities include market orientation programs, investor assistance, networking events, and the establishment of best practice repositories to foster collaboration and investment in underserved markets.

title: Boosting the transformation towards climate-neutral cities, the net-zero economy and open strategic autonomy through Pre-Commercial Procurement (PCP)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on innovative solutions for reducing greenhouse gas emissions, particularly through public procurement processes that stimulate market readiness and competitiveness in sectors like energy efficiency, renewable energy, and sustainable mobility. It emphasizes the role of public procurers, especially local authorities, in driving demand for these solutions, fostering collaboration among cities, and enhancing the involvement of SMEs and startups in the development and commercialization of net-zero technologies. The initiative aims to create climate-neutral cities by 2030 and 2050, leveraging pre-commercial procurement (PCP) to bridge the gap between supply and demand while ensuring sustainability and resilience in urban environments.

title: Breakthrough innovations for future mobility
Innovative in-space servicing, operations, space-based robotics and technologies for resilient EU space infrastructure
Biotechnology driven low emission food production systems
EIC Accelerator Open 2025
GenAI4EU: Creating European Champions in Generative AI
Acceleration of advanced materials development and upscaling along the value chain
Integrating inland waterway transport in smart shipping and multimodal logistics chains
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the integration of inland waterway transport (IWT) into multimodal logistics chains to improve operational efficiency and environmental impact. Key research topics include the development of smart vessels and infrastructure, digital interconnectivity for data sharing, and the testing of innovative solutions in demonstration pilots. Additionally, the call emphasizes stakeholder collaboration, regulatory recommendations for smart shipping, and the assessment of economic, environmental, and social benefits associated with increased IWT usage.

title: Innovative construction and maintenance, with the use of new materials and techniques, for resilient and sustainable transport infrastructure
summary_text: The research topics focus on developing sustainable and resilient transport infrastructure solutions that utilize at least 50% recycled materials, reduce emissions by 30%, and enhance biodiversity. Key areas include innovative construction methods, life cycle assessments, cost-benefit analyses, and the application of eco-friendly materials. Additionally, the projects aim to establish EU standards for construction and procurement processes, ensuring climate resilience and minimal environmental impact throughout the infrastructure's life cycle.

title: Development of sustainable and design-to-cost batteries with (energy-)efficient manufacturing processes and based on advanced and safer materials (Batt4EU Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development of next-generation low-cost batteries aimed at enhancing electric mobility and reducing reliance on critical raw materials. Key research topics include the design and production of liquid electrolyte lithium-ion batteries (using LMFP or HLM cathodes) and sodium-ion batteries, with specific targets for energy density, cycle life, and charging times. Additionally, projects should address advanced production processes, design-for-circularity strategies, and the feasibility of recycling and material safety in alignment with the European Partnership on Batteries.

title: Safety of Cyclists, Pedestrians and Users of Micromobility Devices
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing road safety for pedestrians, cyclists, and users of micromobility devices (e.g., e-bikes, e-scooters) through improved infrastructure, safety measures, and standardization of reporting practices. The research aims to analyze the safety risks associated with the increasing use of these modes, assess the impact of road design and technology on safety, and develop guidelines for integrating micromobility into urban mobility plans. Additionally, there is an emphasis on addressing the needs of vulnerable user groups and fostering collaboration with existing road safety initiatives.

title: Accelerated multi-physical and virtual testing for battery aging, reliability, and safety evaluation (Batt4EU Partnership)
summary_text: The research topics focus on accelerating the development and testing of battery systems, particularly for electric vehicles, by minimizing experimental efforts through advanced multi-physical and virtual testing strategies. Key areas include understanding the impact of operational loads and failure modes on battery reliability and safety, developing novel testing methodologies, and integrating AI to enhance testing efficiency. Additionally, the proposals should aim to establish standards for battery safety classification and explore synergies across different battery chemistries and applications.

title: Reliable data and practices to measure and calculate transport emissions in multimodal transport chains
summary_text: The research topics focus on the measurement, calculation, and reporting of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions in the transport sector, particularly in relation to new EU regulations such as CountEmissions EU, FuelEU Maritime, and ReFuelEU Aviation. Key areas include developing methodologies for accurately quantifying emissions from various transport-related activities, addressing gaps in current emissions accounting, and integrating new technologies to enhance data collection and reporting. The initiative aims to establish a comprehensive scientific framework to support effective emission reduction strategies and align EU policy with market practices.

title: Real time monitoring of regulated and non-regulated emissions from all types of vessels and other port activities in order to enforce emission limits in waterfront cities
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing and demonstrating advanced monitoring techniques for real-time measurement of various pollutants from maritime activities, particularly in port and coastal environments. Key research topics include the creation of harmonized methods for measuring real sailing emissions, the identification of harmful substances from both vessels and port operations, and the establishment of automatic reporting systems to ensure compliance with environmental regulations. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for innovative technologies to assess emissions from new alternative fuels and to improve certification and testing methods to reflect real-world conditions.

title: Approaches, verification and training for Edge-AI building blocks for CCAM Systems (CCAM Partnership)
summary_text: The research topics focus on the development of connected, cooperative, and automated mobility (CCAM) solutions that leverage edge-AI technologies to enhance performance in terms of power consumption, latency, speed, and accuracy. Key areas include optimizing AI algorithms for edge-specific hardware, ensuring safety and security in data-driven functionalities, and creating efficient models for real-time perception, decision-making, and actuation in automated driving applications. Additionally, the research emphasizes the importance of compliance with ethical standards and data protection regulations while fostering international collaboration to advance these technologies.

title: Icing in the context of sustainable aviation
summary_text: The research topics focus on aircraft icing, particularly in relation to safety and efficiency in the context of climate change and the development of low carbon aviation technologies. Key areas include the development of compliance means for certification of icing systems, assessment of climate change impacts on icing environments, and innovation in ice detection and protection technologies. Specific research initiatives involve creating reliable numerical tools, enhancing testing capabilities for supercooled large droplets, and improving ice protection systems through smart monitoring and new materials.

title: Predicting and avoiding road crashes based on Artificial Intelligence (AI) and big data
summary_text: The research topics focus on proactive road safety management through the development of an AI-enabled digital twin of traffic and infrastructure, which integrates diverse data sources to predict safety-critical situations and optimize traffic flow. Key areas include the analysis of big data acquisition and integration challenges, the creation of bias-free predictive models for crash risk, and the exploration of ethical and legal issues related to data sharing. Additionally, the research aims to identify real-time countermeasures for reducing risk and to establish interoperability standards for data sharing among stakeholders.

title: Next-generation environment perception for real world CCAM operations: Error-free and secure technologies to improve energy-efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and circularity (CCAM Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing next-generation vehicle and infrastructure-based environment perception technologies for connected, cooperative, and automated mobility (CCAM). Key research topics include enhancing the safety and reliability of automated systems through improved environmental perception, decision-making, and energy efficiency, while also addressing scalability, modularity, and standardization of technologies. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of integrating societal, ethical, and legal considerations into the development of these technologies, as well as fostering international collaboration to learn from global practices in automated mobility.

title: Monitoring and Evaluation of the Societal Readiness Pilot
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing Societal Readiness (SR) in research and innovation (R&I) projects, particularly within the domains of Climate, Energy, and Mobility. Key research topics include analyzing the integration of SR in pilot projects, fostering interdisciplinary collaboration between STEM and SSH partners, and developing effective methodologies for stakeholder engagement. The initiative aims to create a public web platform for sharing best practices and recommendations, ultimately improving the implementation of SR in future EU-funded projects.

title: Accelerating freight transport and logistics digital innovation
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the functionalities of electronic Freight Transport Information (eFTI) platforms to support new business-to-business (B2B) and business-to-authority (B2A) use cases in multimodal logistics. This includes developing technical solutions for data sharing, improving interoperability, and facilitating the adoption of digital tools by SMEs, while addressing regulatory compliance, data privacy, and cybersecurity. Additionally, the proposals should explore best practices for reducing administrative burdens and costs associated with data sharing in freight transport, and assess synergies with existing EU frameworks related to sustainability and emissions reporting.

title: Integration of human driving behaviour in the validation of CCAM systems (CCAM Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing validated human behavioral models that accurately represent a wide range of driving behaviors in safety-critical scenarios for Connected, Cooperative, and Automated Mobility (CCAM) systems. This includes the design and validation of CCAM systems to exhibit safe, human-like driving behavior that can be anticipated by all road users, as well as the integration of these models into virtual safety validation processes. Additionally, the research aims to capture and analyze the variability in human driving behavior influenced by various factors, ensuring robust calibration and parameterization for diverse traffic conditions and demographics.

title: Integrating advanced materials, cell design and manufacturing development for high-performance batteries aimed at mobility (Batt4EU Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing the transition from liquid electrolyte lithium-ion batteries to high-performance solid-state batteries, emphasizing the development of quasi-solid and all-solid-state technologies. Key research topics include optimizing manufacturing processes for enhanced production yield, quality, and sustainability, as well as integrating advanced materials and cell designs to maximize efficiency. Additionally, projects are encouraged to implement digital technologies and data analytics to improve process control and decision-making in battery production.

title: Federated CCAM data exchange platform (CCAM Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing data sharing and integration for Connected, Cooperative, and Automated Mobility (CCAM) through the establishment of a Federated CCAM Data Exchange Platform. Key research topics include identifying limitations in current data exchange solutions, mapping information needs for key performance indicators (KPIs), and developing harmonized ontologies and standards for data formats. The initiative aims to facilitate the sharing of mobility and research data, support the development of digital twins, and ensure compliance with regulatory frameworks, while promoting interoperability with existing European data spaces.

title: Community Centres of Excellence
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing high-performance computing (HPC) and artificial intelligence (AI) applications by developing and optimizing software codes for exascale and post-exascale performance. Key research topics include identifying targeted applications and user communities, enhancing application scalability and energy efficiency, addressing technical challenges in HPC/AI, and fostering collaboration across European scientific and industrial sectors. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of training and capacity building to bridge the skills gap and ensure inclusive access to HPC/AI resources.

title: Transversal Centres of Excellence
summary_text: The grant call focuses on establishing Transversal Centres of Excellence (CoEs) to enhance the European high-performance computing (HPC) and artificial intelligence (AI) ecosystem. Key research topics include application profiling and performance optimization, application deployment and delivery, data processing and interoperability, resilience and fault tolerance, and energy-efficient computing. The initiative aims to provide technical support, training, and collaboration opportunities for HPC application developers, fostering the integration of AI technologies and improving the overall efficiency and sustainability of HPC applications across various scientific and industrial domains.

title: Lighthouse Codes for HPC Applications
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development and optimization of "Lighthouse Codes" for high-performance computing (HPC) applications, aiming to enhance Europe's competitiveness in scientific and industrial domains. Key research topics include code development and optimization, feature enhancement, architecture adaptation for new HPC platforms, and readiness for exascale and AI capabilities. The initiative emphasizes collaboration among researchers, industry, and HPC experts to create sustainable, high-quality software that addresses significant scientific challenges and promotes innovation across various sectors.

title: Low power Edge AI Chips
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development of AI chip prototypes that integrate advanced technologies such as non-volatile memories, neuromorphic computing, and photonic connectivity, aiming for TRL 6-7. The prototypes should demonstrate robust AI capabilities, including real-time inference and on-device learning, while achieving ultra-low power consumption for energy-efficient operations in edge environments. Applications are expected in mobile communication networks, autonomous systems, industrial automation, and healthcare, contributing to Europe's digital transformation and sustainability goals.

title: Space Data Economy
summary_text: This grant call focuses on enhancing the use of EU space data across various sectors by addressing demand fragmentation and promoting the commercialization of innovative space-based solutions. Key research topics include the development of applications for renewable energy and energy efficiency, climate adaptation and environmental footprint reduction, green financing and insurance, and the modernization of urban environments to create more livable cities. Proposals should leverage space technologies to support informed decision-making, improve resilience, and foster sustainability in these priority areas.

title: Innovative space-based applications enhancing capabilities for a resilient Europe
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development and validation of integrated space technologies, particularly EGNSS and Earth observation services, to enhance the operational capabilities of crisis and security practitioners. Key research topics include creating spoofing-proof EGNSS solutions for law enforcement and critical infrastructure, improving crisis management operations through innovative technologies like drones and AR/VR, and addressing cybersecurity threats. Proposals should emphasize commercial viability, user needs, and integration with other EU Space Programme components, while also identifying and bridging capability gaps in security operations.

title: ERC CONSOLIDATOR GRANTS
summary_text: The ERC Consolidator Grant focuses on supporting Principal Investigators who are establishing their independent research teams or programs, demonstrating research independence. Key research topics may span various scientific fields, as the grant encourages innovative and high-quality research proposals that contribute to advancing knowledge and addressing significant challenges in their respective areas.

title: DIGITAL & AUTOMATIC UP TO AUTOMATED TRAIN OPERATIONS
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing next-generation Automatic Train Control (ATC) technologies, emphasizing automation for various train types, including passenger, freight, and urban light rail. Key research topics include the development of modular and interoperable ATC systems, enhanced train detection and positioning technologies, automated driving solutions, and improved communication platforms. The initiative aims to demonstrate operational solutions that enhance performance, safety, and cost-effectiveness while ensuring compatibility with existing infrastructure and addressing complex operational scenarios across Europe.

title: SUSTAINABLE COMPETITIVE DIGITAL GREEN RAIL FREIGHT SERVICES
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing European rail freight operations through two main workstreams: the development of full digital freight train operations enabled by Digital Automatic Coupling (DAC) and the creation of seamless intermodal freight transport solutions. Key research topics include the development of automated systems for train composition, braking, and inspection, as well as the integration of digital management systems for cross-border freight operations and yard automation. Additionally, the project aims to enhance multimodal transport planning and data interoperability to improve efficiency and responsiveness in freight services.

title: A SUSTAINABLE AND GREEN RAIL SYSTEM
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing the sustainability and resilience of the rail system through innovative energy solutions, including the development of high-performance battery electric multi-unit trains and hydrogen hybrid trains. It emphasizes a holistic approach to energy management, integrating renewable energy sources and smart grid technologies, while also addressing the circular economy in railway infrastructure and rolling stock. Key areas of research include improving air quality and safety in rail environments, enhancing modularity and accessibility in rolling stock design, and developing technologies to reduce noise and vibrations, all aimed at achieving significant environmental and operational improvements by 2028.

title: NETWORK MANAGEMENT PLANNING AND CONTROL & MOBILITY MANAGEMENT IN A MULTIMODAL ENVIRONMENT AND DIGITAL ENABLERS
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing rail network management through two main work streams: improving strategic and tactical planning of the rail network and increasing the resilience of a connected real-time rail network. Key research topics include the development of innovative planning and simulation functionalities, real-time traffic management systems, integration of digital twins for operational processes, and the establishment of federated data spaces for data sharing and interoperability across rail systems. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of automation, decision support systems, and improved accessibility for passengers, particularly those with reduced mobility, in creating a seamless door-to-door mobility experience.

title: STUDIES ON RAIL INDUSTRY 5.0
summary_text: The research focuses on the implementation of Industry 5.0 principles in the European rail sector, emphasizing sustainability, human-centric approaches, and resilience. Key topics include identifying challenges and drivers for adoption, stakeholder engagement, public policy roles, and success factors such as competitiveness and climate goals. Additionally, the study aims to develop a framework for measuring progress in safety, reliability, and efficiency, along with recommendations for pilot projects that demonstrate these principles in action.

title: STUDIES ON INNOVATION IN CLIMATE FINANCE FOR RAIL
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the sustainability and decarbonization of the railway sector in alignment with the EU's Green Deal goals. This includes exploring financing mechanisms such as green bonds and carbon credits, developing standardized methodologies for measuring greenhouse gas reductions, and providing actionable recommendations for improving access to climate finance for rail projects. Additionally, the research aims to identify barriers and opportunities for investment in low-carbon rail infrastructure and operations, while also addressing the integration of climate-related considerations into corporate strategies.

title: REGIONAL RAIL SERVICES / INNOVATIVE RAIL SERVICES TO REVITALISE CAPILLARY LINES
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing regional rail solutions through system architecture, control command and signaling (CCS), operations, rail infrastructure, and customer services. Key research topics include the development of cost-efficient, energy self-sufficient infrastructure components, integrated operations control centers, and multimodal passenger service information systems. The project aims to demonstrate scalable solutions for regional lines, enhance traffic management systems, and improve customer experience through innovative technologies and operational strategies.

title: SUPPORT TO THE EUROPEAN FRMCS DEPLOYMENT GROUP
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the deployment of the Future Railway Mobile Communication System (FRMCS) as a replacement for the aging GSM-R telecommunications system. This includes analyzing current infrastructure and capacity for deployment, developing cost analyses and risk assessments, and creating practical guidelines for transitioning to FRMCS. Additionally, the initiative emphasizes stakeholder cooperation, knowledge sharing, and the establishment of a European Deployment Dashboard to monitor progress and readiness across Member States.

title: INTELLIGENT & INTEGRATED ASSET MANAGEMENT
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing rail system capabilities through five key research areas: 1) Information sharing across the supply chain and Traffic Management Systems (TMS) to enhance data integration and security; 2) Unmanned and non-invasive monitoring and inspections to improve automated asset diagnostics; 3) Advanced and holistic asset decision-making utilizing Digital Twins and AI for optimized lifecycle management; 4) Innovative design and certification processes for rail assets, including additive manufacturing; and 5) Development of remotely controlled and unmanned interventions to enhance operational efficiency and safety in rail systems.

title: EXTENDING THE RAIL NETWORK OF PHDS
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing research in the railway sector through the establishment of PhD positions in two key areas: low-height noise reduction barriers and smart grids/micro smart grids in railway systems. The first topic aims to explore innovative noise reduction techniques, sustainable materials, and cost-benefit analyses for low-height barriers, while the second topic investigates the integration of renewable energy sources and energy management technologies to enhance the efficiency and sustainability of railway power supply systems. Both areas emphasize collaboration with industry and contributions to the Europeâ€™s Rail Programme.

title: ERC 2026 PERA
summary_text: The ERC Public Engagement with Research Award focuses on recognizing and rewarding outstanding science communication efforts by Principal Investigators who engage the public with ERC-funded research. Key research topics include citizen science initiatives, public outreach activities that promote discussion and awareness of research topics, and fostering consultation with citizen groups to address societal challenges and contribute to public debates.

title: Quantum Grand Challenge
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing a comprehensive technical and financial roadmap for quantum computing solutions, emphasizing the integration of hardware and software components. Key research topics include performance benchmarking at various levels (component, system, and application), error mitigation methods, and the demonstration of prototypes that showcase the feasibility of quantum computing in real-world applications. The objective is to transition from early prototypes to scalable, market-ready platforms that deliver quantifiable improvements in specific industrial and societal use cases.

title: EIC Accelerator 2026 - Short proposal
summary_text: The EIC Accelerator focuses on supporting high-impact innovations, particularly in the realm of 'deep tech' that stem from scientific discoveries or technological breakthroughs. It aims to assist companies, especially SMEs and start-ups, in scaling up these innovations by providing funding and business acceleration services, particularly for technologies that have reached at least Technology Readiness Level 5 and require significant investment over a longer timeframe. The program encourages proposals in any field of technology through its Open category, as well as in predefined areas of emerging and strategic technologies through its Challenges category.

title: EIC STEP Scale Up
summary_text: The EIC STEP Scale Up call focuses on supporting ambitious scale-up companies, particularly SMEs and small mid-caps, that are developing game-changing innovations in critical technology areas such as semiconductor and quantum technologies. The initiative aims to fill funding gaps for high-risk innovations, facilitating significant investments to accelerate the development and market launch of these technologies while strengthening their value chains within the EU. Additionally, the call is part of the Strategic Technologies for Europe Platform (STEP), which aims to enhance the competitiveness and sustainability of European technology sectors.

title: Accelerating Physical AI: Embodied Intelligence for the Next Frontier of AI-Powered Robotics
summary_text: This Challenge focuses on the development of disruptive Physical AI innovations that enhance autonomous operation in complex environments, emphasizing intelligent perception, adaptive learning, autonomous decision-making, and human-AI collaboration. Key application areas include disaster response, autonomous scientific labs, and personal or professional robotic assistants, all while adhering to principles of Responsible AI, including transparency, accountability, and ethical alignment. The initiative aims to strengthen European technological sovereignty and competitiveness by fostering scalable prototypes and real-world testing of AI-powered robotic systems.

title: Translating Disruptive New Approach Methodologies (NAMs) into Practice
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development and validation of New Approach Methodologies (NAMs) for biomedical applications, specifically targeting preclinical research and the testing of medicinal products and medical technologies. Key areas of interest include the use of human organoids, microphysiological systems, AI-enhanced predictive models, and advanced human tissue models to replace, reduce, or refine animal testing. The initiative aims to foster regulatory innovation and provide a standardized assessment toolkit to enhance the adoption of these methodologies in the health sector.

title: Strengthening skills and capacity for the deployment of EU Missions
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the capacity of local authorities to effectively engage with EU Missions by identifying skills gaps and promoting innovative solutions. Key research topics include conducting skills inventory and gap analyses, developing training programs, and fostering collaboration through peer-learning networks to empower local authorities in deploying innovative solutions and mobilizing resources for mission-related activities.

title: Understanding and overcoming barriers to the scale-up of innovations supporting EU Missions
summary_text: This grant call focuses on identifying and addressing barriers to the scaling and deployment of both technological and non-technological innovations that support the five EU Missions. Key research topics include the analysis of risk perception and management strategies among diverse stakeholder groups, as well as socio-technical, economic, cultural, and regulatory challenges that hinder innovation scalability. The call encourages interdisciplinary projects that explore these barriers and their impact on mission objectives, emphasizing the importance of integrating insights from Social Sciences and Humanities.

title: Advancing lead markets and proof-of-concept for deep tech solutions contributing to EU Missions
summary_text: The grant call focuses on accelerating the scaling and deployment of innovative technologies relevant to EU Missions, particularly through the development of proof-of-concept for deep tech solutions. It aims to create lead markets by fostering collaboration between public and private stakeholders, addressing barriers to market uptake, and experimenting with innovative procurement and financing models. Proposals should ideally encompass multiple missions and leverage insights from social sciences and humanities to enhance stakeholder engagement and investment in high-impact technologies.

title: Supporting All-Atlantic Ocean Research and Innovation Alliance
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing marine and maritime research and innovation in the Atlantic Ocean, emphasizing collaboration among stakeholders from both the North and South Atlantic. Key research topics include increasing the resilience of coastal communities, promoting sustainable management of ocean resources, and fostering intergenerational cooperation through knowledge transfer and engagement across diverse sectors and cultures. Proposals should support the All-Atlantic Intergenerational Programme, strengthen ocean science diplomacy, and facilitate partnerships to address ocean and coastal challenges effectively.

title: Coordinated European contribution to the WMO Global Greenhouse Gas Watch and its international governance
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the EU's capabilities in global greenhouse gas (GHG) monitoring and reporting, particularly in support of the Paris Agreement. Key research topics include the development of innovative digital solutions for GHG monitoring, the integration of various observational systems and data sources, and the creation of new GHG data products at multiple scales. Additionally, the initiative emphasizes international cooperation, data sharing, and the operationalization of GHG monitoring services to support effective climate policy implementation and visibility of EU climate actions globally.

title: Interconnect Earth Observation research for addressing environmental policies
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing Earth Observation (EO) research to support European environmental policies, particularly those related to biodiversity, and to contribute to the European Green Deal. Key research topics include the development of a structured EuroGEO community, the creation of an Earth Observation Science Service to integrate EO science into policymaking, and the establishment of a research and innovation roadmap for Earth observation. Proposals should aim to foster collaboration among EO stakeholders, address cross-cutting policy issues, and demonstrate innovative applications of Earth intelligence to meet policy needs.

title: Empowering the UN Decade of Ocean Science for Sustainable Development
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing ocean science to support sustainable management and health of the ocean, aligning with the United Nations Decade of Ocean Science for Sustainable Development. Key research topics include addressing marine pollution, protecting and restoring ecosystems and biodiversity, enhancing community resilience to ocean risks, expanding the Global Ocean Observing System, and fostering skills and participation in ocean science. Proposals should emphasize international cooperation and long-term sustainability of initiatives developed during the Decade.

title: A services and business incubator for geospatial open-source developments
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the sustainability and competitiveness of the European open-source geospatial software ecosystem, particularly in climate services, environmental monitoring, and biodiversity analytics. Key research topics include establishing a business incubation hub for geospatial open-source projects, analyzing market demands for these software solutions, and developing tailored business strategies to support high-technology readiness level projects. The initiative aims to foster innovation, entrepreneurship, and long-term economic sustainability within the open-source geospatial community.

title: Improving analytical capacity and understanding of social drivers in agriculture to better assess social sustainability in the sector
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the social sustainability of the agricultural sector by addressing knowledge gaps in data and indicators related to social dimensions, such as employment, health, and inclusiveness. It emphasizes the need for improved analytical tools and methodologies to assess social impacts and develop evidence-based policies that support a just transition in agriculture. Proposals should integrate interdisciplinary approaches, particularly from social sciences, to foster better understanding and implementation of social sustainability principles in agricultural practices across various scales.

title: Additional activities for the Sustainable Blue Economy Partnership (SBEP)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing the Sustainable Blue Economy Partnership (SBEP) to support a climate-neutral, sustainable, and productive blue economy. Key research topics include ocean health, digital twins, and citizen well-being, with an emphasis on fostering collaboration across EU and national levels, promoting Blue Economy innovations, and enhancing the European Ocean Observing System (EOOS). The initiative aims to integrate scientific knowledge into regulatory frameworks, support inclusive governance, and leverage cutting-edge technologies to facilitate a just transition to a regenerative and circular blue economy.

title: Boosting data availability and AI solutions in food for consumers and food service professionals
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing generative AI solutions to enhance the productivity, sustainability, and dietary health of food purchasing, preservation, and preparation processes for consumers and food service professionals. Emphasis is placed on creating high-quality digital datasets, ensuring data sovereignty, and promoting effective data sharing across the food system. Proposals should engage a wide range of stakeholders and incorporate social sciences to ensure practical and widely adopted solutions that address climate change and improve food systems.

title: Increasing knowledge flows to practice within AKIS via EU thematic knowledge hubs
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the competitiveness, sustainability, and resilience of agriculture, forestry, and rural areas through the establishment of EU thematic knowledge hubs. These hubs aim to disseminate practical knowledge and innovative solutions by integrating advisors into Agricultural Knowledge and Innovation Systems (AKIS) and facilitating collaboration among researchers, advisors, and end-users. Proposals should address either the competitiveness of protein crops or sustainable water management under climate change, emphasizing the need for tailored, accessible information and effective networking among AKIS actors.

title: Embracing innovation in agriculture by peer-to-peer learning via on farm-demonstrations and cost-benefit analysis
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing peer-to-peer learning and the uptake of innovative agricultural solutions across the EU, specifically in crop production systems and livestock/mixed production systems. Key research topics include developing benchmarking criteria for agricultural innovations, assessing their economic, environmental, and social impacts, and conducting on-farm demonstrations to validate and showcase these innovations. The proposals should emphasize collaboration among diverse stakeholders, including farmers, advisors, and startups, while also integrating social sciences to support the transition of innovations into practice.

title: New or enhanced Innovative Advanced Materials (IAM) enabled sensing functionality (RIA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development of innovative IAM-enabled multifunctional surfaces and enhanced IAM-based sensor demonstrators. Key research topics include the creation of surfaces that can detect environmental changes and pollutants with high sensitivity and durability, as well as the miniaturization and integration of sensors into portable devices with low power consumption and high performance. Proposals should also consider aspects of circularity, recyclability, and compliance with sustainable design principles to facilitate market adoption and industrial relevance.

title: Next-Generation AI Agents for Real-World Applications in the Apply AI sectors (RIA) (Partnership in AI, Data and Robotics)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing next-generation AI agents, emphasizing improvements in autonomy, robustness, and reliability through enhanced planning, memory management, and reasoning capabilities. Key research topics include the development of innovative multi-agent frameworks for decentralized collaboration, memory-augmented AI for long-term reasoning, and multimodal reasoning capabilities for real-world applications. Proposals should also explore self-planning and self-optimization in AI agents, as well as the integration of external tools to enhance performance in complex tasks.

title: Apply AI: Next-Generation Agile and Intelligent Robotics Platforms for Industrial and Service Applications (Partnership in AI, Data and Robotics) (RIA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development of next-generation AI-powered robotic systems that are agile, modular, and capable of operating in dynamic, unstructured environments. Key research topics include novel design techniques, advanced materials, and innovative control methods to enhance robot autonomy, mobility, and human-robot interaction. Emphasis is placed on creating flexible, safe, and easily reconfigurable robotic platforms that can be integrated into existing industrial and service workflows, addressing high-impact needs in strategic sectors while ensuring scalability and commercial viability.

title: Introducing circular economy models in the construction sector, from buildings to city scale
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing circular economy principles within the construction sector at building, district, and city levels. Key research topics include the development of tools and solutions for urban mining, reuse and recycling of construction materials, and the creation of business models that facilitate these practices. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for whole life-cycle GHG emissions inventories, the integration of various stakeholders, and the demonstration of proposed solutions in multiple cities to promote large-scale cross-border reuse of construction materials.

title: Energy efficient urban and sub-urban public transport, complemented by shared mobility
summary_text: This grant call focuses on enhancing the energy efficiency and attractiveness of urban and suburban public transport systems, urban mobility service car fleets, and shared mobility solutions to support climate neutrality in cities. Key research topics include the electrification of transport systems, integration of various mobility services, assessment of existing measures, and the development of innovative solutions and business models. The initiative aims to foster collaboration among cities, stakeholders, and researchers to identify best practices, evaluate impacts, and provide guidance for local authorities to achieve sustainable urban mobility goals.

title: Transition to low-temperature heating solutions in multi-apartment buildings
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing low-temperature district heating systems and building heating solutions to enhance the integration of renewable energy and waste heat. Key research topics include the development of technical solutions for transitioning existing heating systems to operate at lower temperatures, the demonstration of efficient heating systems in residential multi-apartment buildings, and the implementation of digital tools for monitoring and decision-making. Additionally, projects should assess the socio-economic benefits of these solutions within local energy communities and contribute to broader climate action plans.

title: Leveraging long-term field experiments and other datasets to develop AI-ready decision support systems for sustainable soil management
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing sustainable soil management through the development of standardized protocols for long-term field experiments (LTEs) and the integration of soil data with advanced AI-driven tools. Key research topics include the harmonization of soil data collection methods, the creation of comprehensive soil health databases, and the use of machine learning to analyze complex soil datasets for improved decision-making. The initiative aims to foster collaboration among scientists, policymakers, and land managers to enhance soil health monitoring and management practices across the EU and associated regions.

title: Enabling user-centred and open innovation initiatives to enhance soil health in Ukraine
summary_text: The key research topics focus on addressing soil health challenges in Ukraine, particularly those exacerbated by military actions, including degradation from nutrient mismanagement, contamination, and erosion. The scientific focus areas include participatory and transdisciplinary research and innovation approaches, capacity building for stakeholders, and the development of sustainable management practices and innovative technologies to improve soil health and resilience. Additionally, the initiative aims to enhance collaboration among researchers, policymakers, and local authorities to effectively tackle soil degradation and promote knowledge transfer in the context of Ukraine's reconstruction efforts.

title: Antimicrobial resistance and antibiotic biosynthesis in soils: developing key understanding and counteractive strategies using a One-Health approach
summary_text: The key research topics focus on understanding antimicrobial resistance (AMR) development in soils, including the drivers and pathways that contribute to human and animal exposure to antimicrobial resistant genes and organisms. The scope includes exploring antibiotic biosynthesis in soils, the transfer of AMR genes among organisms, and the impact of land use and management practices on these processes. Additionally, the proposals aim to expand databases of antibiotics-related genes, develop guidelines for policymakers, and raise public awareness about the significance of soil biodiversity for health and pharmaceutical discovery.

title: Monitoring soil health in practice: equipping stakeholders to sample, analyse, and interpret soil health indicators
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing soil health assessments and management practices in the EU, particularly in relation to the Soil Monitoring and Resilience Directive and the EU Soil Strategy for 2030. Key research topics include improving the reliability and accessibility of soil health data, developing standardized methods for soil sampling and analysis, and fostering collaboration among stakeholders to enhance understanding and interpretation of soil data. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for capacity-building activities, the integration of diverse soil data sources, and the promotion of best practices in soil management to support sustainable land use and policy formulation.

title: Building public trust and outreach in the life sciences
summary_text: This grant call focuses on enhancing public engagement and trust in life sciences through improved science communication, risk communication, and citizen involvement in research and innovation activities. Key research topics include developing innovative approaches for public outreach, training life science stakeholders in effective communication strategies, and creating accessible resources for risk communication. Additionally, proposals should emphasize community engagement, particularly in agriculture and food technology, to ensure that life sciences innovations align with societal values and needs.

title: Pilot actions for follow-on funding: Leveraging EU-funded collaborative research in regenerative medicine
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing biotechnology innovations, particularly in the field of regenerative medicine, to enhance health outcomes and strengthen the EU's life sciences sector. Key research topics include the development and validation of health innovations from TRL 5, the commercialization of therapies and services, and the establishment of effective pathways to market, ensuring regulatory compliance and addressing patient needs. Proposals should emphasize collaboration, demonstrate prior validation of concepts, and outline clear plans for clinical studies and market readiness.

title: Development of novel vaccines for viral pathogens with epidemic potential
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing the development of vaccines for emerging and re-emerging viral infections, emphasizing the need for a proactive approach to vaccine-based antiviral strategies in response to health threats exacerbated by climate change. Key research areas include the in-vitro and in-vivo characterization of vaccine candidates, production under Good Manufacturing Practices, and conducting first-in-human clinical safety studies, while considering biological and social factors influencing vaccine efficacy. Proposals should target specific viruses and aim to enhance the EU's role in global vaccine research and development.

title: Support to European Research Area (ERA) action on accelerating New Approach Methodologies (NAMs) to advance biomedical research and testing of medicinal products and medical devices
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development and implementation of New Approach Methodologies (NAMs) in biomedical research and regulatory testing of medicinal products and medical devices. Key research topics include the validation and qualification of NAMs, the establishment of common education and training programs on NAMs and the 3Rs principles, and the promotion of openness and awareness regarding NAMs among stakeholders. The initiative aims to harmonize policies across Member States to enhance the acceptance and uptake of NAMs, ultimately contributing to a healthier society.

title: Regulatory science to support translational development of patient-centred health technologies
summary_text: This grant call focuses on enhancing the regulatory science of health technologies to improve their evaluation, adoption, and integration into clinical practice. Key research topics include the development of evidence-driven methodologies for assessing novel health technologies, the incorporation of innovative biomedical approaches and digital solutions (such as AI), and the refinement of regulatory frameworks to ensure safety and effectiveness. Proposals should aim to address gaps in clinical evidence and explore the use of real-world data and new methodologies to support the regulatory decision-making process for various health technologies.

title: Integrating New Approach Methodologies (NAMs) to advance biomedical research and regulatory testing
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development and integration of New Approach Methodologies (NAMs) in biomedical research and regulatory testing, emphasizing human-relevant technologies such as in-vitro assays, organoids, and AI-driven modeling. Key research topics include enhancing disease modeling precision, improving safety assessments of chemicals and medical products, and fostering collaboration among academia, industry, and regulatory bodies to validate and adopt these innovative platforms. The aim is to reduce reliance on animal testing while ensuring that the resulting data adheres to FAIR principles and supports personalized healthcare solutions.

title: Towards a better understanding and anticipation of the impacts of climate change on health
summary_text: This grant call focuses on research addressing the health impacts of climate change, specifically targeting non-communicable diseases (NCDs), mental health, and infectious diseases. Proposals should explore the interactions between climate factors and health outcomes, emphasizing the need for evidence-based policies, improved data collection, and understanding of vulnerabilities among different populations. Key areas of interest include the mechanisms linking climate change to health, the effects on vulnerable groups, and the development of diagnostic tools and resilience strategies.

title: Advancing research on the prevention, diagnosis, and management of post-infection long-term conditions
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing research into post-infection conditions caused by various microorganisms, aiming to improve patient recovery and quality of life. Key research topics include identifying risk factors and biomarkers, developing innovative prevention and treatment strategies, enhancing rehabilitation approaches, and integrating post-infection care into healthcare systems. Emphasis is placed on addressing health disparities, utilizing multidisciplinary approaches, and incorporating advanced technologies such as AI to optimize outcomes for diverse populations.

title: Public procurement of innovative solutions for improving citizens' access to healthcare through integrated or personalised approaches
summary_text: This grant call focuses on enhancing healthcare access and quality through innovative solutions that address the integration of care and personalized medicine. Key research topics include the development and deployment of digital technologies, such as AI, to improve patient engagement, care coordination, and diagnostic processes, particularly for vulnerable populations with complex health needs. Proposals should emphasize collaboration among procurers to identify unmet needs and implement effective, evidence-based solutions that foster organizational innovation and improve health system resilience.

title: Scaling up innovation in cardiovascular health
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing cardiovascular health research and innovation, particularly in the areas of prevention, early detection, and treatment of cardiovascular diseases (CVDs) and associated comorbidities. Key research topics include the development of personalized risk prediction models, integration of digital tools like Virtual Human Twins and AI, and addressing sex and gender disparities in cardiovascular health. Proposals should aim to create a Strategic Research and Innovation Agenda (SRIA) that enhances collaboration among healthcare providers, policymakers, and researchers to improve health outcomes across diverse populations.

title: Innovative interventions to prevent the harmful effects of using digital technologies on the mental health of children and young adults
summary_text: This grant call focuses on understanding the neuro-biological and cognitive/behavioral impacts of digital technologies on mental health, particularly among children and young adults. It aims to generate robust evidence on both the positive and negative effects of digital technology use, develop and test innovative interventions to promote healthy digital habits, and empower young users with resilience and digital literacy. The research should also consider the inclusion of diverse populations and the co-design of interventions with end-users, while adhering to ethical data practices and engaging social sciences for broader societal impact.

title: Support for a multilateral initiative on climate change and health research
summary_text: The key research topics and scientific focus areas of this grant call include the establishment of an international multilateral initiative aimed at enhancing coordination among research and innovation funding organizations addressing climate change and health issues. Proposals should emphasize the development of a governance model, effective communication strategies, and collaborative platforms to facilitate knowledge sharing and alignment of priorities among stakeholders in the climate-health nexus. Additionally, the initiative seeks to improve understanding of climate-related health vulnerabilities and support sustainable interventions for health systems while promoting the decarbonization of the health sector.

title: Establishing a European network of Centres of Excellence (CoEs) for Advanced Therapies Medicinal Products (ATMPs)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing the development and commercialization of Advanced Therapies Medicinal Products (ATMPs) in Europe, including gene therapies, cell therapies, and tissue-engineered products. Key research topics include establishing a European network of Centres of Excellence (CoEs) for ATMPs, enhancing R&D infrastructure, and fostering collaboration among various stakeholders to streamline clinical trials, manufacturing, and regulatory processes. The aim is to position Europe as a leader in ATMP innovation, improve patient access to these therapies, and stimulate economic growth in the life sciences sector.

title: Behavioural interventions as primary prevention for Non-Communicable Diseases (NCDs) among young people
summary_text: This grant call focuses on behavioral interventions aimed at the primary prevention of non-communicable diseases (NCDs) among youth aged 12 to 25. Key research topics include the development of evidence-based strategies for health professionals to promote healthy habits, the use of digital tools and real-world data to enhance self-monitoring and empowerment, and the integration of gender-sensitive and intersectional approaches to address health disparities. Proposals should emphasize collaboration among healthcare providers, educators, families, and policymakers, and include robust methodologies for evaluating the effectiveness of interventions.

title: Multisectoral approach to tackle chronic non-communicable diseases: implementation research maximising collaboration and coordination with sectors and in settings beyond the healthcare system (GACD)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on implementation research aimed at tackling the burden of Non-Communicable Diseases (NCDs) through multisectoral engagement beyond traditional healthcare settings. Key research topics include strategies for risk reduction, prevention, and management of NCDs in various environments such as workplaces, schools, and communities, particularly in low- and middle-income countries and underserved populations in high-income countries. Proposals should emphasize equitable access, stakeholder engagement, and the integration of social determinants of health to enhance health outcomes and quality of life.

title: Understanding of sex and/or gender-specific mechanisms of cardiovascular diseases: determinants, risk factors and pathways
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing research related to cardiovascular diseases (CVDs) by emphasizing the importance of biological sex and gender-specific health determinants. Key research topics include understanding sex and gender disparities in CVD incidence and treatment, developing tailored risk models for prevention and diagnosis, and integrating data from various disciplines to identify novel health determinants. Additionally, the call encourages the use of new technologies and the involvement of social sciences to enhance the societal impact of research on CVDs.

title: Identifying and addressing low-value care in health and care systems
summary_text: This grant call focuses on addressing low-value care in healthcare systems, aiming to improve efficiency, quality of care, and patient outcomes. Key research topics include the identification and measurement of low-value care practices, the development of evidence-based methodologies and innovative strategies for reducing such practices, and the evaluation of healthcare payment systems that may incentivize low-value care. Proposals should adopt a patient-centered approach, consider ethical and social factors, and promote collaboration among stakeholders to ensure effective interventions and resource allocation.

title: Towards climate resilient, prepared and carbon neutral populations and healthcare systems
summary_text: This grant call focuses on research aimed at enhancing the healthcare sector's resilience to climate change while promoting health-protective behaviors. Key topics include the development of low-carbon medical technologies, frameworks for assessing the health co-benefits of climate adaptation and mitigation, and the design of inclusive interventions to reduce health vulnerabilities. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of community engagement, the scalability of solutions, and the integration of social sciences to address the broader socio-economic challenges faced by healthcare systems.

title: European Partnership on Rare Diseases (ERDERA) (Phase 2)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing research and innovation in the field of Rare Diseases (RD) to enhance healthcare access and outcomes for affected individuals. Key research topics include the establishment of a European Clinical Research Network to facilitate multinational clinical studies, the development of interoperable data ecosystems for improved access to rare disease registries, and the integration of various research phases to streamline the research continuum. Additionally, the initiative aims to promote collaboration among stakeholders, including researchers, healthcare providers, and policymakers, to ensure effective translation of research into practical health solutions.

title: Enhancing and enlarging the European Partnership on Personalised Medicine (EP PerMEd) (Top-up)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on enhancing collaborative research in personalized medicine across European countries and regions, aiming to improve prevention, diagnosis, and treatment strategies. Key research topics include the development of evidence-based policies for personalized medicine integration into healthcare systems, innovative business models for health industries, and the establishment of knowledge hubs to facilitate stakeholder cooperation. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of public engagement, addressing diversity in healthcare, and leveraging genomics for innovation and economic growth.

title: Earlier and more precise palliative care
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing innovative, earlier, and more personalized palliative care models for cancer patients, utilizing digital remote tools and AI to enhance care integration and communication among patients, carers, and clinicians. Proposals should aim to create and validate these models in real-world settings, addressing barriers to access and ensuring optimal patient care through guidelines and effective workforce management. Additionally, the research should consider age, sex, and gender differences, and promote collaboration with existing EU health initiatives.

title: Virtual Human Twin (VHT) Models for Cancer Research
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development and application of advanced multiscale Virtual Human Twins (VHTs) to enhance understanding of cancer onset and progression, particularly for cancers with limited treatment options. Key research topics include the integration of AI tools for analyzing diverse patient data, the creation of personalized treatment models, and the validation of VHTs using longitudinal patient data to improve clinical outcomes. Collaboration among various scientific disciplines and stakeholders is emphasized to ensure the accessibility and usability of VHTs in clinical settings.

title: Boosting mental health of young cancer survivors through the European Cancer Patient Digital Centre (ECPDC)
