summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing an online platform to enhance the mental health support for adolescent and young adult (AYA) cancer patients and survivors, aged 15-39. Key research topics include creating innovative, evidence-based tools for mental health monitoring and support, integrating personalized features, and utilizing patient-reported outcomes to better understand and address the mental health needs of this demographic. Collaboration with end-users, including patients, caregivers, and healthcare professionals, is essential to ensure the platform's effectiveness and relevance.

title: Pragmatic clinical trials to optimise immunotherapeutic interventions for patients with refractory cancers
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing and implementing tailored, affordable immunotherapeutic interventions for patients with refractory cancers across Europe. It emphasizes conducting pragmatic clinical trials to evaluate the effectiveness of these interventions in real-world settings, with a strong focus on patient-reported outcomes, quality of life, and the inclusion of diverse patient demographics. Additionally, the proposals should foster collaboration among various stakeholders, including healthcare professionals, academia, and policymakers, to ensure the integration of evidence-based practices into routine healthcare.

title: Microbiome for early cancer prediction before the onset of disease
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development of microbiome-based tools for the early prediction and prevention of cancer, particularly targeting high-risk individuals. Key research topics include the validation of microbiome tests as predictive biomarkers, the integration of AI risk modeling approaches, and the comparison of these tools with other minimally invasive tests like liquid biopsies. Additionally, proposals should emphasize collaboration with existing microbiome biobanks, citizen engagement for data collection, and the creation of guidelines for managing cancer risk factors through lifestyle and dietary changes.

title: Development of a research capacity building programme on cancer with and for Ukraine
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing a capacity-building program to enhance research and innovation capabilities in Ukrainian cancer centers, particularly in light of the ongoing conflict and its impact on cancer care. Key research topics include improving integration between research and clinical care, enhancing participation in clinical trials, and developing digital capacities for data management and cancer registries. Special emphasis is placed on addressing childhood cancer, training in clinical trial processes, and ensuring gender representation in research and career pathways.

title: Improve the Quality of Life of older cancer patients
summary_text: The grant call focuses on improving the care and quality of life for older cancer patients (aged 65 and above) by enhancing understanding of their specific health needs and developing innovative, age-sensitive care approaches. Key research topics include assessing quality of life determinants, implementing holistic treatment strategies, addressing comorbidities and frailty, and ensuring patient and caregiver engagement in the research process. The aim is to generate evidence-based tools and practices that can be integrated into healthcare systems across Europe, reflecting the diverse needs of older cancer patients.

title: Deploying circular systemic solutions through living labs in cities and regions (Circular Cities and Regions Initiative topic)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing circular economy initiatives at local and regional levels, aiming to enhance circularity, reduce greenhouse gas emissions, and improve air and water quality while preserving biodiversity. It emphasizes the establishment of living labs to foster collaboration among diverse stakeholders, including public authorities, businesses, and citizens, to co-create and implement innovative circular solutions. Additionally, the call encourages knowledge transfer and replication of successful practices across Europe, aligning with broader EU sustainability goals and strategies.

title: Open topic: Using the Circular Cities and Regions Initiative to strengthen urban manufacturing in support of the Clean Industrial Deal
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing resource efficiency in urban manufacturing through circular material use and sustainable practices, contributing to EU climate and biodiversity goals. The initiative emphasizes the development and implementation of circular systemic solutions to address environmental challenges, while fostering collaboration among economic operators, local authorities, and civil society. Additionally, it aims to integrate social sciences to enhance the societal impact of urban manufacturing and support the transition to a resilient circular economy in Europe.

title: Optimising the water-nutrient-energy nexus for sustainable and climate smart agriculture in Africa (FNSSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on promoting sustainable, climate-smart, and biodiversity-friendly agricultural practices in African agro-ecosystems through a nexus approach that integrates water, nutrient, and energy management. Key research topics include assessing the needs for sustainable resource management, developing innovative tools and practices for smallholder farms, and evaluating the economic, environmental, and social impacts of these practices. The initiative aims to foster collaboration among various stakeholders and leverage local knowledge alongside scientific expertise to enhance agricultural sustainability and resilience in Africa.

title: Open topic: Innovative solutions for the European Water Resilience Strategy
summary_text: The grant call focuses on innovative solutions to enhance water resilience in Europe, targeting three main areas: restoring the water cycle through improved ecosystem management and climate adaptation strategies; promoting water-smart economies by developing efficient water use practices and technologies; and ensuring clean and affordable water access for vulnerable populations. Proposals should involve multi-actor collaboration and demonstrate plans for future implementation and scaling of solutions, while also considering public engagement and the integration of gender and intersectional dimensions where relevant.

title: Strengthening plant health: addressing emerging plant pest risks
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing plant health by addressing emerging plant pests that threaten agriculture and forestry within the EU and Associated Countries. Key research topics include understanding the biology and spread of these pests, developing cost-effective and sustainable management tools, and assessing the socio-economic and environmental impacts of pest establishment. Proposals should also promote collaboration among various stakeholders and consider diverse farming systems, including organic practices.

title: Fostering generational renewal in agriculture via EU advisory network
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the capacity of agricultural advisors to support young and new farmers in establishing and managing sustainable farming businesses, particularly in the context of climate change and biodiversity loss. This includes developing training resources, business strategies, and practical guidance for farm establishment, as well as promoting generational renewal and succession planning in agriculture. Additionally, the initiative aims to reposition farming as an attractive career choice for younger generations and foster collaboration among stakeholders within the agricultural knowledge and innovation systems (AKIS).

title: Improving analytical capacity for sustainable competitiveness of the agricultural sector
summary_text: The research topics focus on enhancing the understanding of agricultural competitiveness and its interactions with sustainability dimensions, including economic, social, and environmental factors. Key areas include improving data collection and analytical tools for decision-makers in the agri-food supply chain, addressing analytical gaps in competitiveness drivers and impacts, and developing indicators to measure performance and sustainability. Proposals should also explore trade-offs between competitiveness, resilience, and sustainability objectives, while integrating knowledge from various disciplines and ensuring collaboration among diverse stakeholders.

title: Increasing knowledge flows to practice within AKIS via EU thematic knowledge hubs
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the competitiveness, sustainability, and resilience of agriculture, forestry, and rural areas through the establishment of EU thematic knowledge hubs. These hubs aim to disseminate practical knowledge and innovative solutions related to crop nutrition and protection, as well as agrobiodiversity and wild pollinators, by integrating advisors and end-users into the Agricultural Knowledge and Innovation Systems (AKIS). Proposals should emphasize collaboration among diverse stakeholders to address urgent practical needs, share best practices, and ensure effective knowledge transfer across the EU.

title: International dimension of the circular bio-based economy: seeking win-win opportunities
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing multi-level governance for a sustainable transition in the bioeconomy, emphasizing bio-based innovation, biotechnology, biomanufacturing, and biorefining. Proposals should analyze international cooperation in sustainable bio-based circular innovation, identify stakeholders, and develop strategies for stakeholder engagement and trust-building. Additionally, the research should address socio-economic and environmental impacts, promote inclusivity, and provide recommendations for policy makers, with a strong emphasis on international collaboration, particularly with regions like South Africa and Latin America.

title: Strengthening strategic advice and synergies between EU and national Research and Innovation agendas and investments
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing coordination and collaboration among European and national research and innovation programs in agriculture, fisheries, food systems, forestry, and the bioeconomy. It aims to support the activities of the Standing Committee on Agricultural Research (SCAR) Working Groups by facilitating meetings, producing relevant analyses, and promoting cross-collaboration and information exchange among stakeholders. Additionally, it emphasizes the importance of aligning with the European Green Deal and other strategic initiatives related to bioeconomy and sustainable practices.

title: AI supporting informed advice for farmers and foresters to improve competitiveness and sustainability
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing innovative AI-based solutions to enhance decision-making for farmers and foresters, aiming to improve the competitiveness, sustainability, and resilience of the EU agriculture and forestry sectors. Key research topics include the creation and validation of cost-effective AI tools that utilize diverse data sources for tailored advice, the enhancement of skills and awareness among end users regarding AI applications, and the integration of social sciences to maximize societal impact. Proposals should emphasize collaboration among various stakeholders, including SMEs and rural actors, to ensure effective dissemination and uptake of the developed solutions.

title: Strengthening the resilience of European farmers through improved capacity in coping with risks and crises
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the resilience of farmers and agri-food supply chain operators against diverse risks and crises, particularly in the context of climate change and biodiversity loss. Key research topics include the development of integrated risk and crisis management strategies, understanding farmers' decision-making processes, assessing the impacts of various risks (sanitary, environmental, economic, etc.), and promoting inclusive solutions tailored to different farming systems. Proposals should also emphasize capacity building, fair risk sharing, and collaboration among diverse stakeholders, including farmers, researchers, and policymakers.

title: Living labs to enhance soil health in Continental, Black Sea, Pannonian and Steppic biogeographical regions
summary_text: The grant call focuses on establishing living labs to enhance soil health through participatory, interdisciplinary, and transdisciplinary research and innovation. Key research topics include the co-creation of economically viable soil health solutions, improved soil health monitoring, and the development of practice-oriented knowledge for land managers. The initiative aims to address soil health challenges across various land uses while contributing to broader EU environmental strategies and policies, including the EU Biodiversity Strategy and the European Green Deal.

title: Innovative biotechnologies to restore soil health and improve agricultural competitiveness and resilience
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing biotechnological solutions that enhance soil health and productivity, particularly through the use of soil microbiomes, novel bio-based fertilizers, and microbial inoculants. Key research topics include bioremediation of contaminated soils, increasing soil organic carbon, improving soil structure, and developing scalable, sustainable, and cost-effective biotechnologies that support sustainable land management and agricultural practices. Proposals should emphasize collaboration across the value chain and assess the socio-economic feasibility and environmental impact of the developed solutions.

title: Agroforestry for soil health at landscape level
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing agroforestry practices and agroecological solutions to improve soil health and promote sustainable land management across the EU and Associated Countries. Key research topics include the development and validation of business models for agroforestry, understanding the environmental, social, and economic benefits of agroforestry, and addressing barriers to its adoption through interdisciplinary and participatory approaches. Proposals should aim to assess the impacts of agroforestry on soil health, facilitate capacity building among stakeholders, and ensure the integration of diverse actors along the value chain to support scalable agroforestry systems.

title: Participatory research on the health of communities in contact with polluted soils
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the relationship between soil pollution and human health, emphasizing community-based participatory research to identify and map health outcomes associated with contaminated sites. Proposals should explore both direct and indirect health impacts of soil pollution, engage stakeholders in developing mitigation strategies, and promote public awareness and policy recommendations for sustainable land management and decontamination efforts. An interdisciplinary approach is required, incorporating expertise in soil contamination, epidemiology, and social sciences, while ensuring data accessibility and collaboration with relevant EU initiatives.

title: Long-term drivers and consequences of soil degradation: learning from the past to improve future soil health
summary_text: The key research topics focus on understanding historical and contemporary soil degradation processes, their socio-economic and cultural drivers, and the long-term consequences for climate, biodiversity, and agricultural competitiveness. Proposals should aim to study past soil health using diverse evidence sources, develop methodologies for assessing soil conditions, and utilize digital tools for modeling future trends. Additionally, the initiative emphasizes interdisciplinary collaboration and citizen engagement to enhance awareness and promote sustainable soil management practices.

title: Living Labs for co-creating solutions to reduce eutrophication from agriculture
summary_text: The grant call focuses on establishing living labs to enhance soil health and mitigate eutrophication, particularly in agricultural contexts. Key research topics include participatory and interdisciplinary approaches to co-develop soil management practices, improved soil health monitoring, and the creation of standardized soil data. The initiative aims to support the EU's environmental policies and strategies, including the European Green Deal and the EU Biodiversity Strategy, by fostering collaboration among various stakeholders to implement effective soil health solutions.

title: Living labs to monitor and mitigate carcinogenic substances in and originating from soils: Evaluating their effects on human cancer risks
summary_text: The key research topics focus on establishing living labs to develop and implement solutions for soil health, particularly addressing contamination by carcinogenic substances such as PFAS and heavy metals. The initiative aims to enhance understanding of the pathways through which these contaminants affect human health and the food chain, while promoting interdisciplinary collaboration among various stakeholders to co-create effective remediation strategies. Additionally, the projects will analyze the correlation between soil pollutants and cancer incidence, and aim to ensure the long-term sustainability of these living labs through diverse funding and engagement strategies.

title: MSCA and Citizens 2027
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing public engagement with research through the organization of the European Researchers' Night and the Researchers at Schools initiative. Key research topics include promoting science communication, increasing accessibility to STEAM fields for young audiences, and fostering interactions between researchers and students to address societal challenges. The initiative aims to improve outreach, visibility, and inclusiveness in science, while encouraging partnerships and synergies across Europe.

title: Biotechnology application for CCU
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and scaling of innovative life sciences-based technologies for the purification and conversion of gaseous carbon into sustainable feedstock for industrial processes, promoting circularity and climate neutrality. Proposals should assess the technological readiness of carbon capture and use (CCU) methods, develop effective solutions using synthetic biology or microorganisms, and evaluate the environmental, social, and economic viability of these technologies. Additionally, projects should demonstrate the most promising technologies, explore their replication potential, and consider establishing spin-offs for implementation.

title: Strengthening forest research for the support of Ukraine
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the recovery and resilience of Ukraine's forest sector in the context of climate change and the impacts of the ongoing war. Key research topics include the development of evidence-based policies aligned with EU standards, sustainable management and restoration of war-affected forests, strengthening forest research and education systems, and promoting international cooperation and digitalization of forest governance. Proposals should aim to build institutional capacity, foster innovation in forestry education, and align Ukrainian forestry legislation with EU regulations to support the country's integration into the EU.

title: Increasing the circularity of bio-based sector: upcycling and recycling for higher value and environmental benefits
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing and scaling up safe, sustainable, circular, and bio-based materials and value chains across various sectors, including construction, packaging, and textiles. Emphasis is placed on innovative solutions for bio-waste management, enhancing resource efficiency, and fostering industrial symbiosis, while integrating digital tools for better accessibility and traceability of bio-based resources. Additionally, the proposals should consider stakeholder needs regarding regulations and standards, and encourage cooperation among funded projects to maximize societal impact and knowledge dissemination.

title: Accelerating the transition to a nature positive economy: Integrating biodiversity into the private sector
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the economic case for biodiversity protection and sustainable practices, emphasizing the need for robust assessments of the costs of inaction and the integration of biodiversity considerations into business decision-making. Key research topics include developing effective biodiversity incentives, innovative financial mechanisms, and standardized metrics for assessing biodiversity impacts, as well as promoting a nature-positive economy through policy reforms and collaboration among various stakeholders. The initiative aims to address knowledge gaps and improve sustainability reporting, particularly for start-ups and SMEs, while aligning with European and global biodiversity frameworks.

title: Improve the capacity to monitor and reduce air pollution from agriculture
summary_text: The key research topics focus on improving monitoring, reporting, and verification (MRV) methodologies for air pollutants in agriculture, enhancing data accuracy and user-friendliness through innovative technologies like AI and IoT. The scientific focus areas include assessing emission factors, developing practices to reduce air pollutants from manure management, livestock feeding, and fertilizer use, and building capacity among stakeholders to implement these measures effectively. Additionally, the proposals should align with EU policies aimed at reducing air pollution and promoting biodiversity.

title: Living Labs for the eradication and/or management of invasive alien species
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing collaboration among researchers, decision-makers, and local communities to prevent, manage, and eradicate invasive alien species (IAS), which are significant drivers of biodiversity loss and pose threats to ecosystems and human health. Key research topics include the development of innovative detection and monitoring methods, the design and testing of eradication and management strategies, and the establishment of living labs for participatory and transdisciplinary research. Proposals should also address knowledge gaps, promote the integration of social sciences, and ensure data produced is FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Re-usable).

title: Replacing hazardous substances in biocidal products
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing innovative, bio-based, and safe alternatives to hazardous substances used in biocidal products, particularly in wood preservatives and insecticides for mosquito control. The aim is to create solutions that minimize risks to human health and biodiversity while adhering to the 'safe and sustainable by design' framework. Additionally, projects should incorporate social sciences to assess the safety of these substances across diverse populations and encourage international cooperation and SME participation.

title: Fostering common farmland birds and mammals for resilient food production systems
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing farmland bird and mammal populations to improve ecosystem services such as pest control, pollination, and agricultural resilience. Proposals should explore the impact of farming practices on these wildlife populations, develop participatory research programs for tailored bird-friendly solutions, and create educational initiatives highlighting the economic benefits of such practices. Additionally, the research should assess the effectiveness of biodiversity-friendly farming methods and promote collaboration among stakeholders to ensure sustainable agricultural practices that support both productivity and biodiversity.

title: Innovative circular solutions for end-of-life footwear through collection, sorting and recycling
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the circularity of the footwear industry by addressing the technical, environmental, economic, and social challenges associated with managing end-of-life footwear products. Key research topics include developing innovative methods and technologies for the collection, sorting, and recycling of post-consumer footwear, exploring sustainable business models, and fostering collaboration among stakeholders to promote effective solutions. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of integrating digital tools and addressing hazardous chemicals and microplastics in the recycling process to support EU circular economy policies.

title: Science-policy support to the implementation of EU and global biodiversity policies and strategies
summary_text: The key research topics and scientific focus areas of this grant call include the provision of effective scientific support for biodiversity policymaking, particularly through the European Commissionâ€™s Knowledge Centre for Biodiversity (KCBD). It emphasizes enhancing science-policy interactions, knowledge transfer related to nature-based solutions (NbS), and supporting the implementation of global biodiversity frameworks such as the Kunming-Montreal Global Biodiversity Framework (GBF). Additionally, the call highlights the importance of multi-stakeholder dialogue platforms to foster collaboration among researchers, policymakers, and practitioners to address biodiversity loss and climate change.

title: Enhancing ecodesign and circularity of construction products
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing ecodesign principles in the construction sector to enhance sustainability and circularity. Key research topics include the development and demonstration of durable, reusable, and recyclable construction materials, as well as mechanisms to incentivize design for circularity and product longevity. Proposals should also evaluate the environmental performance of these solutions from a lifecycle perspective and consider the impact of contaminants on circularity.

title: Living labs driving transformative change via knowledge integration and inclusive governance
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing governance frameworks that integrate knowledge across ecosystems and societal challenges to promote a nature-positive economy and support EU climate goals. Key research topics include the establishment of living labs for co-creating and testing governance and socio-economic models, developing inclusive governance strategies that address biodiversity loss, and analyzing barriers to participation in these frameworks. Proposals should emphasize interdisciplinary approaches, stakeholder engagement, and the integration of diverse knowledge systems to foster transformative change in environmental and socio-economic contexts.

title: Enhancing the competitiveness of organic crop breeding: focus on intercropping adapted varieties
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing organic crop breeding for intercropping systems, aiming to develop varieties that improve productivity and sustainability through better pest management, nutrient efficiency, and soil health. Key research topics include understanding plant interactions in intercropping, developing new breeding approaches that prioritize multi-species systems, and identifying effective crop combinations. Proposals should also address the creation of tools and criteria for evaluating crop performance in these systems, while considering regulations for organic breeding materials.

title: Enhancing ecodesign and circularity of consumer electronics
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the ecodesign of electrical and electronic equipment, emphasizing principles such as durability, reusability, reparability, and recyclability to enhance circularity and reduce environmental impact. Additionally, the call encourages the development of new recovery processes for critical raw materials from electronic waste, as well as the exploration of innovative business models and incentives that promote sustainable product design and consumer benefits. The overarching aim is to align these efforts with EU environmental regulations and contribute to the goals of the European Green Deal.

title: Health of ecosystems and wild species, predictions and impacts on human health, in the face of existing and emerging stressors, from a One Health approach
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the One Health approach, emphasizing the interconnectedness of ecosystem health, wildlife, domestic animals, and human health. Proposals should investigate the health status of ecosystems and wild species affected by biodiversity loss, assess the impacts of environmental stressors, and develop indicators for monitoring these interlinkages. Additionally, the research should include cost-benefit analyses of nature restoration efforts and provide actionable policy recommendations to enhance One Health governance, particularly for vulnerable populations.

title: Capacity building for extending product lifecycles through repair and refurbishment
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing innovative training programs and services for the repair and refurbishment of products in the electronics, furniture, textiles, and footwear sectors. The aim is to promote sustainable consumption and production, reduce waste and environmental impacts, and enhance the resilience of product value chains. Additionally, the proposals should evaluate the effectiveness of these initiatives, considering their economic, environmental, and social implications, while ensuring accessibility for all consumers.

title: Developing effective air quality planning strategies through innovative multi-scale modelling
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing air quality modeling capabilities to support effective air quality planning and governance. Key research topics include the development of innovative multi-scale and micro-scale modeling systems that accurately assess air pollution dynamics, the integration of urban canopy effects and emissions from indoor environments, and the consideration of vulnerable populations in air quality analyses. Proposals should aim to improve existing models, provide guidelines for decision-making, and ensure data produced is FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Re-usable), while fostering collaboration with ongoing research initiatives and European research infrastructures.

title: Developing novel recycling technologies for complex plastic materials applying biotech solutions
summary_text: The key research topics focus on advancing novel biotechnological solutions for the recycling of complex plastic materials, particularly in sectors such as packaging, construction, renewable energy, and transport. Proposals should aim to enhance design for recycling, improve waste characterization, and develop innovative recycling technologies, including the use of microbes and enzymes, while ensuring compliance with regulatory frameworks. Additionally, projects must demonstrate feasibility and impact through pilot-scale implementations and robust evaluations, including lifecycle assessments.

title: Europe-wide environmental benchmarking system of the industrial bioeconomy sectors
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing innovative circular industrial bio-based systems to reduce the environmental footprint of industries and support climate neutrality in the EU. Key research topics include the assessment and benchmarking of emerging biotechnologies and biomanufacturing techniques, particularly in sectors such as pulp and paper, bio-based chemicals, and bioremediation applications. The initiative aims to create a collaborative forum for stakeholders to collect and analyze data on these techniques, emphasizing their environmental performance, cost-effectiveness, and potential for biodiversity protection.

title: Towards a Europe of Bioeconomy Places
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development of "Bioeconomy Places," which are geographically defined areas that utilize bioeconomy solutions to enhance sustainability, community well-being, and economic growth. Key research topics include establishing benchmarks for qualifying these places, analyzing local needs and strengths, fostering multi-stakeholder partnerships, and creating training programs to build skills relevant to the bioeconomy. The initiative aims to promote circularity, biodiversity protection, and climate action through innovative solutions tailored to local contexts, with pilot sites set up across various EU Member States, including Ukraine.

title: Integrating Remote Sensing and in-situ observations of Biodiversity, towards a fully interoperable observation and data framework
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing biodiversity monitoring and assessment through the integration of diverse data sources, including omics-based data and remote sensing. Key research topics include the development of multisensory data integration systems, predictive analytics using AI, and the establishment of FAIR data protocols to enhance ecosystem condition assessments and biodiversity trend predictions. Proposals should address critical knowledge gaps and demonstrate applications in various ecosystems, while ensuring alignment with EU biodiversity strategies and relevant environmental policies.

title: Improving biomass flows for a sustainable and circular bioeconomy
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing resource efficiency in the collection, processing, and utilization of primary and secondary biomass, particularly bio-waste, while ensuring ecosystem protection and reducing greenhouse gas emissions. Key research topics include optimizing business models for biomass valorization, developing platforms to connect biomass suppliers and users, and advancing innovative technologies for biomass aggregation and processing. Proposals should also address barriers to biomass platform development and explore digital solutions for improving bio-waste management and traceability.

title: Technical innovation to protect ecosystems and to scale up their restoration
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing innovative technical solutions for the protection and restoration of ecosystems, particularly in the context of the EU Nature Restoration Regulation and the EU biodiversity strategy for 2030. Key research topics include designing and testing new machinery, low-tech solutions, and digital innovations tailored for various ecosystems, with an emphasis on effectiveness, ease of use, and environmental sustainability. The aim is to enhance the implementation of ecosystem restoration strategies that contribute to climate change mitigation and adaptation efforts.

title: Approaches and tools for security in software and hardware development and assessment
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing security frameworks for hardware and software supply chains, emphasizing the development of secure chip architectures and integrated security-by-design methodologies. Key research topics include the creation of robust security solutions for trusted hardware systems, innovative tools for software supply chain security, and advanced security testing methodologies, including AI-driven approaches and formal verification. Proposals should address either secured hardware systems or software supply chain security, with an emphasis on mitigating vulnerabilities and ensuring the integrity of digital systems throughout their lifecycle.

title: Advanced cryptographic schemes and High-Assurance high-speed cryptographic implementations
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing quantum-resistant cryptographic primitives and post-quantum solutions for enhancing the security and privacy of digital wallets and entity authentication over insecure networks. Key research topics include the development of new digital signatures and cryptographic schemes tailored for wallets and eIDs, as well as the creation of High-Assurance Cryptographic Software (HACS) and formal verification tools to ensure strong security guarantees in post-quantum migration. Proposals should also address the design of advanced protocols for secure connections and user authentication, alongside the development of methodologies for evaluating cryptographic implementations.

title: Enhancing the Security, Privacy and Robustness of AI Models and Systems (SecureAI)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the security and robustness of AI systems against adversarial attacks, including the development of resilient AI models and innovative defense mechanisms. Proposals should address methodologies for detecting and mitigating threats such as data poisoning and backdoor exploitation, as well as explore privacy-preserving techniques for AI deployment in sensitive environments. Additionally, the emphasis is on real-time anomaly detection and robust federated learning to ensure compliance with regulatory standards while maintaining data confidentiality.

title: Increasing the resilience of agriculture in water and nutrient-scarce environments through digital innovations
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing agricultural resilience through digital tools and innovative solutions to address water and nutrient scarcity, while promoting biodiversity and reducing pollution. Key research topics include the development of AI-enabled decision support systems for monitoring agricultural practices, understanding the interactions between soil, water, air, and nutrients in the context of climate change, and creating accessible digital tools for farmers. Proposals should also explore barriers to the adoption of these technologies and engage a diverse consortium of stakeholders, including farmers and researchers, to ensure practical application and societal impact.

title: Strengthening rural communities' resilience to shocks
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the resilience of rural communities to climate, environmental, and socio-economic shocks through improved governance and community engagement. Proposals should assess various types of shocks, measure resilience, and foster inclusive governance by involving vulnerable groups in disaster risk management. Additionally, the research should identify local resources for adaptation, support multi-level government strategies, and promote interdisciplinary collaboration, particularly involving social sciences and humanities.

title: AI-powered foodome characterization
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing an Artificial Intelligence (AI) tool to enhance the analysis of complex foodomics data, aiming to identify, characterize, and quantify a wide range of chemicals in food. Key research topics include the creation of AI algorithms for interpreting high-throughput foodomics data, understanding the "foodome" and its vast chemical complexity, and fostering collaboration between academia, industry, and research infrastructures to improve food safety and processing efficiency. Additionally, the initiative seeks to establish a European research network to standardize and disseminate findings in food exposome research.

title: Enhancing farmer's profitability and resilience through innovations for diversified crops and value chains
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing and implementing diversified cropping systems that enhance farmers' resilience, sustainability, and profitability while promoting biodiversity and climate adaptation. Proposals should explore innovative solutions and business models that support crop diversification, assess the economic, social, and environmental impacts of these innovations, and facilitate knowledge exchange among stakeholders. Additionally, the projects should address various farming systems, including organic farming, and ensure collaboration with existing EU-funded initiatives in the agricultural sector.

title: African Union â€“ European Union Partnership on Food and Nutrition Security and Sustainable Agriculture (FNSSA)
summary_text: The key research topics and scientific focus areas include improving coordination of research and innovation policies related to food and nutrition security and sustainable agriculture (FNSSA) between the African Union and European Union. Proposals should aim to operationalize an International Research Consortium to enhance stakeholder collaboration, develop a toolkit for better organizational support, and promote innovative solutions through funding mechanisms, particularly targeting start-ups and SMEs, with an emphasis on social innovation and inclusivity for women and young entrepreneurs. Additionally, collaboration with the European Commissionâ€™s Knowledge Centre on Global Food and Nutrition Security is encouraged to leverage existing knowledge and expand the impact of FNSSA initiatives.

title: Carbon farming innovation and scale-up
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing models, methods, and data for the quantification and certification of carbon farming activities within the EU's Carbon Removals and Carbon Farming (CRCF) framework. Key research topics include the integration of advanced technologies (such as machine learning and blockchain) to streamline monitoring and reporting processes, enhancing cooperation among stakeholders for data harmonization, and addressing barriers to large-scale participation in carbon farming certification. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of stakeholder engagement and the systematic collection of feedback to improve certification methodologies and support effective implementation of CRCF regulations.

title: Towards commercialization of food systems microbiome solutions
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing innovative microbiome solutions that enhance the resilience, productivity, and environmental sustainability of food systems, including organic, circular, and conventional approaches. The scientific focus areas include improving in-situ testing of these solutions, creating cost-effective production methodologies, and establishing business models to facilitate market access and commercialization within the EU. Additionally, the proposals should emphasize collaboration among researchers, businesses, and policymakers to co-develop and validate these microbiome technologies.

title: Governance, sustainable development and international politics of a future ice-free Arctic
summary_text: The grant call focuses on understanding the impacts and processes associated with an ice-free Arctic, emphasizing the need for enhanced observations and monitoring of Arctic changes across various systems, including ocean, atmosphere, and biodiversity. Key research topics include assessing the implications of new seasonal sea ice regimes, developing integrated models for climate and ecological processes, exploring sustainable economic opportunities, and identifying strategies for climate change adaptation and mitigation. The call encourages transdisciplinary approaches, incorporating Indigenous knowledge and fostering international cooperation to address governance and sustainable development challenges in the Arctic.

title: Increasing mitigation of GHG emissions and feed efficiency through feed additives
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and testing of innovative feed additives that reduce greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions and air pollutants from livestock, particularly ruminants, while ensuring animal health and productivity. Proposals should address the effectiveness, safety, and environmental impact of these additives across various livestock systems, promote knowledge transfer to farmers and advisors, and assess consumer perceptions regarding their use. Additionally, the research aims to align with EU policies for sustainable agriculture and enhance the integration of these solutions into common farming practices.

title: Strengthening evidence-based policies for the resilience of European agriculture and forestry and related supply chains against crises and systemic risks
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the understanding of systemic risks and crises affecting European agriculture, forestry, and agri-food supply chains, particularly in the context of climate change and trade disruptions. It aims to improve analytical capacities for assessing the impacts of these risks, develop integrated strategies for resilience, and explore socio-economic and technological options for adaptation and transformation. Proposals should address either agriculture or forestry supply chains, emphasizing interdisciplinary collaboration and the integration of social sciences with STEM disciplines.

title: Unlocking a safe operating space for Antarctica and the Southern Ocean
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the understanding of the Southern Ocean and Antarctic cryosphere, including their interactions with climate systems and ecosystems, particularly in the context of climate change and human impacts. Proposals should aim to improve projections of future changes, investigate the dynamics of ocean circulation and sea ice, assess the vulnerability of marine biodiversity, and develop long-term monitoring systems. Additionally, there is an emphasis on fostering international cooperation and integrating data for effective policy-making and conservation strategies.

title: Unleashing the potential of sustainable small-scale aquatic food production and recreational fisheries for prosperous local communities
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing small-scale aquatic food production, including small-scale fisheries, aquaculture, and recreational fisheries, with an emphasis on sustainable practices and community empowerment. Proposals should aim to develop innovative methodologies and tools that integrate natural and social sciences to improve value chains, assess socio-economic contributions, and address climate change impacts. Additionally, the research should prioritize stakeholder engagement, knowledge transfer, and capacity-building to ensure practical application of findings in local communities.

title: Improving understanding of the contribution of the organic farming sector to sustainability
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing data collection regarding the environmental, economic, and social impacts of the EU organic sector, aiming to improve understanding of its sustainability contributions. Key research topics include mapping existing data collection tools and methods, facilitating best practice exchanges among EU countries, assessing the feasibility of utilizing data from organic certification bodies, and developing training for organic farmers to enhance their data reporting capabilities. The initiative emphasizes collaboration among stakeholders in the organic value chain and aims to support the EU's broader agricultural and environmental policies.

title: Empowering local urban food systems entrepreneurship and innovation
summary_text: The key research topics focus on transformative and inclusive innovation in local urban food systems, emphasizing the development of decentralized ecosystems such as food innovation incubators and accelerators. Proposals should aim to empower urban food entrepreneurs through collaborative governance models, enhance resilience and well-being in urban communities, and align with the European Green Deal and Food 2030 priorities. Additionally, the integration of social sciences and humanities, as well as a multi-actor approach involving diverse stakeholders, is essential for creating sustainable and scalable urban food solutions.

title: Microbiome for terrestrial livestock sustainability and health within a One Health approach
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing microbiome research in livestock within a One Health framework, emphasizing the interconnectedness of animal, human, and environmental health. Key research topics include investigating host-microbiome interactions, developing integrated data monitoring systems for health indicators, and designing microbiome-based intervention strategies to enhance animal health, reduce antimicrobial use, and minimize environmental impact. The initiative aims to foster collaboration among various scientific disciplines to create sustainable livestock systems and address challenges such as antimicrobial resistance and zoonotic disease transmission.

title: Advanced integrated photonic devices for extended features and ultra-low power consumption (RIA) (Photonics Partnership)
summary_text: The research topics focus on advancing integrated photonic devices and circuits to enhance their functionality, efficiency, and performance across various sectors, including communication, computing, and health. Key areas of interest include improving spectral purity, modulation speeds, and signal processing capabilities, as well as developing miniaturized, high-complexity photonic circuits and reducing power consumption through innovative materials and designs. Proposals should demonstrate real-world applicability and system-level impact in relevant application domains.

title: European Partnership for Pandemic Preparedness (Phase 2)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on enhancing pandemic preparedness and response through coordinated clinical research across Europe, emphasizing the establishment of a robust network of clinical research sites for large-scale studies. Key research topics include the integration of One Health approaches to address the interplay of environmental factors and health threats, the development of evidence-based strategies for public health, and the consolidation of a health research data ecosystem aligned with European initiatives. The initiative aims to foster collaboration among stakeholders, including policymakers and the research community, to close research gaps and improve transnational research capabilities.

title: Development of innovative antimicrobials against pathogens resistant to antimicrobials
summary_text: This grant call focuses on developing innovative antibacterial and antifungal agents to combat antimicrobial resistance (AMR), specifically targeting pathogens such as Carbapenem-resistant Acinetobacter baumannii, Methicillin-Resistant Staphylococcus aureus, and drug-resistant Candida spp. Proposals should aim to advance candidate therapies through in-vivo testing, production under Good Manufacturing Practices, and human clinical trials, while addressing regulatory pathways and considering biological and social factors. The initiative encourages collaboration with SMEs and participation from regions where AMR is prevalent, aiming to enhance the EU's role in AMR research and development.

title: Tools and technologies to support health adaptation to climate change
summary_text: This grant call focuses on enhancing the adaptive capacity and resilience of healthcare systems and communities to mitigate health impacts from climate change. Key research topics include the development of innovative technologies for health risk surveillance, real-time monitoring tools, and climate-resilient healthcare solutions, as well as strategies for health risk management and prevention. Proposals should foster collaboration between public authorities and private developers to create effective climate adaptation technologies that address both direct and indirect health risks associated with climate change.

title: Integrating climate-related exposures into the human exposome and characterising its changes in response to climate change
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing research related to the human exposome, particularly the integration of climate-related factors and their interactions with environmental, social, and lifestyle determinants of health. Key research topics include understanding the health implications of climate exposures, developing methodologies for exposomics studies, and identifying health risks and benefits associated with climate change. Proposals should also address socioeconomic and demographic disparities in exposure patterns and health outcomes, promoting a multidisciplinary approach to enhance public health in the context of environmental degradation.

title: Personalised approaches to reduce risks from Adverse Drug Reactions due to administration of multiple medications
summary_text: This grant call focuses on research aimed at reducing adverse drug reactions (ADRs) associated with polypharmacy, particularly in older patients. Key topics include the integration of pharmacogenomics and biomarkers into clinical decision-making, the use of technology such as electronic health records and AI to enhance medication safety, and the development of personalized medicine approaches to optimize drug management. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for evidence-based strategies to inform clinical guidelines and improve healthcare outcomes while addressing ethical and regulatory challenges.

title: Addressing disabilities through the life course to support independent living and inclusion
summary_text: This grant call focuses on enhancing the independent living and societal inclusion of persons with long-term disabilities through innovative research and community support services. Key research topics include health-related studies addressing disabilities, access to habilitation and rehabilitation services, prevention of disabilities across the life-course, and strategies for successful transitions from institutional care to community living. The call emphasizes the importance of person-centered approaches, the involvement of persons with disabilities in the research process, and the integration of social sciences to maximize societal impact.

title: Development of novel small molecule antiviral therapeutics for pathogens with epidemic potential
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing research and development of antiviral therapies for emerging and re-emerging viral infections, particularly in the context of health security threats exacerbated by climate change. Key research topics include the discovery and optimization of candidate antivirals, in-vitro and in-vivo characterization of their efficacy, and the establishment of regulatory pathways for clinical trials. Proposals should specifically target certain viruses, such as Junin and Lassa mammarenaviruses, tick-borne encephalitis viruses, and others, while also considering the broader implications for global health preparedness.

title: Development of monoclonal antibodies to prevent and treat infections from Filo-, Nairo-, Phenui-, Picorna- and Toga viruses
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing the development of monoclonal antibodies for the prevention and treatment of emerging and re-emerging viral infections, specifically targeting viruses such as Ebola, Marburg, and Chikungunya. Key research areas include in-vitro characterization, in-vivo testing in animal models, evaluation of Antibody-Dependent Enhancement (ADE) risks, and production of antibody candidates under Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP). Proposals should also aim to conduct first-in-human clinical safety studies and engage with regulatory bodies to facilitate market authorization.

title: Development of monoclonal antibodies to prevent and treat infections from Flaviviruses
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing the development of monoclonal antibodies for the prevention and treatment of emerging and re-emerging viral infections, specifically targeting Flaviviruses such as Dengue, Zika, and Yellow Fever. Key research areas include in-vitro characterization of antibody candidates, in-vivo testing in animal models, evaluation of Antibody-Dependent Enhancement (ADE) risks, and production of antibody batches under Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP). Proposals should also aim to facilitate first-in-human clinical safety studies and engage with regulatory bodies to ensure compliance and market authorization pathways.

title: Development of cell-free protein synthesis platforms for discovery and/or production of biologicals
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing Cell-Free Protein Synthesis (CFPS) technologies to enhance the development and production of peptide- and protein-based biologicals for the health industry. Key research topics include addressing bottlenecks in CFPS deployment, utilizing synthetic biology for designing novel biomolecules, and optimizing CFPS platforms to meet Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) for clinical-grade production. The integration of machine learning and artificial intelligence in biomolecule design and high-throughput screening is also emphasized, aiming to improve access to innovative health technologies and pharmaceuticals.

title: Prevention and management of chronic non-communicable diseases in children and young people (GACD)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on implementation research aimed at preventing and managing non-communicable diseases (NCDs) in children and young people, particularly in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs) and underserved populations in high-income countries (HICs). Key research topics include strategies for early prevention, risk reduction, and timely diagnosis of NCDs, as well as the adaptation and scaling of effective interventions. Proposals should emphasize community engagement, policy evaluation, and the integration of social determinants of health to improve health outcomes and quality of life for affected populations.

title: Development of predictive biomarkers of disease progression and treatment response by using AI methodologies for chronic non-communicable diseases
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development and clinical validation of predictive biomarkers for chronic non-communicable diseases, utilizing established AI methodologies to enhance disease progression assessment and treatment response. Key research topics include the integration of multimodal biomarkers, the establishment of a biomarker validation platform, and the creation of trustworthy AI tools to improve personalized medicine and clinical outcomes. Proposals should emphasize collaboration, data integration, and compliance with regulatory standards while addressing the unmet clinical needs in this area.

title: Clinical trials for advancing innovative interventions for neurodegenerative diseases
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing research and innovative interventions for neurodegenerative diseases, emphasizing the need for effective treatments that address underlying causes rather than just symptoms. Key areas of interest include conducting early-stage clinical trials, utilizing state-of-the-art technologies (such as AI and wearable devices), and integrating diverse data sources while adhering to FAIR principles. Additionally, the call highlights the importance of stakeholder engagement, including patients and caregivers, to ensure that interventions are tailored to their needs and promote improved quality of life.

title: Portable and versatile Point-of-care diagnostics
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing Point-of-Care (PoC) medical diagnostics to enhance healthcare delivery by providing faster, more accurate diagnostic tools that improve therapeutic decision-making and health outcomes. Key research topics include the development of sensitive, selective, and user-friendly PoC devices that meet WHO criteria, the integration of mobile technologies and AI for data analysis, and the optimization of these devices for clinical validation, particularly in resource-limited settings. Proposals should address the challenges of PoC diagnostics for both infectious and non-communicable diseases, emphasizing the need for effective clinical studies and value-based assessments.

title: Innovative healthcare interventions for non-communicable diseases
summary_text: This grant call focuses on developing innovative healthcare interventions to reduce the burden of specific Non-Communicable Diseases (NCDs) such as cardiovascular diseases, diabetes, chronic respiratory diseases, and chronic kidney diseases. Key research topics include conducting early-stage clinical trials to validate these interventions, utilizing digital technologies for disease management, integrating health data infrastructures, and ensuring stakeholder engagement, particularly with patients and caregivers. Additionally, proposals should address health-economic assessments and consider social sciences to enhance the societal impact of the research.

title: Combining conventional and innovative construction materials, products and techniques for sustainable and beautiful buildings
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing innovative hybrid building solutions that integrate conventional and innovative construction materials, products, and techniques to enhance sustainability, performance, and architectural quality in the built environment. Key research topics include the use of bio-based and circular materials, 3D printing, and the adaptation of traditional construction methods, with an emphasis on optimizing construction processes, ensuring compliance with safety standards, and incorporating circularity principles. Additionally, the proposals should adopt a participatory and transdisciplinary approach, engaging various stakeholders and integrating social sciences to maximize societal impact.

title: Revitalising neighbourhoods around existing railway and motorway corridors
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing and demonstrating innovative solutions to mitigate the negative environmental, ecological, economic, social, and health impacts of active railway lines and motorways on surrounding neighborhoods. Key research topics include revitalizing these areas to enhance livability, inclusivity, safety, and biodiversity, while employing a participatory and transdisciplinary approach that engages various stakeholders. Additionally, proposals should assess the effectiveness of implemented measures, identify barriers to their adoption, and ensure scalability and replicability through best practices.

title: Novel combinations of knowledge and researchâ€¯methods to address social issues and advance a fair green transition of neighbourhoods
summary_text: The grant call focuses on addressing social issues that impact the green transition in neighborhoods, such as affordable housing, energy poverty, and access to green spaces. It emphasizes the need for innovative, transdisciplinary approaches that integrate knowledge from local communities and non-scientific actors with scientific research to develop solutions that promote fairness and inclusion in the green transition. Proposals should aim to validate these approaches across diverse neighborhoods and provide guidelines for their application in decision-making and public service design.

title: Intergenerational neighbourhoods and communities aligned with the New European Bauhaus
summary_text: The research topics focus on developing methodologies and solutions for creating intergenerational neighborhoods and communities that address the needs of various age groups while promoting sustainability. Key areas of interest include measuring intergenerational living, exploring barriers to such living arrangements, and implementing adaptable solutions that enhance community spaces and services. The proposals should adopt a participatory and transdisciplinary approach, integrating social sciences and humanities to ensure meaningful societal impact.

title: Mass customisation of offsite manufactured modular construction components to transform the existing built environment
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and demonstration of innovative solutions for the mass customization of offsite manufactured modular construction components, aimed at enhancing sustainability and local cultural heritage in the built environment. Proposals should explore technologies such as distributed manufacturing and building information modeling (BIM), and evaluate the economic, aesthetic, environmental, social, and cultural impacts of these solutions across various application areas. Additionally, a participatory and transdisciplinary approach is emphasized, integrating social sciences and humanities to maximize societal impact.

title: Anticipating the long-term future of neighbourhoods in line with the New European Bauhaus
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing and validating a participatory foresight approach to enhance the long-term planning and resilience of existing neighborhoods in Europe. Key research topics include analyzing socioeconomic, cultural, demographic, and climatic conditions, creating future scenarios and visions for neighborhoods, and fostering the participation of diverse local stakeholders, particularly marginalized groups. The initiative aims to integrate social sciences and humanities expertise to inform local authorities and decision-makers on sustainable and inclusive neighborhood development.

title: Innovative models for collective community investment and ownership
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing innovative community investment and ownership models that empower diverse local stakeholders, particularly marginalized groups, to co-create and manage local assets such as commercial and housing developments. Proposals should aim to implement and validate these models in multiple neighborhoods, assess their socioeconomic and environmental impacts, and address systemic challenges to their adoption. A participatory and transdisciplinary approach is emphasized, integrating social sciences and humanities to enhance societal impact.

title: Sustainable, beautiful and healthy construction and renovation sites
summary_text: The key research topics focus on assessing the negative environmental, ecological, and health impacts of construction and renovation sites on surrounding ecosystems and communities. Proposals should aim to develop and validate solutions that mitigate these effects, including addressing visual impacts, and provide guidance for construction ecosystem actors. Additionally, a participatory and transdisciplinary approach is emphasized, incorporating social sciences and humanities to enhance societal impact.

title: The transformative potential of co-governance in the green transition of neighbourhoods
summary_text: The research topics focus on enhancing public participation in the green transition of neighborhoods through co-governance approaches that balance interests and empower marginalized groups. Key areas include the integration of digital tools for inclusive decision-making, the role of cultural institutions in fostering civic engagement, and the application of more-than-human perspectives to address climate, biodiversity, and pollution challenges. The aim is to develop evidence-based guidance for policymakers and local actors to support sustainable and equitable neighborhood transformations.

title: Towards Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) for healthcare
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing the development and application of frontier Artificial Intelligence (AI) models in healthcare, emphasizing the integration of multimodal health data for personalized medicine. Key research topics include the creation of a collaborative roadmap for AI model development, the identification and curation of relevant datasets, and the establishment of community-building activities among multidisciplinary stakeholders to foster ethical and effective AI innovations in the health sector. The initiative aims to leverage high-performance computing and existing EU resources to enhance patient outcomes through advanced AI solutions.

title: Advancing bio-printing of living cells for regenerative medicine
summary_text: This grant call focuses on advancing tissue-specific functional 3D bio-printing technologies for regenerative medicine, particularly for the repair of internal organs and complex tissues. Key research topics include the development of bio-printing equipment for high cell-density constructs, in-situ bio-printing techniques, and the integration of these technologies into clinical settings. Proposals should emphasize multidisciplinary collaboration and address regulatory compliance for clinical studies, targeting unmet medical needs across various therapeutic areas.

title: Virtual Human Twins (VHTs) for integrated clinical decision support in prevention and diagnosis
summary_text: This grant call focuses on developing and utilizing multi-scale, multi-organ "Virtual Human Twin" (VHT) models to enhance personalized prevention and diagnostics in healthcare, particularly in high disease burden areas. Key research topics include the integration of complex disease modeling, the use of advanced computational methodologies (such as AI and biophysics-based modeling), and the evaluation of these models in clinical settings to improve decision support and health outcomes. Proposals should emphasize multidisciplinary approaches, user-centered design, and collaboration with existing EU health initiatives.

title: Community of practice - Data-Driven Decision-Making in Energy
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing cooperation and knowledge sharing in data and analytics for the planning and operation of European electricity grids, particularly in integrating renewable energy sources (RES). Projects should aim to develop innovative open-source solutions and tools, promote the use of AI and digital twins, and establish a collaborative ecosystem among stakeholders in the energy sector to improve grid management and operational efficiency. Additionally, there is an emphasis on maintaining research results in a FAIR manner and fostering open-source practices across the energy value chain.

title: Industrial processes and equipment for innovative, reliable and scalable tandem technologies (EUPI-PV Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and commercialization of tandem photovoltaic (PV) technologies that exceed the efficiency limits of traditional silicon-based systems. Proposals should aim to demonstrate large-scale engineering of interfaces and thin films, as well as production processes suitable for mass deployment, contributing to the EU's solar energy goals and strengthening the European solar manufacturing sector. Additionally, projects must include a robust strategy for the exploitation and dissemination of results, emphasizing scalability and commercialization.

title: Delivery of industrial CCUS clusters â€“ Societal Readiness pilot
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing near-to-market solutions for the safe integration and use of Carbon Capture, Utilization, and Storage (CCUS) technologies in energy- and carbon-intensive industries. Key research topics include planning for retrofitting capture systems, demonstrating system components, optimizing industrial symbiosis, and assessing transport options for CO2 infrastructure. Additionally, projects should engage with diverse social groups to address societal concerns and ensure public acceptability, while also considering the economic and technical aspects of regional CO2 transport networks and geological storage services.

title: Advanced Distribution Management Systems (ADSM) for more efficient and flexible distribution grids
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the reliability, resilience, and efficiency of electricity distribution grids through innovative solutions and architectures for Advanced Distribution Management Systems (ADMS). Projects should aim to improve grid performance and controllability, facilitate the integration of distributed energy resources (DERs), advance forecasting and analytics, and enhance interoperability among Distribution System Operators (DSOs) and Transmission System Operators (TSOs). Additionally, the use of digital twins, artificial intelligence, and open-source software solutions is encouraged, along with the development of best practices for system operation and security against cyber threats.

title: Advanced TSO control rooms to enhance grid observability, stability and resilience
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the reliability, resilience, and efficiency of electricity transmission grids through innovative solutions for Transmission System Operators (TSOs). This includes the design and testing of advanced control room technologies, improved observability and forecasting capabilities, and the integration of digital solutions such as artificial intelligence and digital twins. Additionally, the projects aim to develop interoperability between TSOs and other entities, facilitate data-driven operations, and address the challenges of grid congestion and renewable energy integration.

title: PV based electrification of the economy: Designing & optimising PV systems supporting industrial electrification and promoting participation in electricity markets (EUPI-PV Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and implementation of high-voltage direct current (DC) photovoltaic (PV) systems, aiming to enhance efficiency and reduce costs for industrial users. Additionally, the integration of PV systems into electricity markets through participation in ancillary services is emphasized, promoting energy efficiency and flexibility. Proposals should address system architecture design, hybrid solutions for load management, and the economic viability of these systems, including business models and risk mitigation strategies.

title: Integrated Approaches for Retrofitting Infrastructures with Innovative Energy Storage Technologies
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and demonstration of innovative and improved energy storage technologies that are cost-effective, sustainable, and circular. Proposals should emphasize the integration of these technologies with retrofitting existing obsolete infrastructures, such as old hydropower dams and decommissioned power plants, to enhance grid flexibility while ensuring socioeconomic and environmental sustainability. Additionally, projects must incorporate security measures into the design of energy systems and engage with stakeholders to address potential environmental impacts.

title: Demonstration of hydropower technologies for efficient and forward-looking refurbishment of existing hydropower plants
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the flexibility and sustainability of hydropower systems to support a renewables-based electricity grid. This includes the modernization of hydropower technology, such as innovative turbine designs, digitalization for improved control and operational strategies, and the development of new materials to increase efficiency and resilience. Additionally, the research aims to address climate change adaptation challenges, ensuring socio-economic and environmental sustainability while considering biodiversity and integrated water management.

title: New primitives and protocols for functionalities of future hybrid classical-hybrid and quantum networks
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing research in quantum cryptography beyond Quantum Key Distribution (QKD), emphasizing the development of new quantum primitives and protocols that integrate classical cryptographic approaches. Key areas of interest include the analysis of quantum information processing tasks, the connection between quantum computing and cryptography, and the creation of a roadmap for the future of quantum networks. Proposals should aim to demonstrate quantum cryptographic advantages, improve performance, and address the challenges of scaling applications in hybrid classical-quantum environments.

title: Artificial Intelligence for Cybersecurity applications
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing AI-driven solutions in cybersecurity, specifically for real-time threat detection, adaptive defense mechanisms, and enhancing Security Operation Centres. Key research topics include developing resilient and transparent AI systems that can evolve with dynamic cyber threats, addressing adversarial AI risks, and ensuring compliance with regulatory frameworks like the AI Act. Proposals should explore novel machine learning techniques for anomaly detection and improving situational awareness in cybersecurity contexts.

title: Secure Computing Continuum (IoT, Edge, Cloud, Data spaces)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing security and resilience against cyber threats in interconnected systems, particularly within distributed computing environments such as IoT, edge computing, and cloud infrastructures. Key research topics include the development of advanced security solutions that incorporate privacy-preserving mechanisms, improving interoperability of security measures across different computing layers, and implementing robust zero-trust architectures. Proposals should also address challenges related to data integrity, anomaly detection, and the integration of lightweight cryptographic techniques, including post-quantum cryptography, to ensure comprehensive protection of sensitive data throughout its lifecycle.

title: Secure PQC implementations, Cryptanalysis and Post-quantum Digital Trust
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development of robust post-quantum cryptography (PQC) implementations that can resist various implementation attacks, including side-channel and fault attacks, as well as the design of automated security evaluation tools. Additional areas of interest include the analysis of quantum hardness in mathematical problems, advancements in quantum algorithms, and the creation of new digital signatures and key encapsulation mechanisms to enhance privacy-friendly applications and digital trust systems. Proposals should also explore formal verification methodologies and the impact of AI on both attacks and the security of PQC systems.

title: Reducing soil sealing through sustainable urban and territorial design in the New European Bauhaus
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing innovative and regenerative planning and spatial design solutions that adhere to the New European Bauhaus principles of sustainability, aesthetics, and inclusivity. Key research topics include preventing soil sealing, improving soil health, supporting food systems transformation, enhancing climate resilience, and promoting biodiversity through nature-based and community-centered approaches. Proposals should emphasize participatory processes, cross-sector collaboration, and the scalability of solutions across diverse territorial contexts in urban, peri-urban, and rural areas, while also addressing effective funding models and policy frameworks to support these initiatives.

title: Toward a comprehensive assessment of the disturbance of marine ecosystems by anthropogenic underwater noise
