summary_text: The key research topics focus on understanding the impacts of continuous and impulsive underwater noise on marine organisms, ecosystems, and the services they provide, while considering regional differences. Proposals should aim to develop and enhance scientific methods and tools for monitoring and assessing these impacts, including cumulative effects, and to investigate mitigation measures for protecting ecosystem services such as carbon sequestration. Additionally, the research should align with the objectives of the Marine Strategy Framework Directive and support initiatives aimed at reducing underwater noise pollution to promote a quieter ocean.

title: Improving circularity of multilayer flexible plastic food contact packaging
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing recyclable food packaging solutions, particularly mono-material multilayer flexible plastics, to enhance their end-of-life collection, sorting, and recycling into food contact-compliant materials. The proposals should aim to improve eco-design, implement digital solutions for circularity, and demonstrate effective recycling technologies while ensuring compliance with food safety regulations. Additionally, the engagement of the entire value chain, from raw material producers to recyclers, is essential to evaluate the economic, environmental, and social impacts of these innovations.

title: Supporting pre-normative research for standardization of the bio-based products
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the sustainability and competitiveness of the bio-based industry through ecodesign and standardization. Key research topics include developing knowledge and technologies for bio-based products, identifying gaps in standardization, and fostering collaboration among stakeholders to create circular bio-based value chains. The initiative aims to improve environmental sustainability, reduce ecological impact, and align with EU policies on bioeconomy and circular economy.

title: Understanding biomass flows in Europe
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the understanding and sustainable management of various biomass types, addressing their environmental, social, and economic implications. Key research topics include improving biomass monitoring and assessment methods, optimizing biomass supply and demand, and developing innovative digital tools for resource efficiency. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need to restore ecosystems, protect biodiversity, and ensure food security while meeting the growing demand for biomass through sustainable practices and circular economy principles.

title: Developing methods to assess the presence, functions and sensitivity of groundwater ecosystems
summary_text: The research topics focus on improving knowledge and assessment of groundwater ecosystems, including their biodiversity, functions, and sensitivity to pollutants. Key areas include developing innovative methods for characterizing these ecosystems, establishing standardized ecotoxicity assessment protocols, and identifying biological and chemical quality elements for future ecological status classification. The aim is to enhance protection measures for groundwater resources and their dependent ecosystems, while ensuring data produced is accessible and reusable.

title: Advanced recovery of critical raw materials from Waste from Electrical and Electronic Equipment (WEEE)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the recovery and recycling of critical raw materials (CRMs) from waste electrical and electronic equipment (WEEE) to support a circular economy in Europe. Key research topics include the development of innovative and economically viable recycling technologies, including AI and bio-inspired methods, to improve collection, sorting, and recovery processes for valuable materials like rare earth elements and precious metals. Additionally, the call emphasizes establishing standards and processes to ensure the quality and safety of recycled materials, thereby fostering a sustainable waste market and reducing environmental impacts.

title: Understanding and tackling the decline of insects
summary_text: The grant call focuses on understanding insect diversity, population trends, and the drivers of their decline, emphasizing the need for improved knowledge of less studied insect groups. It aims to assess the ecosystem services provided by insects, develop long-term monitoring schemes, and devise strategies to mitigate the decline of insect populations. Additionally, the call encourages the integration of genomic approaches, multidisciplinary frameworks, and collaboration with existing biodiversity monitoring initiatives to enhance data accessibility and promote effective conservation practices.

title: Harnessing the unique properties of marine organisms to deliver sustainable blue bio-based products
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development of safe and sustainable blue bio-based products derived from marine organisms, emphasizing the exploration of their unique properties for applications in various industries. Key research topics include the creation of environmentally friendly alternatives to hazardous chemicals, the assessment of safety and effectiveness of these products, and the incorporation of synthetic and engineering biology approaches. Additionally, proposals should address regulatory and market challenges, promote biodiversity conservation, and ensure ethical considerations in the use of marine resources.

title: Advancing integrated scenarios and prediction models for informing transition to a nature positive society
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing knowledge of ecosystem responses to human-induced pressures, emphasizing the development of integrated scenarios, predictive models, and model intercomparison frameworks. Key research topics include the interactions between biodiversity, climate, and socio-economic factors, as well as the creation of comprehensive ecosystem prediction models applicable across various ecosystems. Proposals should also address socio-economic transitions, equity considerations, and involve stakeholder engagement to ensure the relevance and applicability of the developed frameworks for policy and long-term planning.

title: Balancing food security, bioeconomy, climate and biodiversity objectives to unlock sustainable value chains
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the intersection of bioeconomy, nature markets, and sustainable agriculture, emphasizing the need for strategies that balance market incentives with food security and environmental protection. Proposals should explore natural capital accounting, innovative business models for farmers, and interdisciplinary assessments of economic, social, and environmental impacts, particularly regarding biomass utilization and land-use conflicts. Additionally, the research should provide policy recommendations that align bioeconomy, climate, and biodiversity goals while ensuring fair income opportunities for farmers.

title: Pushing the frontier of knowledge and conservation action for deep sea ecosystems
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the understanding and management of deep-sea ecosystems, which are critical for global biodiversity and biogeochemical cycles. Key research topics include habitat mapping, species inventory, and ecological functioning in deep-sea environments, particularly in the bathypelagic and abyssopelagic zones. Proposals should aim to develop innovative technologies for species identification, assess the impacts of climate change and anthropogenic stressors, and establish monitoring frameworks to inform conservation strategies and adaptive management approaches for deep-sea areas.

title: Advancing recycling technologies for mixed post-consumer textiles waste from blended products
summary_text: The research topics focus on innovative solutions for the end-of-life management of textile products, particularly addressing the recycling of post-consumer blended textiles. Key areas include developing technologies for fibre-to-fibre recycling, improving the quality and durability of secondary textile materials, and enhancing waste management practices. Additionally, the proposals should explore techniques for disassembling complex textile products, assess recyclability limits, and advance recycling technologies that mitigate harmful chemicals and microplastics, all while adhering to sustainability principles and lifecycle assessments.

title: Bioremediation of Ukraineâ€™s ecosystems contaminated by conflicts
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing innovative biotechnology and Nature-based Solutions (NbS) to address severe environmental degradation in Ukraine caused by conflicts. Key research topics include assessing soil contamination, adapting bioremediation techniques, and implementing cost-effective solutions like phytoremediation to restore ecosystems and improve resilience to climate change. Additionally, the proposals should evaluate the social impacts of these interventions and ensure collaboration with local stakeholders and international partners.

title: Demonstrating and deploying innovative collection, sorting-for-reuse and repair systems for textiles at city/region level (Circular Cities and Regions Initiative topic)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing and implementing innovative solutions for textile reuse and repair practices at the local and regional levels, promoting circular economy strategies, and enhancing public awareness and participation. The initiative aims to optimize municipal waste collection and sorting systems, improve data transparency in textile waste flows, and encourage collaboration among citizens, businesses, and social enterprises. Additionally, it emphasizes the importance of evaluating the environmental, economic, and social impacts of these solutions while supporting broader European sustainability goals.

title: Bio-based innovation in society: supporting the sustainable way of living
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development of innovative bio-based products and services that leverage biotechnology and biomanufacturing to promote sustainability and socio-economic transformation. Emphasis is placed on creating user-friendly solutions that reduce environmental impact, enhance public understanding of bio-based innovations, and assess new socio-economic models for circular systems, incorporating aspects of social justice and inclusion. Additionally, the proposals should foster collaboration among various stakeholders, including SMEs, civil society, and SSH experts, to ensure broad societal benefits and effective market deployment.

title: Ensuring continuous effectiveness of protected areas in conserving habitats and species while facing intensifying drivers of biodiversity loss
summary_text: The research topics focus on enhancing the effectiveness of protected areas in conserving biodiversity amidst increasing threats such as climate change, pollution, and habitat loss. Key areas of investigation include analyzing trends and cumulative impacts of biodiversity loss drivers, developing predictive tools for future impacts on protected habitats and species, and exploring innovative management practices and adaptive approaches for conservation. The proposals should also emphasize long-term ecological monitoring and involve collaboration with public authorities and civil society to align research outcomes with societal needs.

title: Boosting agrobiodiversity for food security and sustainable competitiveness
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing agrobiodiversity to improve agricultural resilience, food security, and farmer incomes. Proposals should quantify the economic impacts of agrobiodiversity, develop strategies for scaling diversified practices, and create decision support tools to mitigate risks associated with diversification. Additionally, the research should explore pathways for valorizing diverse agricultural products and engage multiple stakeholders to ensure effective implementation and alignment with EU agricultural and biodiversity policies.

title: Advancing the European bio-based innovation enabled by biotechnology and biomanufacturing concepts
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing biotechnology, life sciences, and biomanufacturing innovations to support sustainable and circular value chains, with an emphasis on decarbonization and environmental sustainability. Key research topics include the development of synthetic biology, gene editing, metabolic engineering, and biofoundry approaches, alongside the integration of digital technologies like AI and bioinformatics. Proposals should also explore the convergence of these biotechnological advancements with Nature-based Solutions for environmental applications, while ensuring stakeholder engagement and compliance with sustainability principles.

title: Developing managed aquifer recharge techniques (MAR) in a rural context
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing managed aquifer recharge (MAR) techniques to improve water supply and resilience in agriculture amidst increasing droughts due to climate change. This includes developing methodologies for site assessment, creating monitoring systems for groundwater quality, evaluating the sustainability of MAR techniques, and proposing business models for farmer compensation. Additionally, the research aims to strengthen water ecosystems and provide policy insights for improving agricultural water resilience in the EU.

title: Bioeconomy policy support hub for Member States, regions and sectors
summary_text: The grant call focuses on establishing a European Bioeconomy Policy Support Hub to enhance the development and implementation of bioeconomy policies across Member States and regions. Key research topics include innovative approaches for policy support, assessment tools for bioeconomy strategies, and the facilitation of dialogue among stakeholders in the quadruple helix (government, sectors, research & innovation, society). The aim is to increase awareness, improve collaboration, and advance skills related to bioeconomy initiatives, while also monitoring the uptake of bioeconomy solutions in various sectors.

title: Additional activities for the European Partnership of Agriculture of Data
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the continuation and enhancement of the European Partnership of Agriculture of Data, emphasizing the need for additional activities and partnerships to support agricultural data initiatives. Key research topics include the development of tools and solutions for farmers and stakeholders, the integration of research and innovation initiatives, and the promotion of synergies across national research programs to improve the European data landscape. The proposal should also address international collaborations and leverage European research infrastructures in the fields of environment, food, and digital domains.

title: Living labs for co-creating solutions for the restoration of ecosystems
summary_text: The grant call focuses on empowering stakeholders to implement effective ecosystem restoration measures in line with the EU Nature Restoration Regulation and the EU biodiversity strategy for 2030. Key research topics include the establishment of living labs for co-creation of innovative restoration solutions, assessment of ecosystem health, and demonstration of social, economic, and environmental co-benefits of restoration activities. Specific ecosystems of interest include transitional marine-coastal-terrestrial interfaces, urban-rural gradients, mosaic agricultural landscapes, biodiversity corridors, and dryland ecosystems, with an emphasis on multi-actor collaboration and the integration of social sciences to enhance societal impact.

title: Unlocking the potential of citizen action for nature protection and restoration
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing citizen engagement in nature conservation and restoration, aiming to create new business opportunities aligned with EU biodiversity objectives. Key research topics include developing innovative approaches for citizen-led conservation activities, creating toolkits for species conservation, and implementing social incentives to encourage active participation. The proposals should also emphasize inclusivity, engage local communities, and integrate social sciences to maximize societal impact.

title: Deploying circular systemic solutions through living labs in cities and regions (Circular Cities and Regions Initiative topic)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing circular economy initiatives at local and regional levels, aiming to enhance circularity, reduce greenhouse gas emissions, and improve air and water quality while preserving biodiversity. It emphasizes the establishment of living labs to foster collaboration among diverse stakeholders, including public authorities, businesses, and citizens, to co-create and implement innovative circular solutions. Additionally, the call encourages knowledge transfer and scalability of successful practices across Europe, aligning with broader EU environmental and economic strategies.

title: Open topic: Using the Circular Cities and Regions Initiative to strengthen urban manufacturing in support of the Clean Industrial Deal
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing resource efficiency in urban manufacturing through circular material use and sustainable practices, contributing to EU climate and biodiversity goals. The initiative aims to support the clean transition in energy-intensive industries by developing circular systemic solutions that address environmental challenges and promote local production. Additionally, it emphasizes collaboration with local authorities and civil society, integrating social sciences to enhance societal impact and resilience in urban economies.

title: Open topic: Uncovering the causes of specific speciesâ€™ rapid decline and exploring actionable solutions
summary_text: The key research topics focus on understanding the drivers behind the decline of specific species, particularly those that were once common but are now threatened or endangered. Proposals should aim to develop innovative solutions to prevent further declines and promote recovery, while also supporting the EU biodiversity strategy for 2030 and the Kunming-Montreal Global Biodiversity Framework. Additionally, the research should include long-term ecological monitoring and provide policy recommendations to enhance conservation efforts across various ecosystems.

title: Decontaminate and bioremediate aquatic pollution
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing effective bioremediation and decontamination solutions for aquatic pollution, particularly targeting contaminants of emerging concern (CECs) such as PFAS, antimicrobial substances, and microplastics. The scientific focus areas include the use of life sciences and biotechnology, particularly microbial communities and nanoparticles, to enhance pollutant degradation, as well as improving monitoring and management tools for aquatic ecosystems. Additionally, the research aims to better understand the interactions of pollutants within aquatic environments and their impact on ecosystem resilience to climate change and biodiversity loss.

title: Mainstreaming and scaling-up evidence-based Nature-Based Solutions towards a nature positive and climate-resilient economy
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the understanding and integration of Nature-based Solutions (NbS) across various sectors, including energy, water management, and transport, to promote ecosystem conservation and climate resilience. Key research topics include assessing the long-term effectiveness and economic viability of NbS, developing adaptive management strategies, and facilitating collaboration among stakeholders to support evidence-based decision-making. Proposals should aim to address knowledge gaps, evaluate the environmental, social, and economic impacts of NbS, and align with major EU policies and frameworks for biodiversity and climate adaptation.

title: Open topic: Develop Earth Intelligence solutions using environmental observations and state-of-the-art AI for sustainable competitiveness and policy making
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing AI-based Earth Intelligence tools that integrate Earth Observation data and socio-economic information to support evidence-based decision-making in environmental policy and sustainability. Key research topics include the creation of applications for climate-related risks, environmental hazards, and biodiversity reporting, utilizing advanced AI approaches and digital twins. Proposals should emphasize user engagement, demonstrate the robustness and replicability of their solutions, and explore business models for scaling their products in collaboration with relevant initiatives.

title: Open topic: Improving the competitiveness of the agricultural sector by enhancing the efficient and sustainable use of agricultural production factors
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the efficiency and sustainability of EU farming systems through the development and testing of innovative agricultural practices and prototypes. Key research topics include improving the sustainable use of production factors, assessing the environmental and economic impacts of these innovations, and identifying barriers to their adoption. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of a multi-actor approach involving various stakeholders, including farmers and researchers, to facilitate the commercialization and dissemination of new farming practices aligned with EU agricultural policies.

title: Open topic: Boosting organic farming for a competitive, sustainable and resilient farming sector
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the competitiveness, sustainability, and resilience of the organic farming sector in Europe through research and innovation. Key research topics include the development of viable innovations and practices for agronomic and sustainability challenges, knowledge exchange among stakeholders, and the establishment of testing sites across diverse pedo-climatic conditions. The initiative aims to support the EU's regulatory framework and policies related to organic farming, biodiversity, and climate, while promoting collaboration among various actors in the organic agri-food value chain.

title: Living labs to enhance soil health in Alpine and Atlantic biogeographical regions
summary_text: The grant call focuses on establishing living labs to enhance soil health by 2030, aiming to create 100 such labs across Europe. Key research topics include participatory and interdisciplinary approaches to co-develop soil health solutions, improved soil health monitoring, and the creation of standardized soil data. The initiative also emphasizes the importance of collaboration among diverse stakeholders, including land managers, researchers, and policymakers, to address soil health challenges across various land uses and ensure the sustainability of solutions.

title: Living labs to enhance soil health in managed forests and in natural/semi-natural lands
summary_text: The grant call focuses on establishing living labs to enhance soil health in managed forests and natural/semi-natural lands, aiming to create 100 such labs by 2030. Key research topics include participatory and interdisciplinary approaches to co-develop soil health solutions, improved soil health monitoring, and the dissemination of practice-oriented knowledge for land managers. The initiative also emphasizes the importance of integrating local needs into policy-making and fostering a sustainable forest bioeconomy to support biodiversity and climate change mitigation.

title: Flagship-pilot: large-scale demonstrations of CCAM (CCAM Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing Connected, Cooperative, and Automated Mobility (CCAM) through large-scale demonstrations and validation of user-oriented systems for both people and goods in mixed traffic environments. Key research topics include the integration of advanced technologies (such as AI and V2X), the assessment of operational design domains for automated vehicles, and the exploration of viable business models to ensure sustainability and scalability of CCAM solutions. Additionally, the initiative emphasizes the importance of societal engagement, regulatory compliance, and the development of safe, efficient, and environmentally friendly mobility services.

title: Increasing competitiveness and resilience of multimodal freight transport and logistics for competitive supply chains
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the competitiveness and sustainability of European multimodal freight transport networks through the development of advanced tools and solutions. This includes real-time visibility and predictive analytics for multimodal services, improved integration of multimodal data, and the application of emerging technologies like Artificial Intelligence and the Internet of Things. Additionally, the research aims to address disruptions in supply chains, explore synchromodality strategies, and validate solutions through large-scale pilots, while also assessing regulatory frameworks to facilitate the adoption of multimodal transport solutions.

title: Geopolitical competition and socioeconomic resilience in CCAM: an innovation and policy roadmap for EU leadership (CCAM Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on assessing Europe's competitive position in Connected, Cooperative, and Automated Mobility (CCAM) within a global context, identifying vulnerabilities and opportunities in business models, supply chains, and technological capabilities. The initiative aims to develop stakeholder-driven future scenarios and strategic pathways using advanced foresight methods, while also analyzing the socioeconomic impacts of CCAM deployment on employment, equity, and regional growth. Additionally, the project seeks to create robust governance models and business strategies that enhance Europe's leadership and resilience in CCAM, ensuring adaptability to geopolitical and economic changes.

title: Road Safety and resilience of rural areas
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing road safety and resilience on rural roads in the EU, particularly through the implementation of the Network-Wide Road Safety Assessment (NWRSA) methodology for all rural roads. The initiative aims to develop innovative enforcement strategies, prevention measures to reduce road fatalities and serious injuries, and tools for local authorities to address climate-related risks and extreme weather impacts on road safety. Additionally, the research emphasizes the importance of understanding road user behavior, particularly among vulnerable populations, and promoting safer driving practices through tailored interventions.

title: Enhanced resilience in multimodal passenger transport through digital technologies and generative and discriminative AI
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the resilience of passenger transport systems through the development of real-time data analytics, predictive maintenance strategies using Generative AI, and guidelines for managing disruptions. The scientific focus areas include leveraging digital technologies for disruption prediction, integrating data from various sources for decision-making, and conducting safety assessments in multimodal transport contexts. Additionally, proposals should emphasize user-friendly solutions and ensure compliance with EU frameworks for data sharing and accessibility.

title: Supporting sustainable and smart urban mobility in Europe (CIVITAS)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing sustainable urban mobility through the dissemination and implementation of innovative solutions derived from EU and national projects, particularly within the CIVITAS initiative. Key research topics include the development of effective urban mobility systems, capacity building for local authorities, fostering collaboration among stakeholders, and optimizing knowledge exchange platforms to support the deployment of smart mobility solutions. The initiative aims to address barriers to innovation in urban mobility, promote mutual learning, and strengthen the European urban mobility innovation ecosystem.

title: Generative AI for smarter CCAM: enhancing perception, decision-making, and validation (CCAM Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and integration of advanced, energy-efficient perception systems for Connected, Cooperative, and Automated Mobility (CCAM), leveraging Generative AI (GenAI) to enhance situational awareness and decision-making. Specific areas of interest include improving safety for Vulnerable Road Users (VRUs), enhancing the robustness of CCAM systems through virtual testing and scenario generation, and developing tools for real-time perception and decision-making that address latency, security, and reliability challenges. Additionally, the research aims to explore the limitations and benefits of GenAI in mobility technology, promoting collaboration with existing initiatives and ensuring the integration of ethical considerations in AI applications.

title: Integrated Production and Product Development for Next-Generation Lithium-based Batteries for Mobility (BATT4EU and Made in Europe Partnerships)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing next-generation lithium-based battery technologies, specifically targeting the scaling-up of production processes for semi and all-solid state batteries. Key research topics include the optimization of anode and cathode materials, development of high-throughput manufacturing methods, and integration of battery modules and packs for various transport modes such as automotive, aviation, rail, and waterborne applications. Additionally, projects should address performance metrics, safety, and sustainability in line with regulatory standards, while fostering EU competitiveness in the battery value chain.

title: Structurally addressing homelessness through coordinated social infrastructure and services in neighbourhoods
summary_text: The research topics focus on developing a system-based approach to address homelessness at the neighborhood level by analyzing the availability and accessibility of social infrastructure and services, particularly for marginalized and chronically homeless groups. Key areas of investigation include assessing the impact of built environment design on homelessness, strategies for coordinating social services, and evaluating community integration and socioeconomic impacts. Proposals should adopt a participatory and transdisciplinary approach, involving social sciences and humanities to enhance societal impact.

title: Sustainable, inclusive, affordable and beautiful solutions for thermal comfort in buildings
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing and demonstrating innovative solutions for achieving thermal comfort in buildings through vernacular principles, nature-based solutions, bioclimatic design, and frugal innovation. The aim is to reduce life cycle greenhouse gas emissions and costs while enhancing accessibility and aesthetic appeal, particularly for vulnerable populations. Proposals should also address barriers to implementation and scalability, and promote a participatory and transdisciplinary approach involving various stakeholders.

title: Innovative approaches for the spatial design of neighbourhoods
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the design and transformation of public spaces in neighborhoods, emphasizing the integration of user perspectives to enhance climate resilience, social cohesion, and inclusivity. Key research topics include assessing the impact of spatial design on diverse user experiences, developing innovative design methods that reflect local sociocultural factors, and ensuring accessibility and safety for all community members. Proposals should adopt a participatory and transdisciplinary approach, demonstrating their methods in various neighborhood contexts and addressing broader implications for the green transition.

title: Approaches to reuse vacant, obsolete or underutilised spaces
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the systematic identification and quantification of vacant, obsolete, or underutilised spaces in urban, peri-urban, and rural areas, with an emphasis on addressing local community challenges and needs. Proposals should explore the drivers of vacancy, assess the potential for reuse of these spaces, and engage community stakeholders through co-creation methods, while considering ecological, social, cultural, and economic impacts. Additionally, the research should aim to develop governance measures and funding mechanisms to support the sustainable reuse of these spaces, contributing to the EU's environmental goals and enhancing societal impact through interdisciplinary collaboration.

title: Understanding capital market dynamics for increased investment in New European Bauhaus projects in neighbourhoods
summary_text: The key research topics focus on understanding the capital market dynamics that influence investments in New European Bauhaus (NEB)-aligned projects for neighborhood transformation. This includes analyzing the size, diversity, risks, and barriers of capital supply and demand, as well as developing innovative investment solutions that leverage place-based impact investing and other diverse funding approaches. Additionally, the research aims to identify and mobilize various types of capital to support NEB-aligned projects while assessing their potential economic, social, cultural, and environmental returns.

title: Innovative solutions for the sustainable and beautiful use of vertical space
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing innovative solutions for utilizing under-used vertical spaces in urban environments to enhance housing availability and create green spaces. Key research topics include urban vertical farming, rooftop gardens, and multifunctional structures, with an emphasis on sustainability, circular economy principles, and assessing the social, environmental, and economic impacts of these solutions. Proposals should also address regulatory and societal barriers, involve community participation, and contribute to urban greening goals while fostering international cooperation and integrating social sciences and humanities expertise.

title: Advancing sustainable maintenance and repair measures for existing buildings
summary_text: The key research topics focus on extending the service life and improving the performance of existing buildings through sustainable maintenance and repair strategies. Proposals should develop decision-support tools for predictive maintenance, create maintenance packages that integrate circularity principles, and involve building users in the process. Additionally, the research should explore barriers to implementing predictive maintenance and promote a participatory approach that includes social sciences and humanities expertise to enhance societal impact.

title: Understanding inhabitantâ€™s experiences of neighbourhoods to support their health and well-being
summary_text: The research focuses on understanding how inhabitants experience their neighborhoods and the subsequent effects on their health and well-being. It aims to gather evidence on the sensory and emotional experiences of diverse populations, including marginalized groups, and how these experiences vary across different neighborhood characteristics. The findings will inform strategies for enhancing community belonging, supporting health, and guiding the green transition of neighborhoods towards nature-positive transformations and climate resilience.

title: Addressing homelessness through housing-led approaches aligned with the New European Bauhaus
summary_text: The research topics focus on developing and refining housing-led approaches to address homelessness in alignment with the New European Bauhaus (NEB) principles. Key areas include creating permanent housing solutions complemented by support services, integrating green transition strategies, and ensuring community reintegration for homeless populations. The proposals should emphasize participatory methodologies, address institutional barriers, and demonstrate adaptability across diverse urban, peri-urban, and rural neighborhoods in Europe.

title: MSCA COFUND 2026
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing research and innovation (R&I) capabilities through doctoral and postdoctoral training programs that develop transferable skills, foster interdisciplinary collaboration, and promote Open Science. Key research topics include the integration of digital technologies in research practices, knowledge valorisation, and societal engagement, with an emphasis on preparing candidates for diverse career paths in academia and beyond. The programs are encouraged to align with regional and national R&I strategies while ensuring quality supervision and transparent selection processes.

title: Novel solutions for off-grid storage of renewable energy for critical infrastructures
summary_text: The research topics focus on developing innovative, cost-effective off-grid energy storage solutions for renewable energy, specifically designed for critical infrastructures like hospitals and data centers. Key areas of emphasis include addressing challenges related to storage scale, resilience to material shortages, and multi-energy needs, while ensuring sustainability, efficiency, and operational robustness. Additionally, the projects should incorporate simulations and experiments to enhance energy security and resilience, particularly in the context of high-impact, low-probability events.

title: AI-driven forecasting algorithms for Grid and Consumer friendly Energy Sharing â€“ Societal Readiness pilot
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and testing of AI-driven forecasting algorithms and machine learning processes to optimize energy sharing and self-consumption in communities. Additionally, the projects aim to enhance grid balancing and consumer participation in decentralized energy systems, analyze social interactions through game-theoretic models, and improve the operation and maintenance of energy grids. There is also an emphasis on understanding the needs of diverse social groups to foster societal acceptance and trust in energy technologies.

title: Affordable and sustainable primary equipment for Future-Ready multi-terminal HVDC Systems
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and optimization of High Voltage Direct Current (HVDC) systems to enhance their performance, sustainability, and affordability in the context of Europe's energy transition. This includes investigating advanced equipment such as circuit breakers and cables that are lightweight, environmentally friendly, and reliable, as well as addressing challenges related to interoperability, supply chain resilience, and life-cycle environmental impacts. Additionally, projects should involve techno-economic assessments and contributions to standardization efforts to ensure the effective integration of these technologies into multi-terminal HVDC systems.

title: Targeting key value chain components for increasing the competitiveness of renewable energy technologies in Europe
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the competitiveness and security of Europe's clean energy system through research and innovation in renewable energy technology value chains. Key research topics include material efficiency and circularity, sustainable low-cost feedstock access, digital and AI tools for operational optimization, and the development of solutions to address bottlenecks and improve logistics and production pathways. Proposals should also consider the benefits of domestic ownership within these value chain solutions.

title: Industrial scale up and circularity pathway for IPV technologies (EUPI-PV Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and commercialization of Integrated PV (IPV) technologies, addressing challenges related to their diverse formats, materials, and technical constraints. The scientific focus areas include the demonstration of innovative IPV manufacturing processes at scale, the establishment of flexible production pilot lines, and the development of recycling processes for various IPV products. Additionally, the proposals should explore new business models and strategies for enhancing recyclability and minimizing environmental impacts associated with IPV technologies.

title: Grid-forming capabilities for more resilient and RES-based electricity grids
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the preparedness and resilience of electricity grids to accommodate increasing shares of renewable energy sources (RES) by 2030 and achieving full decarbonization by 2050. This includes developing advanced grid-forming inverters (GFIs) for improved system stability, innovative grid control solutions, and interoperability among different GFI technologies. Additionally, projects should leverage modern tools such as digital twins and artificial intelligence, while also addressing the standardization of technical requirements and best practices for transmission and distribution system operators (TSOs and DSOs).

title: Hybrid AI-Control Framework for a next-generation grid-scale energy storage and system integration
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and validation of advanced digital twin and AI technologies for proactive grid storage management, particularly in systems with high renewable energy integration. The projects aim to optimize energy storage operations and dispatch, enhance grid resilience, and improve cost efficiency while facilitating seamless integration with electricity markets and existing grid infrastructures. Additionally, the initiative emphasizes real-time management, scalability for cross-border operability, and the use of proof of concept studies to validate adaptive management algorithms.

title: Long-lifetime and optimised use of materials in recyclable Ag and In-free Si PV modules (EUPI-PV Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the sustainability and eco-design of crystalline silicon photovoltaic (PV) modules. This includes extending the lifetime of PV modules to 40 years, developing designs that incorporate recycled materials and eliminate the use of critical raw materials like silver and indium, and improving recyclability and repairability. Additionally, the research aims to establish new testing methodologies and recycling standards, as well as assess the environmental benefits of recycling precious metals from PV modules.

title: Development of direct recycling processes (BATT4EU Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing direct recycling technologies for next-generation battery chemistries, particularly low-value options like LFP, LMFP, and sodium-ion. Key research topics include improving recycling efficiency, reducing energy consumption, and developing scalable, automated processes for gigafactory production scrap. Proposals should also emphasize economic viability, sustainability assessments, and innovative approaches to enhance material recovery and integration into battery manufacturing.

title: Pre-commercial appraisal for CO2 aquifer storage
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the appraisal and development of pre-commercial CO2 geological storage sites, particularly in deep saline aquifers in Central, Eastern, and Southern Europe. The scientific focus areas include site identification, injection pilot tests to assess reservoir injectivity, and ensuring compliance with legal and environmental safety standards for CO2 storage. Additionally, the research aims to optimize testing methodologies to quantify injectivity and evaluate geological conditions to mitigate risks associated with CO2 leakage.

title: Shipyards of the future (ZEWT Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the competitiveness and sustainability of the European shipbuilding industry, particularly for small and medium-sized shipyards. Key research topics include the integration of innovative technologies such as automation, robotics, and advanced digitalization in shipbuilding processes, as well as the development of strategies for biodiversity-friendly practices and circular economy principles. Proposals should also address skills development, interoperability of systems, and the demonstration of solutions in real shipyard environments to improve efficiency and reduce environmental impacts.

title: Safety of renewable low and zero-carbon waterborne fuels in port areas: risk assessment, regulatory framework, and guidelines for safe bunkering, handling and storage (ZEWT partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the comprehensive risk assessment of renewable low and zero-carbon fuels in maritime and inland port areas, including their storage, handling, and bunkering operations. The initiative aims to improve safety protocols, review existing regulations, and develop guidelines for safe operations while addressing the specific risks posed by these fuels, particularly in populated port areas. Additionally, the project emphasizes the need for skills development and training for port personnel to ensure safe and efficient handling of these fuels.

title: Ports of the future (ZEWT Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing sustainable and digital strategies for middle and small-sized maritime and inland ports across the EU, aiming to enhance their competitiveness, climate resilience, and biodiversity friendliness. Key research topics include the adoption of zero-emission practices, the implementation of innovative technologies for energy systems, and the integration of digital solutions to improve operational efficiency and safety. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of addressing climate-related risks, promoting circular economy practices, and ensuring cybersecurity in port operations.

title: Large-scale demonstration of Heavy-Duty Battery Electric Vehicles (HD BEV) towards long-haul logistics operations (2ZERO Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the integration and deployment of Heavy Duty Battery Electric Vehicles (HD-BEV) in long-distance logistics operations across Europe. This includes addressing barriers related to vehicle technology, charging infrastructure, and stakeholder engagement, while also developing digital tools and AI-based solutions for fleet management. Additionally, the initiative aims to establish a collaborative ecosystem for data sharing, assess the impact of policies on HD-BEV adoption, and evaluate the environmental benefits of transitioning to zero-emission transport solutions.

title: Energy-efficient software-defined EVs (2ZERO Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing energy-efficient, electric Software Defined Vehicles (SDVs) through the integration of innovative traction and chassis hardware subsystems, emphasizing the role of software abstraction layers. Key research topics include the development of vehicle-to-grid (V2G) functionalities, optimal battery sizing for sustainability, and the creation of standardized interfaces for mass-market electric vehicles. Additionally, the call encourages exploring novel propulsion systems, enhancing user experience through AI-driven solutions, and ensuring compatibility with existing automotive standards and infrastructure.

title: AI-assisted digital aircraft design, manufacturing and MRO, towards a competitive aviation
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development of AI-assisted technologies for various aspects of aircraft design, manufacturing, operation, and maintenance. Key research topics include the integration of AI with digital twins for aircraft design and certification, the creation of efficient AI tools for requirement validation and verification, and the enhancement of manufacturing and maintenance processes through AI-driven capabilities. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for robust training of AI systems, the establishment of protocols for the aircraft supply chain, and the application of machine learning for predictive maintenance and operational efficiency.

title: Next generation of renewable energy technologies
summary_text: The grant call focuses on high-risk, high-return research and development of breakthrough renewable energy technologies aimed at achieving a net-zero greenhouse gas emissions economy by 2050. Key topics include catalyst development, renewable energy storage systems, hybrid renewable energy systems, and solar-driven chemical processes, with an emphasis on minimizing environmental impacts, enhancing resource efficiency, and fostering social acceptance. Proposals should also consider policy approaches and the integration of social sciences to ensure the societal impact and successful deployment of these technologies.

title: Non-exhaust emissions in road and railway transport
summary_text: The research topics focus on the measurement, simulation, and validation of non-exhaust pollutant emissions from road and railway transport, particularly concerning their impact on human health, ecosystems, and biodiversity. Key areas include the identification and characterization of emission sources, the development of improved emission factors, and the assessment of health and environmental impacts, especially related to particulate matter. Additionally, the call emphasizes the need for innovative mitigation strategies and technologies to reduce non-exhaust emissions, alongside the establishment of standardized measurement methods and regulatory frameworks.

title: Disruptive Technologies and Innovative Concepts for Energy Saving Onboard of long-distance ships (ZEWT Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing innovative technologies and concepts aimed at achieving at least 25% energy savings in long-distance shipping compared to 2008 levels. Key research topics include the creation of novel propulsion systems, hull performance enhancements, and the use of advanced materials, all while considering renewable low and zero-carbon fuels. Additionally, proposals should address methodologies for assessing energy efficiency impacts on GHG emissions, economic viability, safety implications, and the integration of AI and digital twin technologies for optimization and energy management.

title: Demonstration of solid biofuel supply and conversion to high efficiency CHP from fully sustainable regional value chains
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and demonstration of sustainable regional bioenergy value chains utilizing locally sourced solid biofuels derived from upgraded biogenic residues and wastes. The aim is to enhance energy security and reduce dependence on fossil fuels while ensuring socio-economic and environmental sustainability through high-efficiency combined heat and power (CHP) plants. Additionally, the proposals should address the integration of social sciences and humanities (SSH) to promote inclusive solutions and assess the socio-economic impacts of these bioenergy systems.

title: Resource assessment for deep sedimentary and basement reservoirs
summary_text: The key research topics focus on advanced methods and technologies for identifying and exploiting geothermal resources in deep sedimentary and basement reservoirs, particularly those with low permeability at depths of 2000-6000 meters. The scientific focus areas include enhancing drilling success rates, improving geothermal resource performance, assessing environmental and social impacts, and developing predictive models for reservoir properties and conditions. Additionally, the proposals emphasize the importance of community engagement and the integration of social sciences to address the societal impacts of geothermal energy projects.

title: Data sharing to support the training and development of AI foundation models in the energy sector
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing innovative AI foundation models for the energy sector, emphasizing the use of large, high-quality datasets to enhance grid management, forecasting, and energy efficiency. Key research topics include effective data sharing strategies, advanced methodologies for AI model development, and ensuring the models are FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable). Projects should also prioritize ethical considerations, transparency, and collaboration among diverse stakeholders in the energy ecosystem.

title: Improved system design for innovative PV applications (EUPI-PV Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on agrivoltaics (agriPV) and offshore/nearshore photovoltaic (PV) systems, emphasizing the optimization of designs and business models to enhance simultaneous land use for agriculture and energy production. The scientific focus areas include energy yield assessment, advanced system components, resilience to climate change, standardization of designs, and societal acceptance of these technologies, all aimed at minimizing environmental impacts while maximizing energy output and promoting biodiversity. Additionally, the integration of social sciences is highlighted to ensure equitable deployment and address socio-technical challenges in these innovative PV systems.

title: De-risking renewable fuel technologies through transnational pre-commercial procurement of renewable fuel industrial value chains
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development and commercialization of essential renewable fuel technologies to establish industrial value chains that can meet EU needs beyond 2030. Key research topics include advanced bioethanol production, biomass gasification, bio-methanol production, and the development of biokerosene and biomethane from various feedstocks. The initiative aims to enhance market readiness, improve financing access, and foster collaboration among public and private entities to de-risk these technologies and promote sustainable energy solutions.

title: Renewable Energy Valleys in Africa to increase energy security and energy access in Africa
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing renewable energy systems in Africa through decentralized solutions, aiming to improve energy autonomy, reduce reliance on fuel imports, and support local economic development. Key research topics include the design and implementation of sustainable energy systems, the development of local value chains, and the integration of social innovation and gender-sensitive approaches. Additionally, proposals should address the environmental impact through life cycle analysis and align with EU-AU collaborative efforts on climate change and sustainable energy.

title: Sustainable and Competitive Cell Production Techniques for Lithium-ion And Sodium-ion Batteries (BATT4EU Partnership)
summary_text: Proposals should focus on developing innovative battery cell manufacturing processes and machinery that enhance competitiveness, resilience, and sustainability in the European battery industry. Key research topics include the creation of flexible and modular production lines for various battery chemistries, advanced mixing and electrode manufacturing techniques, optimization of dry-room assembly processes, and the implementation of digitalization for quality control. Additionally, proposals must include techno-economic assessments and life-cycle analyses to demonstrate environmental and economic advantages over current manufacturing practices.

title: Advancements in Direct Air Capture
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing Direct Air Capture (DAC) technologies by scaling existing solutions to pilot demonstration levels and enhancing cost efficiency in capture and regeneration processes. Key research topics include improving material performance, exploring alternative materials for CO2 separation, optimizing designs for air contactors, and developing systems that operate effectively under varying environmental conditions. Additionally, projects must include a comprehensive life cycle assessment to evaluate the environmental impacts of DAC systems.

title: Improvement of Adaptability, Flexibility and Efficiency of Existing Recycling Processes (BATT4EU Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing battery recycling technologies to improve efficiency and adaptability in processing diverse feedstocks, particularly mixed lithium-ion battery chemistries and production scrap. Key research topics include the development of innovative recycling processes that enhance recovery rates of critical raw materials, optimization of hydrometallurgical and pyrometallurgical methods, and the implementation of advanced sorting and pre-treatment technologies. Proposals should also include comprehensive techno-economic and life-cycle assessments to demonstrate improvements in energy efficiency and sustainability, aligning with EU regulatory requirements.

title: Concentrated solar thermal systems for decarbonising industrial processes
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the demonstration and integration of concentrated solar thermal technologies for industrial heating applications, specifically targeting temperature ranges of 150Â°C to 400Â°C. Key research topics include showcasing the ability of these systems to meet at least 50% of industrial heat demand, improving their economic feasibility, and optimizing energy efficiency and heat recovery in various industrial processes such as drying and sterilization. Proposals should also address the environmental impact and techno-economic feasibility of the systems, with an emphasis on replicability across different industrial applications.

title: Innovative technologies and solutions to improve wave and tidal energy systems
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing research and innovation in ocean energy, specifically targeting the development and demonstration of cost-effective wave and tidal energy systems. Key research topics include enhancing the efficiency, reliability, and sustainability of these technologies, developing innovative devices and materials, and implementing advanced manufacturing and maintenance solutions. Additionally, the call emphasizes the integration of artificial intelligence and condition monitoring systems to optimize performance while minimizing environmental impacts.

title: Production technologies for solar photovoltaics beyond the state-of-the-art (EUPI-PV Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing solar photovoltaic (PV) technologies to meet the EU's ambitious targets for solar energy deployment and manufacturing capacity by 2030. Key research topics include the development of solar cells and modules with higher conversion efficiencies, resilient production technologies, and automated manufacturing processes. Proposals should also emphasize commercialization strategies and contribute to the objectives of the EU Solar PV Industry Alliance and the European Partnership for Innovation in Photovoltaics.

title: Support to the implementation of an EU policy framework for CO2 transport and storage infrastructure
summary_text: The project focuses on enhancing the implementation of a legislative framework for CO2 infrastructure, addressing key issues such as market structures, cross-border integration, technical harmonization, and investment incentives. It aims to analyze the challenges of repurposing existing infrastructure for CO2, including technical feasibility, costs, regulatory barriers, and the integration of CO2 infrastructure with renewable gases and energy systems.

title: Co-funding Strategic Energy Technology (SET) Plan renewable fuel value chains at EU, national, regional, and local level
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing research and innovation in renewable fuels and bioenergy, aiming to establish interconnected value chains across Europe to overcome fragmentation in the sector. Key research topics include the development and demonstration of advanced biofuels from sustainable biomass, the transformation of energy carriers into renewable fuels, and addressing challenges such as feedstock standardization and regulatory frameworks. The initiative seeks to enhance collaboration among stakeholders, including researchers, industry, and policymakers, to improve the performance and market uptake of renewable fuel technologies.

title: Large scale operational validation and upscaling of state-of-the-art (Generative) AI tools and models powering a next generation digital energy system
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing advanced, secure, and sustainable AI tools for real-time operations in distributed energy systems, emphasizing energy efficiency and consumer empowerment. Key research topics include the integration of AI within the digital infrastructure of the energy system, the validation and scaling of open-source AI models for grid monitoring and market operations, and the implementation of machine learning at edge nodes using agent-based architectures. Additionally, projects should align with European standards and contribute to initiatives like the BRIDGE initiative to enhance AI adoption in the energy sector.

title: Sustainable and healthy diets for cardiovascular diseases prevention with the support of digital applications
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the effects of sustainable and healthy diets on the gut microbiome and cardiovascular health, utilizing AI and digital tools to analyze these relationships across different demographic groups, including children, adults, and the elderly. The initiative aims to develop user-friendly digital solutions that assist individuals in improving their eating habits to prevent cardiovascular diseases, while also conducting economic cost-benefit analyses and fostering collaboration with SMEs and start-ups for effective implementation and commercialization of these solutions. Additionally, the research will explore host-microbiota interactions and the impact of dietary changes on cardiovascular risk, emphasizing the importance of behavioral sciences in understanding dietary habits.

title: Advancing basic knowledge and developing tools for sustainable management of key migratory fish species
summary_text: The key research topics focus on understanding the life history parameters and ecological dynamics of migratory fish species, particularly in the context of climate change and anthropogenic impacts. The scientific focus areas include developing methodologies for assessing conservation and management effectiveness, reducing human-induced mortality, and enhancing connectivity across habitats. Additionally, the proposals should address the ecosystem services provided by these species, involve stakeholder engagement, and incorporate social sciences to ensure practical application of research findings.

title: Tackling pesticide resistance: early detection, management strategies, and foresight
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing a holistic, science-based approach to combat pesticide resistance in agriculture and forestry. Key research topics include mapping resistance risks, creating early detection and predictive modeling methods, designing integrated pest and weed management strategies, and innovating post-harvest practices. Additionally, the call emphasizes enhancing foresight capacities, stakeholder engagement, and capacity-building to support sustainable agricultural practices and preserve biodiversity.

title: Integrating a holistic perspective in microbiome research for resilient, competitive and sustainable food systems
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing a systems-level understanding of microbiomes through a One Health approach, emphasizing their interactions across various hosts and environments. Key research topics include developing resilient and sustainable food systems, integrating multi-omics technologies, and enhancing collaboration among European research infrastructures to facilitate microbiome data sharing. Proposals should engage diverse stakeholders to co-develop innovative applications that address food security, health, and biodiversity in the context of climate action.

title: Developing innovative phytosanitary treatments for regulated plant pests to support safe international trade
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing innovative, cost-effective, and environmentally friendly phytosanitary treatments for regulated plant pests, particularly targeting EU quarantine pests. It emphasizes the need for scientifically validated protocols and guidelines to ensure the efficacy, scalability, and practical application of these treatments in trade, specifically for wood products or post-harvest fruits and vegetables. The initiative aims to enhance plant health measures that protect agriculture, support food security, and facilitate safe international trade.

title: Boosting the competitiveness of protein crops in Europe
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the production and integration of protein crops in European agriculture to improve sustainability, profitability, and food autonomy. Key research topics include developing innovative solutions for diverse farming systems, promoting circular bioeconomy through the valorization of protein crop by-products, and creating effective pest and weed management strategies. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of collaboration among various stakeholders to facilitate knowledge sharing and practical implementation of these innovations.

title: Sustainable and healthy diets based on health status and socio-economic risk factors of ageing population
summary_text: The research topics focus on improving dietary needs and health outcomes for the older population (65+ years), emphasizing the identification of specific foods, nutrients, and easy-to-chew products that enhance wellbeing and prevent diseases related to aging. Additionally, the scope includes understanding sustainable food production, developing tailored dietary recommendations, and creating prevention campaigns to address malnutrition and promote healthy diets among older individuals, particularly those in care settings or living alone. The proposals should integrate social sciences to address the economic and psychological aspects of dietary needs in this demographic.

title: Advanced innovative solutions for improved competitiveness and sustainability in controlled environment agriculture (CEA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on advancing Controlled Environment Agriculture (CEA) through innovative farming techniques and decision support tools that enhance sustainability and competitiveness. This includes the development of AI-driven solutions for crop optimization, energy and water efficiency, and pest management, as well as exploring new business models and fostering knowledge sharing among stakeholders. The aim is to support farmers in adopting sustainable practices that contribute to climate neutrality and resilience while addressing global food security challenges.

title: Boosting plant health and reducing losses on farm and during storage for sustainable growth in Africa (FNSSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing sustainable management of plant pests in Africa to improve food security and address climate and biodiversity challenges. Key research topics include understanding the biology and dynamics of plant pests, developing environmentally friendly pest management strategies, and fostering agroecological practices to minimize crop losses pre-harvest and during storage. Proposals should emphasize collaboration among agricultural actors and integrate local knowledge with scientific expertise to promote resilience in African agricultural systems.

title: Boosting circularity and diversification strategies of terrestrial livestock production systems
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing sustainability in livestock farming through diversification and circularity strategies. Key research topics include the integration of diverse animal breeds and products, the valorization of agricultural by-products, and the development of innovative tools for optimizing resource use and resilience in farming systems. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of assessing socio-economic impacts, fostering collaboration among stakeholders, and ensuring compliance with EU regulations to support sustainable rural development.

title: Towards the water infrastructures of the future
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the resilience and adaptability of water infrastructures for drinking water supply and wastewater treatment in response to climate change and emerging contaminants. Key research topics include the integration of digital solutions (such as AI and IoT), the development of modular processes and Nature-based Solutions to reduce carbon footprints, and the implementation of robust cybersecurity measures. Proposals should also emphasize data sharing frameworks and collaboration among diverse stakeholders to improve monitoring, predictive analytics, and overall system efficiency.

title: Towards more effective, fair and coherent policies for climate change mitigation and adaptation in agriculture and forestry
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the intersection of climate change mitigation and adaptation in agriculture and forestry, emphasizing the evaluation of policy tools and their impacts on economic, social, and environmental outcomes. The research aims to analyze trade-offs and synergies between various climate policies, including the Common Agricultural Policy (CAP) and other sectoral and horizontal policies, while considering the influence of international standards and market dynamics. Additionally, the proposals should incorporate advanced methodologies for evidence synthesis and engage Social Sciences and Humanities to enhance understanding of policy effectiveness and interconnections.

title: Leveraging R&I knowledge on microbiome
summary_text: The key research topics focus on establishing a comprehensive resource hub for microbiome research and innovation (R&I) that integrates knowledge across various domains, including human health, climate, environment, agriculture, and food systems, all framed within a One Health perspective. The initiative aims to enhance coordination among EU member states and associated countries, mapping existing microbiome projects, identifying synergies and gaps, and addressing regulatory challenges to facilitate the translation of microbiome research into innovative solutions. Additionally, it emphasizes monitoring the impact of microbiome R&I on public health, biodiversity, and the economy, aligning with EU policies and strategic frameworks.

title: Green Transition Food Processing Africa
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing food processing facilities in Africa to improve operations related to underutilized crops, such as pulses, millets, and cassava, while ensuring food safety and quality through innovative processing techniques and sustainable practices. The initiative aims to reduce post-harvest losses and promote circular economy approaches, supporting biodiversity and market opportunities for these crops. Additionally, it emphasizes collaboration among various stakeholders, including researchers, food processors, and entrepreneurs, particularly targeting social innovation and inclusivity for women and young entrepreneurs.

title: Strengthening the EU plant protection ecosystem for a future-proof agriculture
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing EU-wide dialogue and cooperation on plant protection challenges, promoting the development and adoption of sustainable and biodiversity-friendly alternatives to harmful pesticides, and addressing the impacts of active substance withdrawals on agriculture. The scientific focus areas include assessing agronomic and economic impacts of pesticide withdrawals, identifying critical uses at risk, and fostering multi-actor collaboration among policymakers, researchers, and agricultural stakeholders to co-develop actionable plans and strategic research agendas.

title: Boosting sustainable competitiveness in rural areas through innovation
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing sustainable competitiveness in rural areas by addressing societal and market failures, promoting entrepreneurship and innovation, particularly among young people, and improving access to services and business opportunities. The scientific focus areas include the development of indicators for measuring competitiveness that incorporate social and environmental performance, the design and testing of sustainable solutions, and the provision of digital education and training to foster skills and entrepreneurial mindsets in rural communities. Additionally, the integration of Social Sciences and Humanities is emphasized, particularly in relation to gender considerations in project design and implementation.

title: Accelerating the development of breeding tools for perennial crops, specifically fruits and nuts
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing innovative and user-friendly tools and methods to enhance the breeding of perennial crops, particularly fruits and nuts, with an emphasis on sustainability traits such as pest and disease resistance, yield stability, and climate adaptability. The proposals should aim to shorten breeding cycles, implement genomic selection models, validate tools across different species, and assess their environmental impacts, all while ensuring accessibility and scalability for breeders. Additionally, collaboration with ongoing projects and leveraging European research infrastructure is encouraged to promote plant breeding innovations.

title: R&D for the next generation of scientific instrumentation, tools, methods, digitalisation and solutions for research infrastructure upgrades
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing research infrastructures (RIs) in the EU through the development of innovative scientific instrumentation, tools, digital solutions, and methods. Key research topics include enhancing the capacity and resilience of RIs, promoting digitalization, fostering collaboration with industry and academia, and addressing environmental sustainability. Proposals should aim for technology validation and training, while also considering the potential for industrial exploitation and societal benefits.

title: Consolidation of the research infrastructure landscape â€“ pilots for strategic coordination, synergies and simplified access pathways, by large thematic clusters of pan-European research infrastructures
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the visibility and accessibility of European research infrastructures by improving coordination, interoperability, and synergies among them within large thematic domains. Key research topics include the development of integrated catalogues of research services, the establishment of user support tools, and the promotion of indicators that align with EU research and innovation priorities. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of collaboration across projects and domains to address complex scientific challenges and to better serve diverse user communities, including researchers from widening countries and industry stakeholders.

title: Research infrastructures as accelerators of the integration of Ukraine in the European Research Area
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing collaboration between Ukrainian and European research infrastructures to support joint research initiatives and the reconstruction of Ukraine's research capacity. This includes providing remote fellowships for Ukrainian researchers, facilitating access to European research infrastructures, and developing methodologies for technology advancement. Proposals should also aim to align investment opportunities and leverage EU funding to prioritize the development of Ukrainian research infrastructures while fostering networking and shared use of facilities.

title: Digital twins and/or their major components for environment, climate and security
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing digital twins to enhance foresight and anticipation capabilities at the intersection of climate change, environment, and security. Key research topics include the creation of high-accuracy models for local and regional disaster resilience, the integration of AI and machine learning for improved data processing and visualization, and the establishment of robust frameworks for risk mitigation across various sectors such as health, energy, and resource management. Proposals should demonstrate collaboration with the Destination Earth initiative and aim to produce actionable insights for decision-makers in response to climate-related challenges.

title: Strengthening the human capital managing research infrastructures, including in international context
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the skills of staff managing European research infrastructures through specialized training programs. Key research topics include the development of educational curricula that address the complexities of governance, financial sustainability, and the impact of digitalization and international collaboration on research infrastructures. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of training in data management, socioeconomic impacts, and engagement with various stakeholders, including academia and industry, to improve the overall effectiveness and sustainability of research infrastructures.

title: Strengthening the international dimension of ESFRI and/or ERIC research infrastructures
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing cooperation between European research infrastructures and their international counterparts, aiming to strengthen global engagement and competitiveness in research. Key research topics include the development of sustainable collaboration models, data sharing agreements, and fostering global interoperability in data management. Additionally, the call emphasizes addressing societal challenges through international partnerships, particularly in environmental monitoring and health.

title: Research infrastructure concept development including major upgrades or extensions of existing infrastructures
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development of innovative research infrastructures of European interest, emphasizing the need for transformative upgrades or extensions that significantly enhance scientific outputs. Key research topics include the alignment of infrastructure development with frontier research and technology innovation, addressing gaps in the existing landscape, and ensuring environmental sustainability. Proposals should also consider user community needs, governance strategies, and long-term sustainability plans while integrating ethical and environmental considerations.
