title: Uptake of FAIR data management practices and of EOSC by research communities and research infrastructures (EOSC Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the adoption of open science and FAIR data management practices across Europe, particularly through the development and integration of the European Open Science Cloud (EOSC) Federation. This includes supporting open science projects that promote cross-disciplinary collaboration, improving data access and reuse, and fostering the engagement of underrepresented research communities. Additionally, the initiative aims to establish training programs and frameworks for high-impact services and data repositories, ensuring their sustainability and alignment with EOSC standards.

title: Risk management, mitigation and contingency for ESFRI/ERIC and other world-class research infrastructures
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing risk management and mitigation strategies for pan-European research infrastructures, particularly in the domains of climate, health, and social sciences. It aims to address critical risks related to data access, equipment, and facilities, while promoting international collaboration and the sustainability of research infrastructures. Key areas of interest include developing guidance on risk assessment, preserving critical data, and ensuring the EU's strategic autonomy and competitiveness in research and innovation.

title: Implementing digital services to empower neuroscience research for health and brain inspired technology via EBRAINS
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing brain research through the development of the EBRAINS digital infrastructure, which aims to integrate AI tools for enhanced data analysis, simulations, and modeling in neuroscience and brain medicine. Key research topics include the creation of innovative brain-inspired AI technologies, detailed multi-scale models of brain behavior and cognition, and the establishment of digital brain twins for medical applications. Additionally, the initiative emphasizes collaboration across European research infrastructures to promote data sharing, interoperability, and the development of new services that enhance brain health and cognitive technologies.

title: Consolidation of the research infrastructure landscape â€“ individual support for evolution, long-term sustainability and emerging needs of pan-European research infrastructures
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the sustainability and effectiveness of European research infrastructures, particularly ESFRI Landmarks and ERICs. Key research topics include the expansion of membership, international cooperation, development of managerial skills, and the integration of remote access and FAIR data management. Additionally, the call emphasizes addressing new research and societal challenges, fostering innovation, and reducing environmental impacts through improved technologies and methodologies.

title: Trusted frameworks for secure and efficient data sharing in EOSC (EOSC Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing and implementing data sovereignty frameworks that align with EU legislation and international agreements, facilitating secure and lawful data sharing across EU member states and third countries. The initiative emphasizes creating harmonized guidelines and governance structures for data management, enhancing interoperability with European data spaces, and ensuring compliance with data protection regulations. Additionally, it aims to improve the management of sensitive data through comprehensive tools for data provenance, risk assessment, and the establishment of support centers for data compliance.

title: Digital enablers and building-blocks for Earth Observation and Satellite telecommunication for Space solutions (Space Partnership)
summary_text: The research topics focus on enhancing satellite communication (SatCom) and Earth Observation (EO) systems through digitalisation, aiming to develop new commercial services and applications. Key areas include improving interoperability of satellite networks, advancing EO equipment and applications for better timeliness and resolution, and optimizing resources for both EO and SatCom systems. The initiative emphasizes collaboration among industry, SMEs, and research institutions to foster innovation and maintain competitiveness in the European space sector.

title: Preparing demonstration missions for Earth Observation and Satellite telecommunication for Space solutions (Space Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing research and innovation in satellite communication (SatCom) and Earth Observation (EO) technologies, particularly at mid to high Technology Readiness Levels (TRL). Key areas of interest include the development of end-to-end SatCom mission capabilities, secure services, real-time EO applications, and synergetic technologies that enhance operational efficiency across both domains. Projects should aim to foster competitiveness in the European space sector through innovative solutions, collaboration among various stakeholders, and the integration of digital tools and algorithms for improved performance and service delivery.

title: Space critical EEE components for EU non-dependence â€“ GaN MMICs mm-Wave Foundations (Phase A): Development and Industrialization of Semi-insulating SiC Substrate Capabilities
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing critical space electronic, electrical, and electromechanical (EEE) components and technologies to enhance the EU's strategic autonomy in space. This includes establishing resilient supply chains based in the EU, reducing dependencies on non-EU sources, and ensuring unrestricted access to high-performance components for EU space missions. Additionally, the initiative aims to improve competitiveness by creating products that meet or exceed global standards while addressing export control challenges and vulnerabilities in the supply chain.

title: Reinforcing EU autonomous access to space through EU-based spaceports
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the EU's access to space by developing innovative launch services and ground facilities within EU territory. This includes establishing launch pads, integration and operation facilities, and ensuring the participation of EU launch service providers in the projects. Additionally, the proposals should align with past and ongoing initiatives in the space sector and consider the integration of gender dimensions where relevant.

title: Critical Facilities Serving Space EEE components for EU non-dependence â€“ High and Very High Energy Irradiation Test Facility Market Deployment
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing a dedicated high and very high energy irradiation test facility for space EEE components to enhance the EU's strategic autonomy and reduce dependencies on non-EU supply chains. The project aims to establish a reliable and trustable supply chain for critical space components, ensuring unrestricted access for EU stakeholders while prioritizing EU-based requests. Additionally, it emphasizes the need for a comprehensive analysis of the supply chain, technical roadmaps, and commercialization strategies to support EU space missions effectively.

title: Scientific analysis and exploitation of space data
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the analysis and exploitation of data from European space science missions, including small satellites and CubeSats, with an emphasis on astronomy, astrophysics, cosmology, heliophysics, and deep space exploration. The initiative aims to enhance scientific collaboration, develop advanced data processing techniques, and produce high-level data products and publications, while encouraging international cooperation and the integration of innovative methodologies such as artificial intelligence and multidimensional data fusion.

title: Space critical Equipment for EU non-dependence â€“ Space Refuelling Interface
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing critical space equipment and technologies to enhance the EU's strategic autonomy by reducing dependencies on non-EU sources. Key research topics include establishing resilient supply chains for space equipment, ensuring compliance with export regulations, and achieving high-performance standards comparable to non-EU products. The initiative aims to foster collaboration between space and non-space industries in Europe while promoting the commercialization of developed technologies within the EU framework.

title: Space critical EEE components for EU non-dependence â€“ Radiation Hard FPGA on 7nm
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing critical space electronic, electrical, and electromechanical (EEE) components and technologies to enhance the EU's strategic autonomy in space. This includes establishing resilient supply chains within the EU to reduce dependencies on non-EU sources, ensuring unrestricted access to high-performance components for EU space missions, and achieving competitive capabilities that meet or exceed global standards. Additionally, projects should address the assessment of vulnerabilities in supply chains and compliance with export control regulations.

title: Quantum Space Gravimetry topic
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing quantum gravimetry technology for space applications, specifically through the development of quantum accelerometers based on cold atom interferometry and emerging technologies like SQUIDs and nuclear spin-based gravimeters. The aim is to enhance the performance of space gravimetry missions, improve the monitoring of Earth's gravity field, and support the EU's strategic objectives in quantum technologies and space policy. Proposals should target technological maturation to TRL 4-6 and include plans for in-orbit testing of prototypes.

title: Space critical equipment for EU non-dependence
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing critical space equipment and technologies to enhance the EU's strategic autonomy and reduce dependencies on non-EU sources. This includes establishing resilient supply chains within the EU, ensuring unrestricted access to high-performance space technologies, and fostering competitiveness in the global market. Additionally, the initiative aims to promote collaboration between space and non-space industries to support the EU's space missions and address the challenges posed by non-EU export controls.

title: Digital solutions for autonomy for space transportation systems, design and simulation tools - Digital enablers and building blocks (Space Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing satellite communication, Earth observation, and new commercial space transportation solutions through the maturation of disruptive digital technologies. Key research topics include enhancing space transportation systems, improving launcher sustainability, and developing innovative technologies for autonomy, data fusion, navigation, and mission planning. Additionally, the call emphasizes eco-design guidelines, software design tools, and landing solutions for reusability, aiming to strengthen the competitiveness and sustainability of the EU's space sector.

title: Preparing demonstration missions for collaborative Earth Observation and Satellite telecommunication for Space solutions (Space Partnership)
summary_text: The research topics focus on advancing satellite communication (SatCom) and Earth Observation (EO) technologies, emphasizing the development of end-to-end mission capabilities, secure services, and digital infrastructure to enhance operational efficiency. Key areas include improving data processing, interoperability, and miniaturization of EO systems, as well as fostering AI integration and enhancing security for both SatCom and EO services. Projects should promote collaboration among industry, academia, and research institutions, aiming to leverage existing EU technologies to strengthen the competitiveness of the European space sector.

title: Digital enablers and building blocks for collaborative Earth Observation and Satellite telecommunications for Space solutions (Space Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on research and innovation in satellite communication (SatCom) and Earth Observation (EO) technologies, emphasizing the development of next-generation payloads and processing systems to enhance competitiveness in these fields. Key areas of interest include the integration of digitalization for commercial space solutions, the enhancement of End-to-End SatCom mission capabilities, and the establishment of synergies between EO and SatCom systems for improved operational efficiency and resilience. Projects should promote collaboration among various stakeholders and leverage existing EU technologies to foster innovation and commercial application in the space sector.

title: Space critical EEE components for EU non-dependence
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing and maturing critical space electronic, electrical, and electromechanical (EEE) components and technologies to enhance the EU's strategic autonomy in the space sector. This includes establishing resilient and trustable supply chains primarily based in the EU, reducing dependencies on non-EU sources, and ensuring access to high-performance components necessary for EU space missions. Additionally, the initiative aims to foster competitiveness and collaboration between European space and non-space industries to address the dynamic challenges of the space market.

title: ISOS4I Pilot Mission Integrated Ground Test and consolidation of space-compatible USI solutions
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and demonstration of the ISOS4I pilot mission, aimed at establishing a sustainable in-space economy through innovative technologies and services. This includes the design and testing of mission components, the qualification of the Universal Service Interface (USI), and the promotion of the mission to enhance public awareness and engagement. The initiative emphasizes collaboration among industry, SMEs, and research institutions to foster European competitiveness in the space sector and ensure interoperability among various space actors.

title: Innovative Solutions for mitigating the environmental impact of waterborne transport in marine and aquatic Ecosystems (ZEWT Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on evaluating and mitigating the environmental impacts of waterborne transport on marine and aquatic ecosystems, particularly concerning the use of renewable low and zero-carbon fuels. This includes assessing pollution sources, developing innovative abatement and mitigation strategies, and enhancing resilience against climate change and human-induced pressures. Additionally, the research aims to improve stakeholder engagement and ensure compliance with European environmental targets, contributing to the overall goal of achieving Good Environmental and Good Ecological Status in European waters.

title: Higher Voltage, Megawatt Charging System compatible, modular powertrain for Heavy Duty Vehicles (HDV) (2ZERO Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and integration of advanced high-voltage systems for Heavy-Duty Battery Electric Vehicles (HD-BEV), emphasizing cost reduction, energy efficiency, and fast charging capabilities. Specific areas of interest include optimizing voltage levels for performance and compatibility with Megawatt Charging Systems, enhancing modularity and interchangeability of components, and exploring second-life applications for battery systems. Additionally, the research aims to evaluate life-cycle costs and demonstrate effective integration with innovative electrical and thermal management architectures.

title: Fire prevention and mitigation for EVs in confined areas (2ZERO Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing fire safety for electric vehicles (EVs) through the development of standardized fire risk assessments, innovative fire detection and suppression technologies, and comprehensive databases on EV fire incidents. Key research topics include mitigation measures for battery thermal runaway, improved on-board diagnostics for early fire detection, and the creation of firefighting protocols tailored for constrained environments. Additionally, the initiative aims to improve public perception of EV safety through social awareness campaigns and stakeholder engagement.

title: Data-driven circular economy for e-mobility ecosystem (2ZERO Partnership)
summary_text:
The grant call focuses on two key research areas: 

1. **Circular Economy for Electric Vehicle (EV) Powertrains and Infrastructure**: This area emphasizes minimizing the environmental impact of EV drivetrains and charging infrastructure through improved design for durability, repairability, and recyclability. It aims to enhance the lifespan of components, optimize material usage, and promote strategies for refurbishment and reuse.

2. **Data-Driven Life-Cycle Management of Electric Vehicles**: This area seeks to develop digital twin-based product passports and track-and-trace systems for EV components to facilitate data accessibility and interoperability. It focuses on improving lifecycle management through advanced data collection, predictive maintenance, and compliance with data governance frameworks, ultimately supporting circular economy strategies in the EV sector.

title: Demonstration of zero emission coaches and buses in long distance operations (2ZERO Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing sustainable and affordable long-distance zero-emission mobility solutions, addressing challenges related to vehicle weight, energy demand, and charging infrastructure. The initiative aims to demonstrate the operation of zero-emission buses and coaches over long distances, enhance passenger comfort and inter-modality, and create shared charging solutions for multiple operators. Additionally, the project emphasizes the importance of collaboration with European transport providers to facilitate the integration and replication of best practices across different regions.

title: Sustainable aircraft circular design and additive manufacturing, towards a climate neutral aviation
summary_text: The key research topics focus on advancing additive manufacturing (AM) techniques for high-performance polymers, composites, and metals in the aerospace sector, emphasizing improvements in energy efficiency, material savings, and part quality. Additionally, the initiative aims to develop sustainable circular design and manufacturing processes for aircraft components, addressing challenges such as residual stresses, defects, and reproducibility, while enhancing maintenance, repair technologies, and real-time monitoring for safety-critical systems.

title: Prospective evaluation of nuclear power potential for shipping (ZEWT Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the feasibility and safety of deploying nuclear power, including small modular reactors (SMRs), in commercial shipping to achieve zero emissions of greenhouse gases and pollutants. This includes assessing technical and economic viability, environmental impacts, regulatory frameworks, and safety protocols, as well as developing operational guidelines and training for nuclear-powered vessels. The project aims to create a comprehensive roadmap for integrating nuclear technology into maritime transport while addressing infrastructure needs and potential damage scenarios.

title: Assessing the effect of airport operations on air quality and noise in nearby communities
summary_text: The key research topics focus on assessing the environmental impacts of airport operations, specifically regarding air quality, water pollution, and noise emissions. This includes real-time measurements of pollutants, the development of improved emission factors for emissions inventories, and methodologies to evaluate health impacts related to airport emissions. Additionally, the research aims to investigate the effects of various emissions on local biodiversity and community health, while also considering the implications of auxiliary power units and ground power units on overall emissions.

title: Enhanced electric operation and battery durability (ZEWT Partnership)
summary_text: The research topics focus on enhancing the autonomy and power output of fully battery-electric vessels, aiming for at least 150 nm range and over 5 MW peak propulsion power. Key areas include optimizing battery management systems, improving charging infrastructure for rapid zero-emission replenishment, and addressing the operational profiles of various ship types to ensure safety and efficiency. Additionally, the initiative emphasizes life cycle considerations for batteries, regulatory compliance, and the development of best practices for safety assessments in maritime electrification.

title: Autonomous vessels in short sea shipping and inland waterways
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development and demonstration of Maritime Autonomous Surface Ships (MASS), specifically remote-controlled and fully autonomous vessels. Projects should address operational aspects such as navigation, port calling, and safety considerations, while also tackling implementation challenges like data quality, infrastructure needs, and cyber risk management. Additionally, the research aims to assess the economic viability and environmental impact of autonomous vessels, ensuring alignment with EU strategies and enhancing the competitiveness of the EU waterborne industry.

title: Onboard renewable energy solutions and energy saving measures to reduce the fuel consumption of ships by at least 55% (ZEWT Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the full-scale demonstration of combined solutions to achieve at least a 55% reduction in ship greenhouse gas intensity and energy consumption compared to 2008 levels. This includes the development of a standardized framework for verifying energy efficiency improvements, the integration of renewable energy solutions, and the assessment of safety and operational impacts on ships and ports. Additionally, the proposals should address the optimization of energy-saving technologies, cybersecurity risks, and the environmental benefits of these solutions, while promoting cooperation and training among vessel crews and shore-side services.

title: Noise reduction breakthroughs for new ultraefficient aircraft
summary_text: The research topics focus on advanced methodologies for predicting and mitigating noise in new ultra-efficient aircraft designs, particularly large passenger aircraft with innovative open fan engine architectures. Key areas include the study of airframe and cabin noise, engine noise sources, noise perception and annoyance, and the development of experimental data and multi-disciplinary design approaches to enhance noise reduction technologies. Emphasis is placed on integrating aerodynamics, aeroacoustics, and novel metamaterials to achieve significant reductions in cabin noise and improve noise footprint assessments.

title: Novel approaches towards next-generation battery concepts, leveraging the enabling role of innovative advanced materials (BATT4EU and IAM4EU Partnerships)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development of innovative battery technologies across three main areas: Area A emphasizes low-cost battery chemistries for electric mobility and stationary storage, targeting performance benchmarks for lithium-ion and sodium-ion batteries; Area B seeks high-performance batteries for aviation and demanding mobility applications, aiming for energy densities exceeding 500 Wh/kg; and Area C focuses on durable materials and cell concepts for stationary energy storage, particularly for grid integration and energy-intensive industries. All proposals should address scalability, manufacturability, sustainability, and safety in battery design.

title: Inclusive and climate resilient multimodal passenger hubs enhancing modal shift towards sustainable transport and shared mobility
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the climate resilience of multimodal passenger hubs in urban and peri-urban areas, aiming to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and improve air quality through sustainable transport solutions. Key research topics include developing innovative mobility solutions that increase accessibility and inclusivity, assessing climate-related vulnerabilities of transport infrastructures, and integrating nature-based and digital solutions to mitigate climate risks. Additionally, the call emphasizes stakeholder engagement and the application of social sciences to ensure the societal impact of the proposed initiatives.

title: Advancing circular logistics solutions in cities
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing circular economy practices in the freight transport and urban logistics sectors. Key research topics include the development of modular, reusable, and recyclable packaging solutions, the integration of digital tools for optimizing logistics operations, and the enhancement of reverse logistics systems to improve material reuse and recycling rates. Additionally, the call emphasizes stakeholder engagement in co-designing solutions and the formulation of policy recommendations to support sustainable urban logistics and circular economy initiatives.

title: Hydrogen cities
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development and implementation of hydrogen strategies in European cities, particularly for decarbonizing hard-to-abate sectors such as heavy-duty transport, aviation, and maritime uses. It emphasizes creating 'twinning' partnerships between cities and Hydrogen Valleys to facilitate knowledge sharing, collaborative activities, and tailored decarbonization roadmaps, while enhancing synergies with the Climate-Neutral and Smart Cities Mission and the Horizon Europe Clean Hydrogen Partnership. Key research topics include feasibility assessments, technology choices, regulatory issues, and socio-economic impact assessments related to renewable hydrogen applications.

title: Innovative microgrids for improved energy system integration and efficiency in urban contexts
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing Low Voltage Direct Current (LVDC) microgrids to enhance energy efficiency, safety, and integration of renewable energy sources in Europe. Key research topics include the development of innovative design methods for LVDC microgrids, real-life demonstrations in various building types, regulatory barrier identification, and the creation of educational materials to promote awareness and acceptance of LVDC technologies. Additionally, the call emphasizes collaboration with social sciences to ensure societal relevance and the importance of clustering activities with other related projects.

title: Boosting the transformation towards climate-neutral cities, the net-zero economy and open strategic autonomy through Pre-Commercial Procurement (PCP)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on innovative public procurement aimed at reducing greenhouse gas and air pollutant emissions, facilitating the transition of local communities towards climate neutrality. Key research topics include the development and implementation of market-ready solutions in energy efficiency, renewable energy, sustainable mobility, and digitalization, with an emphasis on collaboration among public procurers, local authorities, and innovative companies, particularly SMEs and startups. The initiative aims to enhance the resilience of supply chains, promote the adoption of net-zero technologies, and ensure the sustainability of actions beyond the project lifecycle.

title: Enhancing Mobility for All: affordable, reliable, and accessible multimodal transport for inclusive rural and urban connectivity â€“ Societal Readiness pilot
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing innovative multimodal transport solutions to enhance the availability, accessibility, and affordability of transport for vulnerable rural and urban populations. Key research topics include strategies to address transport poverty, the integration of various transport modes for improved first- and last-mile connectivity, and the analysis of mobility service demand in underserved areas. Proposals should emphasize community-driven pilot demonstrations, collaboration among local authorities and transport operators, and the incorporation of social science expertise to ensure inclusive and equitable transport systems.

title: European CCAM knowledge hub and tools for safe and scalable deployment (CCAM Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing Connected and Automated Mobility (CCAM) in Europe by enhancing the EU-wide Knowledge Base with tools for safe deployment, fostering cooperation among stakeholders, and addressing regulatory challenges. Key research topics include the development of practical safety assessment procedures, the establishment of a secure application exchange platform for road-testing permits, and the creation of a federated scenario database linked to accident data for validating CCAM systems. The initiative aims to facilitate international collaboration and harmonize regulations to support the large-scale deployment of automated vehicles.

title: Enhancing Resilience and Accuracy in Positioning, Navigation, and Timing (PNT) Systems and e-conspicuity solutions
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing alternative Positioning, Navigation, and Timing (PNT) solutions that integrate advanced technologies such as 5G networks and the Internet of Things (IoT) to enhance resilience against GNSS vulnerabilities. This includes improving signal processing techniques, ensuring e-conspicuity for collision avoidance in aviation, and addressing regulatory and policy aspects related to the deployment of these systems. The aim is to create secure, redundant navigation solutions that can operate effectively in contested environments and support safe operations in low altitude airspace.

title: Support for dissemination events in the field of Transport Research
summary_text: The grant call focuses on organizing the Transport Research Arena (TRA) conference in 2030, emphasizing technological and industrial advancements across various transport sectors, including road, rail, waterborne, and aviation. Key research topics include innovative solutions for transport, digitalization, climate-neutral mobility, and socio-economic impacts, with a strong emphasis on enhancing participation from diverse groups and fostering collaboration between researchers, industry, and policymakers. Additionally, the initiative aims to recognize excellence in transport research through awards for both young and senior researchers, promoting visibility and career development opportunities in the field.

title: Holistic solutions for CCAM integration in critical scenarios (CCAM Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing Connected, Cooperative, and Automated Mobility (CCAM) solutions for critical situations, including emergency conditions and unplanned events that pose higher risks, such as extreme weather, road incidents, and cyberattacks. Key research topics include the creation of a clustered list of critical scenarios, stakeholder analysis, real-time situation interpretation services, and the development of decision-support tools that integrate with mobility platforms and emergency services. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of user acceptance, risk mitigation, and the validation of solutions to enhance safety and resilience in CCAM operations.

title: Pillar I: Accelerating open access and research assessment reforms in ERA
summary_text: The grant call focuses on two key research areas: Area 1 aims to support the transition of scholarly societies to non-profit open access publishing models, promoting equity in open science and enhancing access to research outputs. Area 2 seeks to implement sustainable institutional reforms in research assessment systems, fostering responsible practices that recognize diverse research outputs and improve the quality and impact of research in alignment with the Agreement on Reforming Research Assessment (ARRA).

title: Pillar IV: Advancing Knowledge for ERA
summary_text: The grant call focuses on six key research areas aimed at enhancing the European Research Area (ERA). These include: 1) Enabling open science through data sharing and replication studies to improve research reproducibility; 2) Addressing ethical challenges in emerging technologies, particularly in space exploration; 3) Promoting inclusive gender equality in R&D intensive firms; 4) Advancing gender-responsive research and innovation through budgeting and evaluation; 5) Assessing trends in research careers within the private sector and inter-sectoral mobility; and 6) Mapping international research careers and talent flows to strengthen global collaboration and knowledge exchange.

title: Pillar III: European Citizens' Hackathon Championship
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the translation of research and innovation (R&I) results into societal and economic benefits through citizen engagement and co-creation. Key research topics include the development of innovative solutions to societal challenges via transdisciplinary collaboration between researchers and citizens, the promotion of entrepreneurship and business skills, and the organization of the "European Citizensâ€™ Hackathon Championship" to foster local and regional problem-solving. The initiative aims to increase trust in science, align R&I with societal needs, and support the market uptake of new business ideas.

title: Pillar I: Building institutional capacities for ethical, equitable, open, and inclusive ERA
summary_text: The grant call focuses on four key research areas aimed at enhancing the European Research Area (ERA) through institutional changes in research and innovation (R&I) organizations. Area 1 emphasizes the development of frameworks for ethics and integrity in research, particularly in the context of digitalization and AI. Area 2 targets the implementation and evaluation of inclusive gender equality plans in R&I organizations, while Area 3 addresses equity and inclusion in open science practices. Finally, Area 4 seeks to improve the quality and equity of the peer-review process in scientific publishing, exploring innovative models and addressing biases.

title: Pillar III: Science comes to town 2028
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the alignment of research with societal needs through a collaborative program titled "Science comes to town 2028," which aims to engage citizens in science communication and foster public participation in research and innovation (R&I) policy discussions. Key research topics include promoting citizen science, improving science education, and addressing gender-specific challenges, while also organizing events like the EUCYS and EU TalentOn competitions to inspire young scientists and early-career researchers. The initiative emphasizes building networks among cities, researchers, and local stakeholders to create inclusive and participatory science engagement activities.

title: Pillar III: Fostering citizen engagement for more responsible and democratic R&I
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing citizen engagement and participation in research and innovation (R&I) to improve the alignment of science with societal needs and values. It includes two main areas: Area 1 emphasizes the integration of citizen science into democratic governance, aiming to improve data practices and raise awareness of citizen science's contributions to policy change. Area 2 seeks to establish guiding principles for inclusive public engagement in R&I, promoting co-creation, capacity building, and ethical guidelines to ensure diverse citizen participation and address equity issues.

title: Pillar II: Strengthening ecosystems for open, ethical, and sustainable ERA
summary_text:
The grant call focuses on three key research areas within the European Research Area (ERA): 

1. **Research Ethics and Integrity**: This area aims to enhance the ecosystem for research ethics and integrity, promoting equitable partnerships and preventing ethics dumping, particularly in the context of digitalization and AI.

2. **Open Science Practices**: This area seeks to foster global cooperation in open science, emphasizing the sharing and re-use of data through the European Open Science Cloud (EOSC) and the development of standards and methodologies that support equitable access to research.

3. **Environmental Sustainability in Research**: This area focuses on promoting environmentally sustainable research practices, reducing the environmental footprint of research activities, and integrating sustainability considerations into research funding and evaluation processes.

title: Pillar II: Piloting innovative approaches to support academic startups and spinoffs
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing knowledge valorisation and innovation ecosystems by supporting early-stage academic spinoffs and startups in their market engagement. Proposals should aim to develop guidance and services that facilitate the testing and validation of innovative solutions with end-users and industry, while promoting inclusive practices and addressing gender-specific challenges. Additionally, projects are expected to implement pilot actions across Europe to foster collaboration between startups and societal actors, contributing to the EU Knowledge Valorisation Platform.

title: Consolidation of the research infrastructure landscape â€“ development of complementarities, synergies and/or integration between a set of pan-European research infrastructures
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the European research infrastructure (RI) landscape by promoting the consolidation, integration, and synergy between multiple European Research Infrastructure Consortia (ERICs) and ESFRI Landmarks. Key research topics include operational integration to optimize efficiency and prevent duplication, as well as planning for potential mergers of infrastructures, addressing governance, legal frameworks, and operational steps. The aim is to strengthen the capacity of research infrastructures to meet EU policy priorities and enhance the global competitiveness of the European Research Area.

title: European Startup and Scaleup Hubs pilot
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the European deep tech startup ecosystem by fostering collaboration among startup hubs, research institutions, and investors. Key research topics include the development of pan-European alliances to support deep tech startups in scaling, bridging regional innovation gaps, and facilitating access to resources and funding opportunities. Specific areas of interest encompass sectors such as artificial intelligence, quantum technologies, biotechnology, cleantech, and advanced materials, with an emphasis on integrating less-connected innovation hubs into a cohesive network.

title: Innovative AI methods and technologies for the process industries (RIA) (Processes4Planet and AI, Data and Robotics partnerships)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing innovative AI-driven solutions to enhance competitiveness and sustainability in the process industries. Key research topics include the advancement of AI methods for materials and process development, optimizing plant operations and value networks, improving working conditions through AI technologies, and fostering faster innovation in product lifecycle management. Proposals should address effective material and process development, sustainable production practices, and the integration of AI solutions into existing operational frameworks while considering user acceptance and training.

title: Development of safe and sustainable alternatives to substances of concern (IA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing safer and more sustainable alternatives to substances of concern (SoCs) across various industries, including energy, mobility, construction, electronics, technical textiles, and medical devices. The aim is to enhance competitiveness by reducing regulatory costs and improving supply chain security while adhering to the safe and sustainable by design (SSbD) framework throughout the innovation process. Proposals should address the redesign, development, and integration of these alternatives into manufacturing processes, identifying barriers to substitution and ensuring alignment with sustainability principles.

title: AI improved advanced manufacturing and production processes in factories (RIA) (Made in Europe and AI, Data and Robotics partnerships)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the integration of AI technologies in advanced manufacturing to enhance operational efficiency, sustainability, and circularity. Key research topics include real-time monitoring and adaptive optimization of manufacturing processes, the use of AI for quality improvement and defect detection, and the optimization of material flows to maximize the use of regenerated components. Proposals should also consider the implementation of explainable AI solutions that support both technical and organizational structures, while addressing data access and security concerns.

title: HORIZON-EIC-2026-BAS-01-ECOSYSTEM
summary_text: The grant call focuses on providing financial support to EIC Awardees for accessing R&D infrastructure, prototyping, and legal support services. Key research topics include the development and implementation of services that enhance innovation and entrepreneurship within the EIC Ecosystem, as well as monitoring and evaluating the impact of these services on the recipients. The initiative aims to facilitate collaboration among various stakeholders and ensure effective financial management and reporting throughout the project duration.

title: R&I in Support of the Clean Industrial Deal: Clean Technologies for Climate Action
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing clean technology solutions that enhance the competitiveness, sustainability, and resilience of the EU's industrial sector, particularly in the context of decarbonization and biodiversity preservation. Key research topics include the development of integrated net-zero emissions energy systems, enhanced zero-emission power technologies, and innovative storage solutions, including renewable fuels and carbon capture technologies. Proposals should aim to bring these technologies to market readiness, emphasizing circular material use, cost reduction, and collaboration among stakeholders to support the Clean Industrial Deal objectives.

title: R&I in Support of the Clean Industrial Deal: Decarbonisation of energy intensive industries (IA) (Processes4Planet and Clean Steel partnerships)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing innovative technologies for the decarbonization of energy-intensive industries in Europe, emphasizing the development of operational demonstrators and the commercialization of clean products. Key research topics include optimizing carbon capture, utilization, and storage (CCU/CCUS) technologies, enhancing clean energy usage in production processes (such as electrification and hydrogen integration), and improving circularity and resource efficiency in industrial processes. Proposals should demonstrate market readiness and a clear business strategy while addressing environmental impacts and promoting sustainable practices.

title: R&I in Support of the Clean Industrial Deal: Decarbonisation of energy intensive industries (IA) (Processes4Planet and Clean Steel partnerships)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing innovative technologies for the decarbonization of energy-intensive industries in Europe. Key research topics include optimizing carbon capture, utilization, and storage (CCU/CCUS) technologies, enhancing clean energy usage in production processes (such as electrification and hydrogen integration), and improving circularity and resource efficiency in industrial operations. Proposals should aim for significant reductions in energy input and raw material consumption while ensuring commercial viability and market readiness of clean products and processes.

title: R&I in Support of the Clean Industrial Deal: Clean Technologies for Climate Action
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing clean technology solutions that enhance the competitiveness, sustainability, and resilience of the EU's industrial sector, particularly in the context of decarbonization and biodiversity preservation. Key research topics include the development of integrated net-zero emissions energy systems, enhanced zero-emission power technologies, and innovative storage solutions, including renewable fuels and carbon capture technologies. Proposals should aim to bring these technologies to market readiness while ensuring a significant increase in circular material use and a reduction in the levelized cost of energy, all while considering the impact on biodiversity and fostering collaboration among stakeholders in the clean tech value chain.

title: Thematic Networks of Excellence for AI in Science (RAISE pilot) (RIA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on establishing networks of leading European research labs dedicated to collaborative research using AI in strategic scientific areas, particularly in materials science. Key research topics include developing a strategic research agenda to address grand scientific challenges with AI, fostering talent and knowledge exchange, and creating community-driven standards for AI models. Additionally, the initiative aims to enhance collaboration with industry and integrate expertise from social sciences and humanities to advance AI applications in scientific research.

title: Thematic Networks of Excellence for AI in Science â€“ Agriculture and Environmental Pollution (RAISE pilot)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on establishing a network of leading European research labs dedicated to the application of AI in agricultural sciences and environmental pollution sciences. Key research topics include developing a strategic research agenda to address significant scientific challenges using AI, fostering collaboration among labs, and enhancing talent exchange and knowledge sharing. The initiative aims to reinforce the European AI in science community and promote innovative AI solutions in these thematic areas.

title: Automated Scientific Discovery â€“ Food (RAISE pilot)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development of closed-loop scientific experimentation systems that integrate laboratory automation with AI-driven decision-making processes. Key research topics include the creation of autonomous and adaptive AI systems for laboratory instruments, scalable automation solutions for collaborative experimentation across multiple labs, and the establishment of robust data management systems for efficient data handling and sharing. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of safety, security, and ethical compliance in the design of these systems, as well as the potential impact on various scientific disciplines, particularly in areas like biomass and precision fermentation.

title: Automated Scientific Discovery (RAISE pilot) (RIA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development of closed-loop scientific experimentation systems that integrate laboratory automation with AI-driven decision-making processes. This includes creating autonomous and adaptive AI systems for planning and executing experiments, enhancing collaboration across multiple labs, and establishing robust data management systems for efficient data handling and sharing. The initiative emphasizes interdisciplinary collaboration, particularly in materials science, with potential applications in drug discovery, battery technologies, and sustainable practices.

title: Fast Track to Research and Innovation for breakthroughs in industrial technologies (Research and Innovation Action)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on breakthrough innovations in industrial technologies, specifically targeting advancements up to Technology Readiness Level (TRL) 4. Key research topics include contributions to the Strategic Research and Innovation Agendas (SRIAs) related to sustainable manufacturing, clean steel production, innovative advanced materials, and future textiles. Proposals should aim to create open-ended innovations that enhance the knowledge pipeline within these areas.

title: Fast Track to Innovation for breakthroughs in the Chemical Industry Action Plan  (Research and Innovation Action)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on accelerating the market uptake of innovative solutions for decarbonising the chemical industry, promoting circular economy practices, and developing breakthrough production technologies. Additionally, the call emphasizes the creation of alternatives to substances of concern, including new chemical substances and advanced materials, while considering the application of the Safe and Sustainable by Design (SSbD) Framework.

title: New approaches for Human/AI collaboration for the workforce of the future (RIA) (Made in Europe and AI, Data and Robotics partnerships)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on innovative AI approaches to enhance human-machine collaboration in advanced manufacturing. This includes human-AI co-learning for knowledge capture and upskilling, the development of natural interaction models for effective teamwork, and adaptive interfaces that cater to diverse human abilities and cultural needs. Proposals should also address inclusivity, ethical considerations, and the integration of gender perspectives in AI systems, while building on previous projects related to Extended Reality Technologies.

title: Efficient energy input from renewable sources and energy management in the process industries (IA) (Processes4Planet and Innovative Advanced Materials for the EU partnerships)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on significant decarbonization in process industries through innovative technologies that reduce greenhouse gas emissions by at least 20%. Key research topics include the development of renewable energy alternatives for low/medium and high-temperature processes, energy efficiency improvements, advanced materials for energy storage, and integrated energy systems that accommodate fluctuations in renewable energy availability. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of hybrid solutions and the use of innovative materials that minimize critical raw material usage while enhancing heat capture and storage capabilities.

title: MSCA Staff Exchanges 2026
summary_text: The MSCA Staff Exchanges focus on enhancing international, inter-sectoral, and interdisciplinary collaboration in research and innovation (R&I) through staff mobility between academic and non-academic organizations. Key research topics include the development of innovative products and services, knowledge transfer, and the fostering of entrepreneurial mindsets. The initiative aims to strengthen collaborative networks, improve research skills, and facilitate the sharing of innovative approaches across diverse scientific disciplines.

title: Cooperation on innovative advanced materials with Japan (CSA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on innovative advanced materials, emphasizing their importance for industrial competitiveness and strategic autonomy in both Japan and Europe. The initiative aims to facilitate collaborative research visits between European researchers and Japanese institutions, particularly in applications related to mobility, energy, construction, electronics, and medical devices. The goal is to strengthen existing collaborations and foster new partnerships in the field of advanced materials.

title: Mapping and service finder for Technology Infrastructures (CSA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on creating an interactive portal to improve visibility and access to technology infrastructures across Europe, particularly for SMEs, startups, and scaleups. This includes developing a comprehensive inventory and taxonomy of existing technology infrastructure services, facilitating cooperation between infrastructure operators and industry, and enhancing transnational collaboration among technology infrastructures. The initiative aims to boost innovation and market potential by providing a user-friendly platform that supports the development, testing, and deployment of new technologies while ensuring long-term sustainability and interoperability with existing initiatives.

title: Monitoring of secondary raw materials (CSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the knowledge base of secondary raw materials in the EU and third countries, emphasizing their potential, resource estimation, production, refining processes, and biodiversity impact. Key research topics include the classification and recovery of secondary raw materials, particularly critical materials such as waste batteries, WEEE, mining waste, and construction debris, as well as the development of comprehensive resource classification approaches and natural capital accounting frameworks. The initiative aims to improve EU raw materials intelligence, address supply and demand bottlenecks, and foster international cooperation on raw materials sourcing.

title: Advanced manufacturing for key products (IA) (Made in Europe partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advanced manufacturing technologies and machinery aimed at enhancing manufacturing excellence and circularity in Europe. Key research topics include the development of innovative manufacturing processes that utilize advanced materials and secondary raw materials, with an emphasis on resource efficiency, reduced reliance on critical raw materials, and improved performance of manufactured products. Specific areas of interest include additive manufacturing, hybrid manufacturing, advanced joining technologies, and the use of lightweight and functionalized materials, all contributing to the competitiveness and resilience of the European industry.

title: Pilot access schemes to Technology Infrastructures for European startups, scaleups and innovative SMEs (CSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing access to technology infrastructure services for industrial users, particularly startups, scaleups, and innovative SMEs, in priority areas such as advanced materials, clean energy, and health and biotechnology. It aims to develop pilot multi-site access schemes that simplify and standardize access conditions across the EU, thereby strengthening innovation capacity and facilitating the testing and commercialization of new technologies. Additionally, the call emphasizes fostering transnational collaboration among technology infrastructures to build ecosystems that support resource sharing and best practices.

title: Circular innovative advanced materials: facilitating the transition from design to markets (RIA) (Innovative Advanced Materials for the EU and Made in Europe partnerships)
summary_text: The research focus of this grant call centers on the development and adoption of innovative advanced materials (IAMs) designed for circularity, particularly in recyclable polymers, composites, and metals for additive manufacturing. Key topics include enhancing resource efficiency, creating circular business models, and ensuring the integration of these materials into industrial manufacturing processes. Proposals should also emphasize collaboration across value chains, the use of digital tools and FAIR data principles, and the demonstration of transformative solutions in strategic sectors such as mobility and medical devices.

title: Technologies for innovative extraction of critical raw materials (RIA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing and validating innovative and sustainable technologies for the extraction of complex and difficult-to-access mineral deposits, particularly from abandoned mining sites. Emphasis is placed on improving the efficiency and environmental impact of raw materials extraction, including reducing greenhouse gas emissions and enhancing biodiversity outcomes. Additionally, the involvement of the mining industry and collaboration with international partners, particularly those in strategic partnerships with the EU, are highlighted as essential components of the proposed actions.

title: Enhancing industry-academia knowledge exchange in Social Sciences and Humanities (SSH) (CSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on leveraging the strengths of social sciences, humanities, and arts (SSH) to enhance innovation capabilities in industry, particularly for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). Key research topics include understanding the socio-technical implications of new technologies, addressing customer needs, integrating considerations of social and economic inequality into industry practices, and developing methodologies for effective knowledge exchange between SSH researchers and industry. The initiative aims to foster collaboration through co-creation activities such as hackathons and mentorship programs to drive organizational development and sustainability.

title: Innovative technologies and tools for exploration and data modelling of raw materials (RIA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the understanding and exploration of critical raw materials within the EU. This includes developing advanced geological modeling and mineral system analysis using multi-source data, integrating innovative technologies such as AI and machine learning, and improving geological characterization and mapping of mineral deposits. The aim is to identify new exploration areas, strengthen the EU's supply of primary raw materials, and support the National exploration programmes as outlined in the Critical Raw Materials Regulation.

title: Improving availability of secondary raw materials through recycling (IA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing technologies for the recycling and re-use of critical raw materials, specifically metals, from end-of-life products and urban mines. Key research topics include the development of efficient disassembly, separation, and sorting processes, as well as strategies to minimize biodiversity impacts and promote the renaturation of urban mining sites. Additionally, projects should emphasize the entire recycling chain, from collection to purification of secondary raw materials, while ensuring high-quality outputs and fostering collaboration within the recycling industry in the EU.

title: Optimise the usage of resources in a circular economy (RIA) (Processes4Planet and Clean Steel partnerships)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing material recycling and upcycling through technology development and value chain optimization, aiming to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and reliance on imported raw materials. Key research topics include improving the efficiency of resource recovery from production waste, minimizing energy and water usage, and developing low-CO2 processes for recycling. Additionally, the call emphasizes the importance of addressing impurities in materials, fostering circular material flows, and integrating secondary resources into production processes to promote sustainability and reduce environmental impact.

title: Efficient capture / purification / utilisation of CO2 for the production of competitive products (RIA) (Processes4Planet partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing the sustainable valorisation of CO2 through the development of innovative methodologies, processes, and technologies that optimize CO2 capture, purification, and conversion. Key research topics include reducing energy consumption and capital costs, integrating renewable energy sources, enhancing process efficiency, and addressing thermodynamic constraints to maximize yield. Proposals should also emphasize lifecycle assessments, scalability, and the societal and environmental impacts of the solutions, with a goal of supporting industrial decarbonization in Europe.

title: Attracting management talent for capacity building for Technology Infrastructures staff members (CSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the management and operational effectiveness of Technology Infrastructures across EU member states. Key research topics include developing training programs for staff to improve sector-agnostic competencies, fostering collaboration between research and technology infrastructures, and promoting entrepreneurial skills among staff. Additionally, proposals should address the need for improved business models, governance, and the sharing of best practices to optimize services for industry, particularly for SMEs, startups, and scaleups.

title: Accelerating the discovery and development of chemicals and innovative advanced materials through digitalisation and artificial intelligence (IA) (Innovative Advanced Materials for the EU partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on accelerating the discovery and development of innovative advanced materials and chemicals through the use of digital tools and methodologies, including artificial intelligence and self-driving labs. Key research topics include the design of experiments and simulations, the operationalization of the Safe and Sustainable by Design (SSbD) framework, and the development of interoperable workflows that enhance risk assessment and market access for new substances. Proposals should aim to create demonstrators that validate material properties in realistic conditions and foster collaboration with existing initiatives to streamline data sharing and enhance innovation in materials development.

title: â€˜Proof of marketâ€™ to improve valorisation and commercialisation of Horizon generated R&I results (IA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the commercial potential of research results from Horizon projects, particularly within the domains of Digital, Industry, and Space. Key research topics include the valorisation of innovations through technology demonstration, market analysis, technology assessment, and compliance with regulatory standards, with an emphasis on engaging startups and SMEs in the commercialization process. Proposals should leverage knowledge assets from previous projects, including intellectual property, to outline a clear pathway to market for the developed technologies.

title: Large-Scale Photonic Quantum Computing Platform Technologies (RIA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing photonic quantum computing by addressing key technical challenges such as improving photonic entanglement efficiency and developing standardized control systems for hardware and software integration. Proposals should aim to create scalable, modular quantum computing platforms with high connectivity and low error rates, culminating in the demonstration of a photonic NISQ processor and a full-stack quantum computer by 2030. Additionally, the initiative emphasizes the importance of interoperability, standardization, and collaboration with industry partners to ensure practical applications and commercial viability.

title: Fostering 2-Dimensional Materials (2DM) based emerging and enabling technologies (CSA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the impact of EU-funded research and innovation in two-dimensional materials (2DM) and related technologies. This includes fostering collaboration among projects, supporting R&I roadmapping and standardization, maintaining updated R&I landscapes, and amplifying communication efforts within the graphene and 2DM community. Additionally, the proposals should encourage synergies with national and regional initiatives and partnerships in advanced materials.

title: Web 4.0 architectural framework and Open Internet Stack applications for virtual worlds (RIA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on two main research areas: the development of a human-centric Web 4.0 architectural framework and the creation of alternative decentralized applications and services. The architectural framework aims to establish interoperable, secure, and trustable building blocks utilizing open-source software, while the applications area emphasizes the use of extended reality technologies for communication and collaboration within virtual worlds. Both areas require proposals to demonstrate technical maturity, community support, and compliance with EU regulations, fostering synergies with existing European initiatives.

title: Apply AI: Pilot of the â€œScience for AIâ€ Pillar of RAISE (â€œResource for AI science in Europeâ€) (RIA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing core AI capabilities through the establishment of a network of leading European AI research institutions. Key research topics include fundamental AI research, collaboration among AI labs, and the development of a strategic research agenda aimed at pushing the frontiers of AI technology. The initiative emphasizes the importance of attracting talent, fostering industrial partnerships, and enhancing cooperation within a virtual institute framework to ensure Europe's leadership in AI research.

title: Open Internet Stack Support for Scale (CSA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the development of a centralized hub for cataloguing and validating Open Internet Stack components, including conducting security and accessibility audits on selected solutions. Additionally, the initiative aims to establish sustainability models for Open Source projects, create a common branding and communication strategy, and develop tailored training materials that emphasize compliance with EU legislation and security standards. The project also seeks to foster collaboration with national and pan-European initiatives to promote Open Source solutions and attract technology adopters.

title: Apply AI: Robotics for Manufacturing: Advancing Core Skills through Technical Challenges (RIA) (Partnership in AI, Data and Robotics)
summary_text: The project focuses on enhancing robotics capabilities in manufacturing, particularly in the automotive sector, by developing advanced robotics skills such as high precision autonomous manipulation and human-robot collaboration. It aims to create a comprehensive framework for flexible robotics skills development, facilitating the deployment of adaptable and modular solutions across various industrial contexts. The initiative includes a multi-stage competition to identify and support innovative solutions that address defined technical challenges, ensuring industrial relevance and promoting collaboration with user-industry partners.

title: Efficient and compliant access to and use of data (IA) (AI, Data and Robotics partnership)
summary_text:
The grant call focuses on two main research areas: 

1. **AI-Driven Compliance Technologies**: This area emphasizes the development of advanced technologies that automate regulatory processes, reduce administrative burdens, and enhance compliance with EU rules. It includes the creation of digital tools for real-time compliance guidance, automated rule drafting, and predictive analytics to streamline regulatory oversight and promote cross-border cooperation.

2. **Secure Data Management Systems**: This area targets the design and deployment of scalable data management systems that ensure seamless data integration and sharing across sectors. It aims to enhance data quality, privacy, and interoperability while supporting the generation of high-quality synthetic data, thereby facilitating the effective use of AI in various applications, including public services and industry.

title: Open Internet Stack Sovereign Solutions (RIA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing open-source solutions within the Open Internet Stack framework, emphasizing the creation of interoperable, decentralized technologies that support trust and sovereignty in Europe. Key research topics include network and transport technologies, sovereign operating systems, and open-source software productivity tools. Proposals should demonstrate technical maturity, community support, and a credible path for integration and deployment across various sectors, including SMEs and public administrations.

title: Standards for Quantum Technologies â€“ Coordination and Support Action (CSA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the development and adoption of standards for quantum technologies, specifically in quantum computing, communication, and sensing. Key research topics include the standardization of hardware-software interfaces, quantum sensing protocols, control electronics, and benchmarking methodologies, with an emphasis on enhancing interoperability and reliability in quantum systems. The initiative aims to engage European stakeholders, including SMEs and start-ups, in international standardization efforts to strengthen Europe's position in the global quantum landscape.

title: Advanced Local Digital Twins using AI for Early Warning and Preparedness (IA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on developing open AI models to enhance disaster management, particularly for urban flooding, by enabling proactive decision-making and urban resilience planning. Key research topics include the integration of diverse datasets for improved flood modeling, the creation of Local Digital Twins for simulating flood scenarios, and the development of innovative AI algorithms tailored to local characteristics. The initiative emphasizes open-source solutions and aims to ensure the applicability of results in various contexts, including low- and middle-income countries.

title: Grand Challenge on Quantum Sensors for Inertial Navigation
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing quantum-enabled navigation systems (Q-INS) for applications in GNSS-denied environments, emphasizing two main categories: cold-atom Q-INS and chip-scale Q-INS. Key research topics include the development of technical and financial roadmaps, investor-readiness analyses, and supply-chain sovereignty assessments, aimed at enhancing the commercial viability and industrialization of these quantum technologies. The initiative seeks to establish credible benchmarks and prototypes to support future investments and strengthen the EU's technological sovereignty in navigation infrastructures.

title: Challenge-Driven GenAI4EU Booster in Apply AI prioritised sectors (RIA) (AI/Data/Robotics Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing Generative AI (GenAI) applications in three key sectors: aerospace, pharmaceuticals/drug development, and telecommunications. It aims to foster innovation and competitiveness by organizing a multi-stage competition that encourages the development of GenAI solutions to address specific challenges within these industries, such as optimizing aircraft design, accelerating drug discovery, and enhancing network management. Proposals must clearly define their sector focus and demonstrate collaboration with industry partners to maximize the impact of the developed solutions.

title: Developing and demonstrating core technologies for Virtual Worlds and Web 4.0 (IA) (Virtual worlds Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing eXtended Reality (XR) and immersive technologies to create the next generation of virtual worlds, emphasizing enhanced user immersion, interaction, and real-time responsiveness. Key research topics include the development of human-centric asset and scene creation technologies, the integration of Generative AI for personalized experiences, and the interoperability of XR applications with Telco-Cloud-to-Edge Continuum components. Proposals should also address the establishment of technological standards and protocols for seamless user interaction and demonstrate the practical application of these technologies in real-world scenarios.

title: Networking and Future Photonics Strategy  (CSA) (Photonics Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics and scientific focus areas include the development and updating of the European Photonics Strategic Research and Innovation Agenda (SRIA), coordination and monitoring of photonics-related research and innovation projects, and enhancing stakeholder engagement across the photonics ecosystem. Additionally, the emphasis is on improving access to financing for photonics innovation, fostering collaboration with other European initiatives, and increasing the visibility of photonics as a vital technology for achieving EU priorities in digital and green transitions.

title: Strengthening the cooperation of semiconductor-intensive EU regions (CSA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing cooperation among semiconductor-intensive regions and their industrial clusters, with an emphasis on developing regional ecosystems that support semiconductor production and services. The scientific focus areas include mapping regional semiconductor supply chains, identifying common needs, and creating strategies to strengthen collaboration, particularly with the Chips Competence Centres. Additionally, the initiative aims to gather evidence on investment obstacles, share best practices, and establish a sustainable platform for information exchange among stakeholders in the semiconductor sector.

title: Energy efficiency and sustainability of AI data processing in Data Centres (IA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing energy-efficient and sustainable AI data processing in data centers through several key research topics. These include innovations in thermal management techniques for high-power AI chips, development of novel backup power systems with minimal cooling needs, and optimization methods for data center operations to enhance energy efficiency. Additionally, the establishment of a pilot demonstration site is emphasized, which will serve as a European reference for showcasing breakthroughs in energy-efficient data center technologies.

title: Create a thriving and competitive Virtual Worlds and Web 4.0 ecosystem (CSA) (Virtual Worlds Partnership)
summary_text: The key research topics and scientific focus areas of the grant call include the development and promotion of open, interoperable, inclusive, and trustworthy virtual worlds systems and applications. The initiative aims to strengthen the European Virtual Worlds Partnership, enhance the competitive ecosystem for virtual worlds technologies, and foster collaboration among academia, industry, and public actors. Additionally, it emphasizes the importance of standardization, ethical considerations, and the integration of social sciences and humanities to ensure the societal impact of virtual worlds research.

title: International cooperation in AI (IA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the adoption and deployment of AI solutions in low- and middle-income countries through tailored approaches that utilize local data. Key research topics include the establishment of Living Labs for co-creation of AI technologies, the development of context-specific AI solutions addressing societal challenges in education, healthcare, agriculture, and environmental sustainability, and fostering local innovation ecosystems to support sustainable socio-economic impact. The initiative aims to strengthen digital partnerships and promote responsible AI development aligned with EU strategies.

title: Advanced and Innovative hardware components for Virtual Worlds (RIA) (Virtual Worlds Partnership)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing XR (Extended Reality) technologies, specifically through the development of innovative hardware such as headsets, wearables, haptic components, and non-invasive brain-computer interfaces. Key research topics include enhancing multisensory immersion by integrating sight, sound, touch, and other senses, as well as improving the synchronization and interoperability of these technologies. Proposals should also emphasize inclusivity, energy efficiency, and the involvement of social sciences to maximize societal impact.

title: Facilitate the engagement of European stakeholders in international digital standardisation (CSA)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing European participation in digital standardization to bolster EU competitiveness and promote EU values in the global digital landscape. This includes improving the skills of experts from SMEs, research institutions, and academia, conducting landscape and gap analyses of digital technologies, and providing foresight analyses for emerging technologies. Additionally, the initiative aims to raise awareness of the benefits of digital standardization, particularly for SMEs, and to support the active involvement of European stakeholders in international standard-setting activities.

title: Apply AI: Challenge-Driven AI Innovation Booster in Apply AI prioritised sectors (RIA) (Partnership in AI, Data and Robotics)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing AI technologies in three strategic sectors: healthcare, advanced manufacturing, and autonomous driving. It aims to drive innovation through challenge-oriented, AI-powered solutions that enhance diagnostics, optimize production processes, and improve vehicle safety and navigation. Proposals should emphasize collaboration among industry partners and include a multi-stage competition to foster the development and adoption of impactful AI applications within these domains.

title: Apply AI: AI-Driven Robotics for Industry: Enabling System Integration and Adoption (IA) (Partnership in AI, Data and Robotics)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on advancing AI-powered robotics through the development of modular and interoperable integration frameworks that enhance system integration capabilities across various industries. Key research topics include the creation of standardized protocols for data and safety testing, the promotion of energy-efficient AI models, and the use of high-fidelity simulation environments for training and validation. The aim is to facilitate the deployment of robotics solutions, particularly for SMEs, by providing practical tools, guidelines, and reusable datasets that support the seamless adoption of AI-driven technologies in diverse industrial settings.

title: Demand-side 3C pilot demonstrators on converged Telco Edge Cloud Infrastructure (IA)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on the validation and integration of open orchestration platforms within the telco-cloud-edge continuum, emphasizing the transformative potential of AI for various European industries. Key research topics include the development of demand-side pilot demonstrators in sectors such as smart mobility and energy, leveraging advanced network features like automation, security, and low latency to enhance digital communication services. Additionally, the call highlights the importance of data governance, interoperability, and the use of open-source frameworks to foster innovation and sustainability in connected, collaborative computing networks.

title: New approaches for decentralized, federated and sustainable AI data processing (RIA)
