summary_text: The Research Management Facility focuses on enhancing research management capacities in Widening countries to improve their participation in the European Research Area. Key research topics include institutional reforms in research management, development of tailored implementation plans, training for research managers, and fostering multidisciplinary and transnational cooperation. The initiative aims to strengthen governance, efficiency, and alignment with European research priorities while promoting best practices in research integrity and responsible research and innovation.

title: MSCA Postdoctoral Fellowships 2026
summary_text: The grant call focuses on enhancing the research and transferable skills of postdoctoral fellows through international mobility and interdisciplinary collaboration, aiming to improve their employability and career prospects. It emphasizes the importance of integrating digital skills, fostering Open Science, and promoting knowledge transfer between academic and non-academic sectors. Additionally, it supports research in nuclear expertise under the Euratom Research and Training Programme and encourages participation from widening countries to strengthen the European Research Area.

title: NLM Research Grants in Biomedical Informatics and Data Science (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The National Library of Medicine (NLM) is focused on supporting innovative research in biomedical informatics and data science, particularly in areas that enhance biomedical discovery and data-driven health. Key topics include the development of new methods for integrating complex research outputs, improving clinical care and public health practices, and creating scalable and reusable approaches for the curation, analysis, and management of health-related data.

title: Standardizing Data and Metadata from Wearable Devices (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development of standards for data accessibility from personal tracking devices, aiming to facilitate collaboration between researchers and device manufacturers. The initiative seeks to establish data standards similar to existing medical imaging formats like DICOM and NIfTI, enhancing the usability of personal tracking device data in research.

title: High Priority HIV and Substance Use Research (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on innovative research at the intersection of HIV and substance use, aiming to explore new avenues for prevention, treatment, and potential cures for HIV among people who use drugs (PWUD). It encourages projects across a spectrum of research areas, including basic science, clinical, and implementation research, with a requirement for a detailed research plan and preliminary data. All studies must align with NIH HIV/AIDS research priorities.

title: Single Cell Opioid Responses in the Context of HIV (SCORCH) Program:  Data Mining and Functional Validation (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on data mining of single cell datasets to identify key biological components such as cell types, transcripts, enhancers, and transcriptional networks related to HIV and antiretroviral therapy (ART) or substance use disorder (SUD). It also supports functional validation studies to confirm the biological roles of these identified components in the context of HIV/ART and SUD molecular responses.

title: Advancing Healthcare for Older Adults from Populations that Experience Health Disparities (R01 - Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This initiative focuses on advancing health care research for older adults facing health disparities. Key research topics include improving screening and diagnostic guidelines in primary care, enhancing shared decision-making between clinicians and older adults with their caregivers, and identifying effective care coordination strategies.

title: Mechanisms that Impact Cancer Risk after Bariatric Surgery (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking research proposals that explore the mechanisms by which bariatric surgery influences cancer risk. The focus is on understanding the long-term effects of bariatric surgery on cancer, rather than its immediate outcomes like weight loss and diabetes management.

title: Mechanisms that Impact Cancer Risk after Bariatric Surgery (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking applications for studies that explore the mechanisms by which bariatric surgery influences cancer risk, focusing on long-term outcomes rather than short-term effects like weight loss and diabetes. The initiative aims to support proof of concept studies that are novel and not previously developed in the literature.

title: Imaging - Science Track Award for Research Transition (I/START) (R03 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on advancing brain imaging research, particularly in the context of substance use disorders and addiction. It aims to support both new and established investigators in developing neuroimaging tools and conducting small proof-of-concept studies.

title: HEAL Initiative: Studies to Enable Analgesic Discovery (R61/R33 - Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the development of safe, effective, and non-addictive therapeutics for pain management. Key research topics include the creation of assays for drug discovery, screening for potential therapeutic agents, and the initial characterization of small molecules, biologics, and natural products.

title: Mechanism for Time-Sensitive Substance Use Research (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The key research topics in this funding opportunity focus on substance use epidemiology and health services, specifically addressing sudden spikes in drug use, emerging marijuana trends, timely prescription drug abuse issues, evolving addiction services in healthcare, and changes in the criminal or juvenile justice systems related to drug abuse. The emphasis is on conducting pilot or exploratory research that responds rapidly to these urgent and time-sensitive issues.

title: BRAIN Initiative: New Technologies and Novel Approaches for Recording and Modulation in the Nervous System (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the development and proof-of-concept testing of innovative technologies for recording and modulating neural cells and circuits, aimed at enhancing the understanding of dynamic signaling in the central nervous system. Key research topics include the creation of instrumentation, devices, and molecular constructs that utilize various modalities (optical, electrical, magnetic, acoustic) to manipulate neural activity and engage non-neuronal cells. The goal is to overcome barriers in neurobiological experimentation, facilitating new discoveries in neural circuit function through technologies that are validated in vivo.

title: Mitochondrial-associated Mechanisms of Neuropathological and Immunodeficient Aging in the Context of HIV and SUD (R21 Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on research exploring the interplay between mitochondrial function, aging, and HIV infection, particularly in relation to the effects of addictive substances. It aims to uncover both protective and pathogenic mechanisms to inform the development of targeted therapies for individuals aging with HIV and substance use issues.

title: Mitochondrial-associated Mechanisms of Neuropathological and Immunodeficient Aging in the Context of HIV and SUD (R01 Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on research exploring the interplay between mitochondrial function, aging, and HIV infection, particularly in relation to the effects of addictive substances. It aims to uncover both protective and pathogenic mechanisms to inform the development of targeted therapies for individuals aging with HIV and substance use issues.

title: Limited Competition: CCRP Initiative: Promoting a Basic Understanding of Chemical Threats to Skin (R34 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics of this funding opportunity focus on understanding skin injuries caused by harmful chemicals, emphasizing the investigation of commonalities in these injuries. The scientific focus areas include identifying shared signaling pathways and potential therapeutic targets for developing medical countermeasures.

title: Revision Applications for Validation of Biomarker Assays Developed Through NIH-Supported Research Grants (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the adaptation and clinical validation of molecular, cellular, and imaging biomarkers for cancer detection, diagnosis, prognosis, treatment response prediction, and cancer control and prevention. It encourages collaborative research involving scientists, assay developers, clinicians, and statisticians to facilitate the integration of validated assays into clinical trials. The emphasis is on utilizing well-annotated specimens for clinical validation rather than early-stage technology development or conducting clinical trials.

title: Interventions to expand cancer screening and preventive services to ADVANCE health in populations that experience health disparities (R01, Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on researching barriers and facilitators to cancer screening and preventive services in populations facing health disparities. It encourages the development of interventions that improve the uptake of these services, including timely follow-up and referrals, while addressing factors at multiple levels: patient, clinician, healthcare setting, and community. Collaborative projects with community partners and service providers are also emphasized.

title: NCI Small Grants Program for Cancer Research (NCI Omnibus) (R03 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The funding opportunity focuses on small-scale cancer research projects, including pilot studies, feasibility studies, and secondary analyses of existing data. It also supports the development of research methodologies and new research technologies related to cancer.

title: NIDCD Early Career Research(ECR) Award (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The NIDCD Early Career Research Award focuses on basic and clinical research in the areas of hearing, balance, smell, taste, voice, speech, and language. It supports various project types, including secondary data analysis, small research projects, methodology development, translational research, outcomes research, and new technology development, with the goal of generating preliminary data for future R01 applications.

title: Innovation Grants to Nurture Initial Translational Efforts (IGNITE): Assay Development and Neurotherapeutic Agent Identification (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on developing in vitro and ex vivo assays to identify and characterize potential therapeutic agents for neurological and neuromuscular disorders. It aims to support iterative screening efforts that advance projects towards meeting the entry criteria for translational programs like the Blueprint Neurotherapeutics Network.

title: Innovation Grants to Nurture Initial Translational Efforts (IGNITE):  Development and Validation of Model Systems to Facilitate Neurotherapeutic Discovery (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the development and validation of animal models and ex vivo systems that accurately represent neurological and neuromuscular disorders. The aim is to enhance the translational relevance of these models for assessing the efficacy of neurotherapeutics in both preclinical and clinical settings, thereby supporting early-stage drug discovery efforts.

title: Implementation Research for Multi-morbidity Management in the Context of Non-communicable Diseases in Low- and Middle-Income Countries and US Tribal Populations  (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The NIH and GACD are seeking implementation research proposals focused on noncommunicable diseases (NCDs) specifically in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs) and American Indian/Alaskan Native (AI/AN) Tribal Nation populations in the U.S. The emphasis is on addressing the challenges and strategies for managing NCDs in these underserved communities.

title: Implementation Research for Multi-morbidity Management in the Context of Non-communicable Diseases in Low- and Middle-Income Countries and US Tribal Populations  (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The NIH and GACD are seeking research proposals focused on implementation strategies for noncommunicable diseases (NCDs) specifically in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs) and American Indian/Alaskan Native populations in the U.S. The emphasis is on addressing the challenges and improving health outcomes related to NCDs in these communities.

title: Pilot Projects Investigating Understudied Proteins Associated with Rare Diseases (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on pilot projects aimed at investigating the roles of understudied proteins linked to rare diseases. The goal is to generate preliminary data and tools for these proteins, which belong to druggable protein families associated with specific rare diseases, thereby advancing research in this area.

title: Development of Biomarkers or Composite Biomarkers for Neurological and Neuromuscular Disorders (R61/R33 - Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the discovery and early evaluation of candidate biomarkers and biomarker signatures for neurological and neuromuscular disorders. It emphasizes the need for both biological and clinical assessments, including preliminary evaluations using standardized human samples or datasets, to facilitate the development of neurotherapeutics. The ultimate aim is to produce biomarkers that are prepared for further validation studies.

title: Dissemination and Implementation Research in Health (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at identifying and testing strategies to enhance the adoption and sustainability of evidence-based interventions in health. It also encourages studies that explore the de-implementation of ineffective or harmful practices, as well as the advancement of dissemination and implementation research methods. Additionally, there is an emphasis on re-implementing health services that may be disrupted during disasters, such as pandemics.

title: Computational Approaches to Curation at Scale for Biomedical Research Assets (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on developing innovative computational approaches to enhance the curation processes of biomedical datasets and models. The aim is to facilitate data mining and knowledge discovery from the increasing volumes of biomedical data generated by advancements in data science.

title: Translational Neural Devices (R61/R33 - Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on advancing the development of therapeutic and diagnostic devices for nervous and neuromuscular disorders. Key research topics include the implementation of clinical prototype devices, non-clinical safety and efficacy testing, and conducting small clinical studies to gather essential data on device functionality and design.

title: Screening and Functional Validation of Genomic Variants Associated with Human Congenital Anomalies (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This initiative focuses on the screening, functional validation, and characterization of genetic variants associated with congenital anomalies, intellectual developmental disabilities, and inborn errors of metabolism. It aims to bridge the gap between identifying genetic variants through advanced sequencing technologies and understanding their functional impacts on phenotypes, utilizing in-silico tools, animal models, and in vitro systems.

title: Dissemination and Implementation Research in Health (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at identifying and developing strategies to enhance the adoption and sustainability of evidence-based interventions and practices. It also encourages studies that explore the de-implementation of ineffective or harmful practices, as well as advancements in dissemination and implementation research methods and measures.

title: Enhancing Mechanistic Research on Precision Probiotic Therapies (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on innovative mechanistic research to enhance precision probiotic interventions by identifying person-specific factors that influence probiotic responses. Key research topics include characterizing host biological patterns such as microbiome composition, immune response, and lifestyle factors that contribute to variability in probiotic effectiveness. The initiative aims to develop strategies to improve clinical outcomes for probiotics by addressing the heterogeneity in human responses through a phased research approach.

title: Effectiveness Trials for Post-Acute Interventions and Services to Optimize Longer-term Outcomes (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The NIMH is seeking research projects focused on evaluating the effectiveness of therapeutic and service delivery interventions for managing mental health conditions in youth, adults, and older adults during the post-acute phase. Key areas of interest include clinical trials that assess the effectiveness of interventions tailored to the stage of illness, addressing aspects such as symptom management, relapse prevention, and service adherence, as well as exploring moderators, mediators, and mechanisms of action. Additionally, the call supports pilot trials to assess the feasibility and preliminary effectiveness of these interventions.

title: Enhancing Mechanistic Research on Precision Probiotic Therapies (R33 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on innovative mechanistic research aimed at enhancing precision probiotic interventions by characterizing individual-specific factors that influence probiotic responses. Key research topics include identifying subgroups of probiotic responders based on host biology patterns such as microbiome composition, immune system characteristics, and lifestyle factors, as well as developing strategies to overcome barriers to effective probiotic therapies. The initiative encourages rigorous studies using animal models or human subjects to explore the causality and predictability of these host biological patterns in relation to probiotic efficacy.

title: Dissemination and Implementation Research in Health (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at identifying and developing strategies to enhance the adoption and sustainability of evidence-based interventions and practices. It also encourages studies that explore the de-implementation of ineffective or harmful practices, as well as advancements in dissemination and implementation research methods and measures.

title: Pilot Effectiveness Trials for Post-Acute Interventions and Services to Optimize Longer-term Outcomes (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The NIMH is seeking applications for pilot projects that evaluate the effectiveness of therapeutic and service delivery interventions for managing mental health conditions in the post-acute phase. Key research topics include assessing the feasibility, tolerability, acceptability, safety, and preliminary effectiveness of these interventions, as well as their ability to engage underlying mechanisms and inform the design of larger-scale effectiveness trials.

title: CCRP Initiative: NIH Countermeasures Against Chemical Threats (CounterACT) Basic Research on Chemical Threats that Affect the Nervous System (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on basic research related to chemical warfare agents, toxic industrial chemicals, and pesticides that impact the nervous system. It aims to generate data on the mechanisms of toxicity, new manifestations of toxic exposures, and potential therapeutic targets associated with these chemical threats.

title: Innovation Grants to Nurture Initial Translational Efforts (IGNITE): Neurotherapeutic Agent Characterization and In vivo Efficacy Studies (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on conducting pharmacodynamic, pharmacokinetic, and in vivo efficacy studies for therapeutic agents aimed at treating neurological or neuromuscular disorders. It supports the development of small molecules, biologics, or biotechnology-derived products to demonstrate their biological activity and advance them towards further development in translational research.

title: Cancer Prevention and Control Clinical Trials Planning Grant Program (R34 Clinical Trials Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on facilitating clinical trials in cancer prevention and control, specifically targeting areas such as cancer prevention, health behaviors, screening, early detection, treatment management, supportive care, and long-term outcomes for cancer survivors. It emphasizes the need for preparatory studies to address information gaps related to study populations, intervention feasibility, and trial design, ultimately aiming to enhance trial efficiency and reduce costs.

title: Research Projects to Enhance Applicability of Mammalian Models for Translational Research (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking projects that enhance the effectiveness of mammalian cancer and tumor models for translational research. Key research topics include improving the representation of human biology in these models, addressing translational deficiencies, exploring new applications of mammalian models, and establishing standard practices for their use in clinical research. The focus is on ensuring these models provide reliable information that benefits patients.

title: Stimulating Hematology Investigation: New Endeavors (SHINE) (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The SHINE program focuses on promoting innovative research in nonmalignant hematology, particularly in basic and early translational studies. It encourages investigator-initiated projects that align with the missions of the NIDDK, NIA, and NHLBI, emphasizing emerging topics in the field that will be updated annually.

title: Development and Application of PET and SPECT Imaging Ligands as Biomarkers for Drug Discovery and for Pathophysiological Studies of CNS Disorders (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant opportunity focuses on the development and evaluation of novel radioligands for PET and SPECT imaging in the human brain. It emphasizes the incorporation of pilot or clinical feasibility evaluations based on previously collected pre-clinical data to advance promising PET ligands for clinical research applications.

title: NIA Multi-site Clinical Trial Implementation Grant (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity seeks applications for multi-site interventional clinical trials across all phases that are investigator-initiated and hypothesis-driven. The trials should align with the National Institute on Aging's (NIA) research mission, focusing on advancing knowledge in aging and age-related health issues.

title: Integration of Imaging and Fluid-Based Tumor Monitoring in Cancer Therapy (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking research projects that focus on integrating imaging techniques with fluid-based tumor monitoring, specifically liquid biopsy assays, during cancer therapy. The aim is to enhance the understanding of therapy response and the development of resistance in cancer patients.

title: Molecular Imaging of Inflammation in Cancer (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity invites research applications focused on the development and application of molecular imaging methods to investigate cancer inflammation in vivo. It emphasizes the need for integrated imaging approaches that enhance understanding of the dynamic interactions between cancer and inflammation, encouraging collaboration between cancer researchers and imaging scientists to explore inflammatory cellular physiology and molecular changes in response to treatment.

title: Clinical Characterization of Cancer Therapy-induced Adverse Sequelae and Mechanism-based Interventional Strategies (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on collaborative research aimed at understanding and addressing the long-term adverse effects of cancer therapies, including chronic comorbidities and delayed post-treatment effects. Key research topics include identifying the mechanisms behind therapy-induced sequelae, clinically characterizing these effects, and developing therapeutic strategies to prevent or mitigate them. The emphasis is on mechanistic studies with translational endpoints and the validation of clinical biomarkers and outcomes for future clinical trials.

title: Assay development and screening for discovery of chemical probes, drugs or immunomodulators (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking research proposals focused on the identification of small molecules that serve as chemical probes or therapeutic agents for disease targets, particularly in cancer. Key research topics include assay development for biological targets, high-throughput screening for small molecule compounds, hit validation through secondary assays and cheminformatics, and hit-to-lead optimization to enhance target engagement and therapeutic efficacy.

title: In-Depth Phenotyping and Research Using IMPC-Generated Knockout Mouse Strains Exhibiting Embryonic or Perinatal Lethality or Subviability (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the phenotyping and research of embryonic lethal knockout mouse strains generated by the International Mouse Phenotyping Consortium (IMPC). The aim is to create a comprehensive catalogue of mammalian gene function, particularly investigating the phenotypes of both homozygous lethal mutations and viable heterozygous phenotypes to enhance understanding of human genetic variation. Researchers are encouraged to utilize these mouse strains for in-depth studies as part of the IMPC's adult mouse phenotyping efforts.

title: Natural History of Disorders Screenable in the Newborn Period (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on expanding knowledge of the natural history of disorders included in newborn screening programs. This includes characterizing symptom development, establishing genotype-phenotype correlations, and identifying genetic, epigenetic, or environmental factors that influence clinical outcomes. The aim is to improve diagnostic accuracy, facilitate clinical trials, and enhance treatment and management strategies for affected infants.

title: Population Approaches to Reducing Alcohol-related Cancer Risk (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The key research topics in this grant call focus on interdisciplinary approaches to raise awareness of the link between alcohol consumption and cancer risk, as well as understanding and altering social norms surrounding alcohol use. It emphasizes the development and evaluation of alcohol policy strategies and population-level interventions aimed at reducing alcohol-related cancer risk, particularly concerning various levels of consumption and alcohol use disorder (AUD) in the context of cancer prevention and control.

title: Assay Development and Screening for Discovery of Validated Chemical Hits for Brain Disorders (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics of this funding opportunity focus on the discovery and development of novel small molecules for potential use in treating psychiatric disorders. Additionally, it aims to generate new insights into the biology of diseases and processes that may serve as important drug targets but have not yet been validated.

title: Engineering Next-Generation Human Nervous System Microphysiological Systems (R01 Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development of next-generation human cell-derived microphysiological systems (MPS) that accurately replicate complex nervous system architectures and physiology. The research aims to enhance the understanding of nervous system development, function, and aging in both healthy and diseased states.

title: Engineering Next-Generation Human Nervous System Microphysiological Systems (R21 Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant opportunity focuses on the development of next-generation human cell-derived microphysiological systems (MPS) that accurately replicate complex nervous system architectures and physiology. The research aims to enhance the understanding of nervous system development, function, and aging in both healthy and diseased states.

title: Academic-Industrial Partnerships (AIP) to Translate and Validate In Vivo Imaging Systems (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is focusing on the translation of scientific discoveries and engineering advancements in imaging, data science, and spectroscopic technologies. The aim is to develop methods or tools that enhance the understanding of cancer biology, assess disease risk, improve diagnosis, treatment, and monitor disease status.

title: Modular R01s in Cancer Control and Population Sciences (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on advancing cancer research through innovative scientific ideas in several key areas, including statistical and analytic methods, epidemiology, cancer survivorship, cancer-related behaviors and interventions, healthcare delivery, digital health, data science, and implementation science. The aim is to enhance cancer control and population sciences.

title: Laboratories to Optimize Digital Health (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: NIMH is seeking innovative research projects focused on enhancing digital mental health interventions. Key areas of interest include the development of digital health test beds, optimization of evidence-based interventions, and conducting statistically powered clinical trials to evaluate the effectiveness of these digital mental health solutions.

title: Exploratory Grants in Cancer Control (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on exploratory research in cancer control, emphasizing behavior modification, screening methods, and the understanding of factors that contribute to cancer development. It aims to support innovative scientific ideas and methodologies that could significantly advance population-based cancer research across various fields, including epidemiology, biomedical research, behavioral studies, health care delivery, and clinical applications.

title: National Cancer Institute's Investigator-Initiated Early Phase Clinical Trials for Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking research projects that focus on early phase clinical trials (Phase 0, I, and II) for cancer-targeted diagnostic and therapeutic interventions. Key research topics include cancer therapy evaluation, cancer imaging, cancer diagnosis, radiation research, complementary and alternative medicine, and HIV and AIDS malignancies. Projects must involve at least one clinical trial aligned with these scientific focus areas.

title: Cancer Prevention and Control Clinical Trials Grant Program (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking applications for investigator-initiated clinical trials focused on reducing cancer burden through advancements in early detection, screening, prevention, healthcare delivery, quality of life, and survivorship. The trials should aim to enhance clinical practice and public health, while specifically excluding studies related to cancer diagnosis or oncologic therapy. Proposed projects should align with the interests of the NCI Division of Cancer Prevention and the Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences.

title: Technology Development Research for Establishing Feasibility and Proof of Concept (R21 - Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on exploratory research aimed at developing innovative technologies that align with the NIGMS mission. It emphasizes projects characterized by high risk and novelty, with the potential for significant future impact in the field of biomedical research.

title: Focused Technology Research and Development (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity emphasizes the development of innovative technologies aimed at enhancing the acquisition of biomedical knowledge. Projects should demonstrate significant technical advancements and practical applications that can address a wide array of biomedical research questions.

title: Developing novel theory and methods for understanding the genetic architecture of complex human traits (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development of innovative theories and methods to enhance the understanding of genetic and non-genetic influences on complex trait variation among individuals, families, and populations. It encourages interdisciplinary approaches that integrate insights from natural and social sciences, while emphasizing the importance of modeling, validation, and the use of large-scale datasets.

title: BRAIN Initiative: Development and Validation of Novel Tools to Probe Cell-Specific and Circuit-Specific Processes in the Brain (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The BRAIN Initiative seeks applications focused on developing and validating innovative tools for analyzing complex neural circuits and cellular interactions in the brain. Emphasis is placed on creating genetic and non-genetic methods for precise targeting of specific cell types and circuits, as well as tools applicable across multiple species. Proposals that address and overcome current technical limitations to enhance research capabilities are particularly encouraged.

title: Developing novel theory and methods for understanding the genetic architecture of complex human traits (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This NOFO focuses on the development of innovative theories and methods to understand the contributions of genetic and non-genetic factors to complex trait variation in individuals, families, and populations. It encourages interdisciplinary approaches that integrate natural and social sciences, consider interdependencies across various biological, social, and ecological scales, and utilize theory, simulations, and large-scale dataset validation.

title: Development of Animal Models and Related Biological Materials for Research (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on innovative research to develop and enhance animal models and related biological materials for studies pertinent to human health and disease. It emphasizes projects that improve disease diagnosis and control affecting animal use in biomedical research, with a requirement for broad applicability across multiple NIH Institutes or Centers and exploration of various body systems or disease categories.

title: NICHD Small Research Grant Program (R03 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The NICHD Small Research Grant Program focuses on supporting clinical trials that align with the mission of the National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD). Key research topics include child health, human development, and related clinical interventions.

title: NICHD Small Research Grant Program (R03 Basic Experimental Studies with Humans Required)
summary_text: The NICHD Small Research Grant Program (R03) focuses on basic experimental studies involving human participants, particularly those that prospectively assign individuals to conditions to experimentally manipulate independent variables. The program supports clinical trials aimed at understanding fundamental biomedical or behavioral phenomena without immediate application towards specific processes or products.

title: Small Research Grant Program for the Next Generation of Researchers in AD/ADRD Research (R03 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on supporting research projects aimed at enhancing the prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and care of individuals with Alzheimer's disease and related dementias (AD/ADRD). It encourages both emerging and established researchers to explore innovative approaches and pilot studies in the field of AD/ADRD.

title: Enhancing Reuse of NHGRI Data Assets (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on supporting secondary analysis of AnVIL datasets to enhance their utilization for small research projects. It aims to demonstrate the value of NHGRI datasets for secondary research and assess the effectiveness of the AnVIL platform in facilitating further scientific discovery.

title: Schizophrenia and related disorders during mid- to late-life (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This initiative focuses on advancing translational research to understand the emergence and progression of schizophrenia and related disorders in individuals aged 35 and older. It aims to identify underlying mechanisms and potential targets for future prevention and treatment strategies.

title: Cellular and Molecular Biology of Complex Brain Disorders (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on researching the biology of high-confidence risk factors associated with complex brain disorders, emphasizing intracellular, transcellular, and circuit mechanisms of neural function. It encourages studies that explore the neurobiological impacts of individual or combined risk factors, aiming to elucidate molecular and cellular components and their relationships within biological processes. The research should contribute to data resources that enhance understanding of disease mechanisms and therapeutic targets, without attempting to model the disorders themselves.

title: Schizophrenia and related disorders during mid- to late-life (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This initiative focuses on advancing translational research to understand the emergence and progression of schizophrenia and related disorders in individuals aged 35 and older. It aims to identify underlying mechanisms and potential targets for future prevention and treatment strategies.

title: Cellular and Molecular Biology of Complex Brain Disorders (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on researching the biology of high-confidence risk factors linked to complex brain disorders, emphasizing the intracellular, transcellular, and circuit mechanisms underlying neural function. It encourages studies that explore the neurobiological impacts of individual or combined risk factors, aiming to elucidate the molecular and cellular components involved, rather than modeling the disorders themselves. The research should contribute to data resources that enhance understanding of the relationship between disease risk factors, biological mechanisms, and potential therapeutic targets.

title: Limited Competition: Small Grant Program for ORIP Special Emphasis Research Career Award (SERCA) K01 Recipients (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on supporting research projects for ORIP-supported Special Emphasis Research Career Award (SERCA) K01 recipients transitioning to independent investigator status. Key research topics include pilot and feasibility studies, secondary data analysis, small self-contained research projects, development of research methodologies, and new research technologies, with an emphasis on projects that can be completed within two years and do not involve clinical trials.

title: Translational Research in Maternal and Pediatric Pharmacology and Therapeutics (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on advancing precision medicine for pregnant and lactating women, neonates, and children by developing novel tools and technologies. The scientific areas of interest include understanding drug action mechanisms, particularly in relation to pediatric development and physiological changes during pregnancy and lactation, as well as discovering new therapeutics and optimizing existing medications for safer use in these populations.

title: Translational Research in Maternal and Pediatric Pharmacology and Therapeutics (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on advancing precision medicine for pregnant and lactating women, neonates, and children by developing novel tools and technologies. The scientific focus areas include understanding drug action mechanisms, particularly in relation to pediatric development and physiological changes during pregnancy and lactation, as well as discovering new therapeutics and improving existing medications for safer use in these populations.

title: Advancement and Innovation in Measurement of Language Development and Predictors (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on community-engaged research aimed at enhancing the understanding of environmental factors that support language development in children. It emphasizes the creation of innovative, culturally and linguistically responsive measures to assess children's language development and impairment, as well as the identification of predictors related to these areas.

title: Advancement and Innovation in Measurement of Language Development and Predictors (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity emphasizes community-engaged research aimed at expanding the understanding of environmental factors that support language development in children. It focuses on developing innovative, culturally and linguistically responsive measures to enhance the assessment of children's language development and impairment, as well as identifying predictors of these outcomes.

title: Social disconnection and Suicide Risk in Late Life (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This initiative focuses on research exploring the relationship between social disconnection, including both objective social isolation and perceived loneliness, and suicide risk in older adults. Key areas of interest include identifying neurobiological and environmental mechanisms that contribute to this risk, employing experimental therapeutics to develop and test interventions, and enhancing service delivery models to improve social connections and prevent late-life suicide.

title: Novel Mechanism Research on Neuropsychiatric Symptoms (NPS) in Alzheimer's Dementia (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at understanding the mechanisms underlying neuropsychiatric symptoms (NPS) in Alzheimer's disease (AD) and Alzheimer's disease-related dementias (ADRD). It emphasizes the exploration of both biobehavioral and neurobiological pathways associated with NPS, with the goal of identifying novel therapeutic targets for interventions to treat and prevent these symptoms.

title: Social disconnection and Suicide Risk in Late Life (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This initiative focuses on research exploring the relationship between social disconnection, including both objective social isolation and perceived loneliness, and suicide risk in late-life. Key areas of interest include identifying neurobiological and environmental mechanisms that contribute to suicidal thoughts and behaviors, employing experimental therapeutics to develop and test interventions, and enhancing service delivery models to improve social connections and prevent suicide among older adults.

title: Basic Research in Cancer Health Disparities (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant opportunity focuses on basic, mechanistic research into the biological and genetic causes of cancer health disparities. Key research topics include investigating biological factors related to cancer disparities, developing new methodologies and models, and conducting secondary data analyses. The initiative aims to foster a nationwide cohort of scientists with expertise in this area to enhance resources and tools for cancer health disparities research.

title: Basic Research in Cancer Health Disparities (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant opportunity focuses on basic, mechanistic research into the biological and genetic causes of cancer health disparities. Key research topics include investigating biological factors associated with these disparities, developing and testing new methodologies and models, and conducting secondary data analyses. The initiative aims to foster a nationwide cohort of scientists with expertise in cancer health disparities research, enhancing resources and tools for further studies.

title: Investigator Initiated Innovation in Computational Genomics and Data Science (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research in computational genomics, data science, statistics, and bioinformatics, aimed at advancing both basic and clinical genomic science with implications for human health and disease. Key areas include the development of innovative analytical methodologies, early-stage tools and software, and enhancements to existing high-value tools for the biomedical genomics community, with an emphasis on scalability to handle larger datasets across various diseases and biological systems.

title: Investigator Initiated Innovation in Computational Genomics and Data Science (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research in computational genomics, data science, statistics, and bioinformatics, aimed at advancing both basic and clinical genomic science with implications for human health and disease. It encourages the development of innovative analytical methodologies, tools, and software that are broadly applicable across various diseases and biological systems, with an emphasis on scalability to handle larger data sets.

title: Secondary Analysis and Integration of Existing Data to Elucidate Cancer Risk and Related Outcomes (R21 Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics for this funding opportunity focus on secondary data analysis and integration of existing datasets to investigate cancer risk and related outcomes, such as risk prediction, survival, and treatment response. The initiative encourages innovative analyses of diverse data types, including clinical, environmental, genomic, and behavioral data, to address significant scientific questions in cancer research.

title: Secondary Analysis and Integration of Existing Data to Elucidate Cancer Risk and Related Outcomes (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics for this funding opportunity focus on secondary data analysis and integration of existing datasets to investigate cancer risk and related outcomes, such as risk prediction, survival, and treatment response. The initiative encourages innovative analyses of diverse data types, including clinical, environmental, genomic, and behavioral data, to address significant scientific questions in cancer research.

title: NCMRR Early Career Research Award (R03 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The NCMRR Early Career Research Award focuses on supporting basic and clinical research in rehabilitation science. Key research topics include secondary data analysis, small-scale research projects, development of research methodologies, translational research, outcomes research, and the creation of new technologies aimed at enhancing rehabilitation practices.

title: NIDCR Small Grant Program for New Investigators (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NIDCR Small Grant Program for New Investigators focuses on supporting basic and clinical research in oral, dental, and craniofacial fields. It aims to facilitate pilot studies and developmental projects that generate preliminary data for future research grant applications.

title: Novel Mechanism Research on Neuropsychiatric Symptoms (NPS) in Alzheimer's Dementia (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at understanding the mechanisms underlying neuropsychiatric symptoms (NPS) in Alzheimer's disease (AD) and Alzheimerâ€™s disease-related dementias (ADRD). It emphasizes the exploration of both biobehavioral and neurobiological pathways, with the goal of identifying novel therapeutic targets for interventions to treat and prevent NPS in these conditions.

title: Mechanisms that Impact Cancer Risk with Use of Incretin Mimetics (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on the mechanisms by which incretin mimetics, including GLP-1 and GIP-1 agonists or antagonists, influence cancer risk. The emphasis is on preclinical and patient-based studies that explore the long-term effects of these agents on obesity-related cancers, rather than their short-term outcomes like weight loss and diabetes.

title: Mechanisms that Impact Cancer Risk with Use of Incretin Mimetics (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on preclinical and patient-based studies investigating the mechanisms by which incretin mimetics (GLP-1, GIP-1, and dual agents) affect cancer risk. The emphasis is on understanding the long-term impacts of these agents on obesity-related cancers, rather than their short-term effects on weight loss and diabetes.

title: NIDCR Research Grants for Analyses of Existing Genomics Data (R01) (Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on research projects that utilize genomic data to explore human dental, oral, and craniofacial biology, as well as related diseases and conditions. Key areas of interest include the development and application of statistical, computational, and AI/ML methods for data analysis, validation of results through experimental or in silico work, and investigations into oral health disparities and biological pathways to identify intervention targets.

title: NIDCR Small Research Grants for Analyses of Existing Genomics Data (R03 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on research projects that utilize genomic data to explore human dental, oral, and craniofacial biology, as well as related diseases and conditions. Key areas of interest include the development and application of statistical, computational, and AI/ML methods for data analysis, validation of results, and understanding oral health disparities. Additionally, projects aimed at characterizing biological pathways and identifying intervention targets related to genetic variants are encouraged.

title: Chemical Countermeasures Research Program (CCRP) Initiative: Basic Research on The Deleterious Effects of Acute Exposure to Ultra-Potent Synthetic (UPS) Opioids (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at understanding and mitigating the harmful effects of acute exposure to Ultra-Potent Synthetic (UPS) opioids, including fentanyl, carfentanil, and nitazenes, as well as their combinations with other substances like xylazine. Additionally, it supports investigations into the persistent and delayed pathophysiological effects following such acute exposures.

title: Co-infection and Cancer (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on mechanistic and epidemiologic research into the roles of co-infection and cancer, particularly how they contribute to carcinogenesis. It emphasizes studies involving co-infections with known oncogenic agents, excluding HIV, and seeks to identify novel prevention and treatment strategies for infection-related cancers.

title: Co-infection and Cancer (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This initiative focuses on advancing the understanding of infection-related cancers, particularly the role of co-infections in cancer etiology. It emphasizes the investigation of co-infections (excluding HIV) that present new opportunities for prevention and treatment, especially in understudied populations, and encompasses various infectious agents, including viruses, bacteria, and parasites.

title: Personal Health Informatics for Delivering Actionable Insights to Individuals (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on advancing personal health informatics through innovative data collection, integration, and analysis methods that provide actionable health insights to individuals. Key research topics include the development of personalized risk assessments, the effective presentation of assessment results, and the design of scalable informatics tools that engage end users and incorporate real-world evaluations.

title: Innovative Research in Cancer Nanotechnology (IRCN; R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) is seeking research proposals that leverage nanotechnology to address significant challenges in cancer biology and oncology. Key focus areas include mechanistic studies of nanomaterial and nanodevice interactions with biological systems, as well as the delivery of nanoparticles and nano-devices to specific cancer targets in vivo, and the characterization of detection and diagnostic devices in vitro. The goal is to generate fundamental knowledge that will inform the development of nanotechnology-based cancer interventions.

title: Screening, Brief Intervention and Referral to Treatment or Prevention (SBIRT/P) for alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs (ATOD) use and misuse in adult populations that experience health disparities (R01, Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on innovative approaches to implementing Screening, Brief Intervention, and Referral to Treatment/Prevention (SBIRT/P) for addressing alcohol, tobacco, and other drug (ATOD) use and misuse among adult populations facing health disparities. Research proposals should involve prospective testing of SBIRT/P methodologies and emphasize collaboration with healthcare and community partners.

title: NCCIH Multi-Site Feasibility Clinical Trials of Mind and Body Interventions (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on investigator-initiated clinical trials of complementary and integrative health approaches, particularly mind and body interventions. Key research topics include assessing the feasibility of multisite trials, participant recruitment and retention, adherence to interventions, and the fidelity of intervention delivery across sites, all aimed at preparing for future efficacy or effectiveness studies. The goal is to gather necessary data to address gaps in scientific knowledge and support the design of impactful clinical trials in the field of complementary health.

title: Investigator Initiated Clinical Trials of Complementary and Integrative Interventions Delivered Remotely or via mHealth (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on investigator-initiated clinical trials that assess the efficacy or effectiveness of complementary and integrative health interventions delivered entirely remotely, without in-person contact. Key research topics include the use of mHealth tools and technologies, as well as the necessity for preliminary data demonstrating the feasibility, safety, and potential clinical benefits of the proposed interventions.

title: Neuromodulation/Neurostimulation Device Development for Mental Health Applications (R01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the development of next-generation brain stimulation devices aimed at treating mental health disorders. Key research topics include the creation of novel stimulation techniques that surpass current electrical and magnetic methods, as well as significant enhancements to existing FDA-approved devices in terms of spatial resolution, depth of delivery, and precision. The emphasis is on innovative approaches that enable increased spatiotemporal precision and multi-focal, closed-loop systems.

title: Neuromodulation/Neurostimulation Device Development for Mental Health Applications (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on the development of next-generation brain stimulation devices aimed at treating mental health disorders. Key research topics include the creation of novel stimulation techniques that surpass current electrical/magnetic methods, as well as significant enhancements to existing FDA-approved devices in terms of spatial resolution, depth of delivery, and precision. Collaborative applications from multidisciplinary teams with expertise in systems neuroscience, engineering, clinical, and regulatory affairs are encouraged.

title: Feasibility Clinical Trials of Mind and Body Interventions for NCCIH High Priority Research Topics (R34 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on supporting feasibility trials of complementary and integrative health approaches, particularly mind and body interventions, for high-priority conditions identified by NCCIH. Key research topics include assessing the feasibility and acceptability of interventions, tailoring interventions for specific populations, refining intervention protocols, and evaluating recruitment and retention strategies, all aimed at informing future full-scale clinical trials that could significantly impact public health.

title: Understanding Expectancies in Cancer Symptom Management (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on researching expectancy-generating factors and their impact on cancer symptom management outcomes. It aims to explore the mechanisms behind expectancy effects in cancer contexts, identify moderators of these effects, and determine how expectancies can be utilized to enhance cancer treatment outcomes across various patient demographics and symptomatology.

title: Advancing Learning Health Care Research in Outpatient Mental Health Treatment Settings (R34 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on pilot studies that enhance data-driven learning in behavioral health treatment, specifically targeting the implementation and sustainability of evidence-based mental health services in community settings. Key research topics include the effectiveness of these practices, data science applications, and the optimization of high-quality, equitable care for individuals with mental illness.

title: Catalyze: Product Definition for Small Molecules, Biologics and Combination Products - Target Identification and Validation, and Preliminary Product/Lead Series Identification (R61/R33  Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NHLBI Catalyze Program focuses on transitioning basic science discoveries into viable diagnostic and therapeutic candidates for human testing, particularly targeting heart, lung, blood, and sleep (HLBS) diseases and disorders. The Catalyze Product Definition initiative emphasizes early-stage translational support for identifying and characterizing potential therapeutic candidates and combination products, alongside a companion initiative for developing devices and diagnostics.

title: BRAIN Initiative: Promoting Health for All Through BRAIN Technology Partnerships (R34 - Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: The key research topics focus on enhancing the dissemination and integration of BRAIN Initiative tools in resource-limited institutions (RLIs) through partnerships between principal investigators (PIs) and BRAIN technologists. The initiative aims to facilitate training, promote knowledge transfer, and increase participation in BRAIN Initiative-related research among PIs at these institutions.

title: Catalyze: Enabling Technologies and Transformative Platforms for HLBS Research (R33 - Clinical Trials Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NHLBI Catalyze Program focuses on advancing basic science discoveries into diagnostic and therapeutic candidates for human testing, emphasizing the development of translational researchers skilled in product development. The initiative specifically supports the validation of transformative technologies that can enhance early detection, screening, clinical diagnosis, treatment, prevention, and epidemiology related to heart, lung, blood, and sleep (HLBS) diseases.

title: Mood and Psychosis Symptoms during the Menopause Transition (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on advancing translational research to understand mood and psychotic disorders, such as perimenopausal depression, generalized anxiety disorder, bipolar disorder, and schizophrenia, during the menopause transition. Key research topics include the neurobiological and behavioral mechanisms of these disorders, the impact of reproductive steroids, the interplay between menopausal and psychiatric symptoms, and the role of psychosocial factors in midlife. The initiative encourages interdisciplinary collaboration to explore these areas and aims to identify targets for novel treatment interventions.

title: Catalyze: Product Definition  Medical Device Prototype Optimization (R33 - Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NHLBI Catalyze Program focuses on facilitating the transition of basic science discoveries into viable diagnostic and therapeutic candidates for human testing, with an emphasis on developing translational researchers skilled in product development. The specific Catalyze Product Definition initiative targets early-stage translational support for prototype testing, assay development for diagnostic targets, and the creation of research tools for treating heart, lung, blood, and sleep (HLBS) diseases and disorders. This initiative aims to prepare products for in vivo testing, with potential for further support from NIH and other funding sources.

title: Mood and Psychosis Symptoms during the Menopause Transition (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on advancing translational research to understand mood and psychotic disorders, such as perimenopausal depression, generalized anxiety disorder, bipolar disorder, and schizophrenia, during the menopause transition. Key research topics include the neurobiological and behavioral mechanisms of these disorders, the impact of reproductive steroids, the interplay between menopausal and psychiatric symptoms, and the role of psychosocial factors in midlife. The initiative encourages interdisciplinary collaboration to identify novel treatment targets and improve diagnosis and understanding of these conditions.

title: Catalyze: Product Definition for Small Molecules, Biologics, and Combination Products - Preliminary Product/Lead Series Identification and Combination Product Prototype (R33 - Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NHLBI Catalyze Program focuses on transitioning basic science discoveries into viable diagnostic and therapeutic candidates for human testing, particularly targeting heart, lung, blood, and sleep (HLBS) diseases and disorders. The Catalyze Product Definition initiative emphasizes early-stage translational support for identifying and characterizing potential therapeutic candidates and combination products, alongside a companion initiative for developing devices and diagnostics.

title: Catalyze Product Definition  Medical Device prototype design/testing and disease target identification and assay development (R61/R33 - Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The NHLBI Catalyze Program focuses on the transition of basic science discoveries into viable diagnostic and therapeutic candidates for human testing, specifically targeting heart, lung, blood, and sleep (HLBS) diseases. Key research topics include the development and testing of device prototypes, identification of diagnostic disease targets and associated assays, and the creation of research tools for HLBS disorders. The initiative is structured in phases to support early-stage projects, emphasizing prototype design, experimental planning, and the refinement of diagnostic products and research tools.

title: Utilizing Invasive Recording and Stimulating Opportunities in Humans to Advance Neural Circuitry Understanding of Mental Health Disorders (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on invasive neural recording studies aimed at understanding the neural circuitry and dynamics associated with mental health disorders. Researchers are encouraged to investigate specific questions related to moods, emotions, cognitive functions, and behaviors, utilizing high-resolution recording techniques to explore neural circuit functions. The emphasis is on addressing gaps in knowledge rather than developing new technologies or therapies.

title: Utilizing Invasive Recording and Stimulating Opportunities in Humans to Advance Neural Circuitry Understanding of Mental Health Disorders (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on invasive neural recording studies that investigate the neural circuitry and dynamics associated with mental health disorders. Researchers are encouraged to explore complex moods, emotions, cognitive functions, and behaviors, utilizing high spatial and temporal resolution to understand neural circuit functions. The emphasis is on addressing specific mental health-related questions rather than developing new technologies or therapies.

title: Prevention and Intervention Approaches for Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity emphasizes research on prevention and intervention strategies for fetal alcohol spectrum disorders (FASD) across the lifespan. Key focus areas include developing approaches to reduce prenatal alcohol exposure and implementing interventions for individuals affected by FASD, with a particular priority on clinical trials.

title: NLM Research Grants in Biomedical Informatics and Data Science (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The National Library of Medicine (NLM) is focused on supporting innovative research in biomedical informatics and data science, particularly in areas that enhance biomedical discovery and data-driven health. Key topics include the development of new methods for integrating complex research outputs, fostering scalable and reproducible approaches to data management, and improving clinical care and public health practices through advanced data analysis and organization.

title: Navigator Emergency Department Diversion Models for Non-Urgent Mental Health Concerns (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on researching the effectiveness and implementation of family navigation models aimed at diverting non-urgent mental health cases from emergency departments. Key areas of interest include the use of triage tools for assessing mental health acuity, enhancing family engagement in mental health services, and addressing barriers to help-seeking through support and knowledge dissemination.

title: New Approaches for Measuring Brain Changes Across Longer Timespans (R21 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on innovative research approaches to measure brain activity, connectivity, and genomics across the lifespan, with an emphasis on understanding brain development and aging. Key areas of interest include the neurodevelopmental origins of health and disease, longitudinal studies of neuroanatomical and functional changes, and the exploration of these topics in both human participants and animal models. The initiative encourages multidisciplinary collaboration and aims to foster technological and conceptual advancements in the field.

title: Prevention and Intervention Approaches for Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (R34 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on research aimed at developing prevention strategies to reduce prenatal alcohol exposure and the incidence of fetal alcohol spectrum disorders (FASD), as well as interventions for individuals affected by FASD. The goal is to support studies that will lay the groundwork for larger-scale research in these areas.

title: The Role of Work in Health Disparities in the U.S. (R01 Clinical Trials Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on innovative population-based research aimed at understanding how work and occupation impact health outcomes and health status, particularly among populations experiencing health and healthcare disparities. Key research topics include identifying and characterizing the pathways and mechanisms linking occupational factors to health disparities.

title: New Approaches for Measuring Brain Changes Across Longer Timespans (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: This funding opportunity focuses on multidisciplinary research aimed at measuring brain activity, connectivity, and genomics throughout the lifespan, with an emphasis on understanding brain development and aging. Key areas of interest include the neurodevelopmental origins of health and disease, longitudinal changes in neuroanatomy and function, and innovative approaches to improve repeated measures over time. Research may involve healthy individuals, clinical populations with cognitive or motor challenges, and animal studies.

title: Development of Animal Models and Related Biological Materials for Down Syndrome Research (R21 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)
summary_text: The INCLUDE Project focuses on developing and improving animal models and biological materials for Down syndrome research. Key research topics include the creation of various animal models, genetic resources, single-cell atlases, and the application of advanced informatics technologies such as artificial intelligence and machine learning to enhance the rigor and reproducibility of preclinical studies related to Down syndrome.

title: HIV Prevention and Alcohol (R01 Clinical Trials Optional)
summary_text: The grant call focuses on expanding HIV/AIDS prevention strategies among alcohol-impacted populations, emphasizing the integration of effective prevention and treatment interventions. Key research topics include PrEP utilization, Treatment as Prevention (TasP), integration of preventive strategies, cross-cutting research related to prevention, syndemic approaches, and implementation and operations research.

title: HIV Prevention and Alcohol (R34 Clinical Trials Optional)
summary_text: The NOFO focuses on expanding HIV/AIDS prevention strategies specifically for alcohol-impacted populations, addressing both episodic and long-term use and their associated risks for HIV acquisition. It emphasizes the integration of effective prevention and treatment interventions, aiming to inform the design of clinical trials that test the efficacy, safety, and implementation of these interventions in preventing HIV. The research should provide sufficient data to support the planning of future trials without the need for additional studies.

title: Navigator Emergency Department Diversion Models for Non-Urgent Mental Health Concerns (R34 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on researching the effectiveness and implementation of family navigation models aimed at diverting non-urgent mental health cases from emergency departments. Key areas of interest include the use of triage tools for assessing mental health acuity, enhancing family engagement in mental health services, and addressing barriers to help-seeking through support and knowledge dissemination.

title: Full-Scale Hybrid Effectiveness-Implementation Trials for Mental Health Interventions (R01 - Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on clinical trials aimed at testing the effectiveness of therapeutic and preventive interventions in mental health settings, as well as evaluating services interventions that enhance access, quality, and equity of mental health services. It emphasizes the need for trials to address significant problems, be adequately powered, and explore mediators and moderators of intervention effects, while also aligning with the NIMH's experimental therapeutics approach to understand the mechanisms underlying these effects. Additionally, it supports multisite trials to enhance sample diversity and representation.

title: Confirmatory Efficacy Clinical Trials of Non-Pharmacological and Pharmacological Interventions for Mental Disorders (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on confirmatory efficacy clinical trials for non-pharmacological interventions aimed at treating mental disorders in both adults and children. It emphasizes the need for these interventions to address unmet therapeutic needs and aligns with the NIMH's experimental therapeutics approach, which seeks to enhance understanding of the relationship between disease processes and the mechanisms through which interventions effect therapeutic change.

title: Pilot Hybrid Effectiveness-Implementation Trials for Mental Health Interventions (R01  Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on pilot effectiveness studies aimed at optimizing preventive and therapeutic interventions with established efficacy for broader populations and community settings. It also encourages the development and preliminary testing of innovative service interventions, emphasizing the need to investigate the underlying mechanisms that drive changes in clinical outcomes, provider behavior, and service access.

title: Early Stage Testing of Pharmacologic or Neuromodulatory Device-based Interventions for the Treatment of Mental Disorders (R33- Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The NIMH grant call focuses on experimental therapeutics for developing and testing therapeutic interventions, emphasizing the evaluation of clinical effects alongside the investigation of underlying mechanisms of disorders or responses to interventions. It encourages early-stage testing of pharmacologic interventions with novel mechanisms and device-based interventions, requiring studies to adequately test the presumed mechanisms of action to yield meaningful neurophysiological, clinical, or behavioral effects.

title: Development of Psychosocial Therapeutic and Preventive Interventions for Mental Disorders (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development and testing of novel psychosocial therapeutic and preventive interventions for mental disorders. It emphasizes the translation of research in basic, behavioral, cognitive, affective, and neuropsychological sciences into effective interventions, aiming to evaluate target engagement and clinical outcomes through a structured experimental therapeutics approach.

title: Development of Psychosocial Therapeutic and Preventive Interventions for Mental Disorders (R33 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: This grant call focuses on the development and testing of novel psychosocial therapeutic and preventive interventions for mental disorders. It emphasizes the translation of research from basic and behavioral sciences into effective interventions, aiming to replicate target engagement from previous studies and assess its impact on clinical outcomes.

title: Alcohol Health Services Research (R34 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism is seeking research proposals that address key areas related to alcohol use disorder (AUD). The focus areas include increasing access to treatment, enhancing the appeal of treatment options, analyzing cost structures and insurance systems, studying the dissemination and implementation of evidence-based treatment approaches, and reducing health disparities in treatment access for affected populations.

title: Early Stage Testing of Pharmacologic or Neuromodulatory Device-based Interventions for the Treatment of Mental Disorders (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The NIMH grant call focuses on experimental therapeutics for developing and testing therapeutic interventions, emphasizing the evaluation of clinical effects alongside the investigation of underlying mechanisms of disorders or responses to interventions. It encourages early-stage testing of pharmacologic interventions with novel mechanisms and device-based interventions, requiring studies to adequately test the presumed mechanisms of action to yield meaningful neurophysiological, clinical, or behavioral effects.

title: Effectiveness Trials to Test Mental Health System Interventions (R61/R33 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The key research topics for this grant call focus on the development and testing of system interventions aimed at improving mental health services. This includes exploring structural, policy, organizational, and interpersonal strategies to enhance access, equity, engagement, and quality of care across various settings such as health systems, community clinics, schools, and juvenile justice systems. The ultimate goal is to improve clinical and functional outcomes for individuals receiving mental health services.

title: Alcohol Treatment, Pharmacotherapy, and Recovery Research (R34 Clinical Trial required)
summary_text: The grant call emphasizes research on improving alcohol health services, specifically targeting the treatment gap for individuals with alcohol use disorder (AUD). Key focus areas include increasing access to treatment, enhancing the appeal of treatment options, analyzing cost structures and insurance systems, studying the dissemination and implementation of evidence-based treatment approaches, and addressing health disparities in treatment access for underserved populations.

title: Alcohol Health Services Research (R01 Clinical Trial Optional)
summary_text: The National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism is seeking research proposals that address alcohol health services, specifically targeting the treatment gap for individuals with alcohol use disorder (AUD). Key focus areas include enhancing access to AUD treatment, improving the appeal of treatment options, analyzing cost structures and insurance systems, studying the dissemination and implementation of evidence-based treatment approaches, and reducing health disparities among affected populations.

title: Alcohol Treatment, Pharmacotherapy, and Recovery Research (R01 Clinical Trial Required)
summary_text: The National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism is seeking research proposals that focus on the treatment and recovery from alcohol use disorder (AUD).
